42/*
43 * SHA1 Wikipedia Page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-1
44 *
45 * Copyright (c) 2012-22 SAURAV MOHAPATRA <mohaps@gmail.com>
46 *
47 * Permission to use, copy, modify, and distribute this software for any
48 * purpose with or without fee is hereby granted, provided that the above
49 * copyright notice and this permission notice appear in all copies.
50 *
51 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND THE AUTHOR DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES
52 * WITH REGARD TO THIS SOFTWARE INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
53 * MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR
54 * ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES
55 * WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN
56 * ACTION OF CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT OF
57 * OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.

70#ifndef _TINY_SHA1_HPP_
71#define _TINY_SHA1_HPP_
72#include <cstdio>
73#include <cstdlib>
74#include <cstring>
75#include <stdint.h>
76
81namespace sha1
82{
88 class SHA1
89 {
90 public:
91 typedef uint32_t digest32_t[5];
92 typedef uint8_t digest8_t[20];
93 inline static uint32_t LeftRotate(uint32_t value, size_t count) {
94 return (value << count) ^ (value >> (32-count));
95 }
96 SHA1(){ reset(); }
97 virtual ~SHA1() {}
98 SHA1(const SHA1& s) { *this = s; }
99 const SHA1& operator = (const SHA1& s) {
100 memcpy(m_digest, s.m_digest, 5 * sizeof(uint32_t));
101 memcpy(m_block, s.m_block, 64);
102 m_blockByteIndex = s.m_blockByteIndex;
103 m_byteCount = s.m_byteCount;
104 return *this;
105 }
106 SHA1& reset() {
107 m_digest[0] = 0x67452301;
108 m_digest[1] = 0xEFCDAB89;
109 m_digest[2] = 0x98BADCFE;
110 m_digest[3] = 0x10325476;
111 m_digest[4] = 0xC3D2E1F0;
112 m_blockByteIndex = 0;
113 m_byteCount = 0;
114 return *this;
115 }
116 SHA1& processByte(uint8_t octet) {
117 this->m_block[this->m_blockByteIndex++] = octet;
118 ++this->m_byteCount;
119 if(m_blockByteIndex == 64) {
120 this->m_blockByteIndex = 0;
121 processBlock();
122 }
123 return *this;
124 }
125 SHA1& processBlock(const void* const start, const void* const end) {
126 const uint8_t* begin = static_cast<const uint8_t*>(start);
127 const uint8_t* finish = static_cast<const uint8_t*>(end);
128 while(begin != finish) {
129 processByte(*begin);
130 begin++;
131 }
132 return *this;
133 }
134 SHA1& processBytes(const void* const data, size_t len) {
135 const uint8_t* block = static_cast<const uint8_t*>(data);
136 processBlock(block, block + len);
137 return *this;
138 }
139 const uint32_t* getDigest(digest32_t digest) {
140 size_t bitCount = this->m_byteCount * 8;
141 processByte(0x80);
142 if (this->m_blockByteIndex > 56) {
143 while (m_blockByteIndex != 0) {
144 processByte(0);
145 }
146 while (m_blockByteIndex < 56) {
147 processByte(0);
148 }
149 } else {
150 while (m_blockByteIndex < 56) {
151 processByte(0);
152 }
153 }
154 processByte(0);
155 processByte(0);
156 processByte(0);
157 processByte(0);
158 processByte( static_cast<unsigned char>((bitCount>>24) & 0xFF));
159 processByte( static_cast<unsigned char>((bitCount>>16) & 0xFF));
160 processByte( static_cast<unsigned char>((bitCount>>8 ) & 0xFF));
161 processByte( static_cast<unsigned char>((bitCount) & 0xFF));
162
163 memcpy(digest, m_digest, 5 * sizeof(uint32_t));
164 return digest;
165 }
166 const uint8_t* getDigestBytes(digest8_t digest) {
167 digest32_t d32;
168 getDigest(d32);
169 size_t di = 0;
170 digest[di++] = ((d32[0] >> 24) & 0xFF);
171 digest[di++] = ((d32[0] >> 16) & 0xFF);
172 digest[di++] = ((d32[0] >> 8) & 0xFF);
173 digest[di++] = ((d32[0]) & 0xFF);
174
175 digest[di++] = ((d32[1] >> 24) & 0xFF);
176 digest[di++] = ((d32[1] >> 16) & 0xFF);
177 digest[di++] = ((d32[1] >> 8) & 0xFF);
178 digest[di++] = ((d32[1]) & 0xFF);
179
180 digest[di++] = ((d32[2] >> 24) & 0xFF);
181 digest[di++] = ((d32[2] >> 16) & 0xFF);
182 digest[di++] = ((d32[2] >> 8) & 0xFF);
183 digest[di++] = ((d32[2]) & 0xFF);
184
185 digest[di++] = ((d32[3] >> 24) & 0xFF);
186 digest[di++] = ((d32[3] >> 16) & 0xFF);
187 digest[di++] = ((d32[3] >> 8) & 0xFF);
188 digest[di++] = ((d32[3]) & 0xFF);
189
190 digest[di++] = ((d32[4] >> 24) & 0xFF);
191 digest[di++] = ((d32[4] >> 16) & 0xFF);
192 digest[di++] = ((d32[4] >> 8) & 0xFF);
193 digest[di++] = ((d32[4]) & 0xFF);
194 return digest;
195 }
196
197 protected:
198 void processBlock() {
199 uint32_t w[80];
200 for (size_t i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
201 w[i] = (m_block[i*4 + 0] << 24);
202 w[i] |= (m_block[i*4 + 1] << 16);
203 w[i] |= (m_block[i*4 + 2] << 8);
204 w[i] |= (m_block[i*4 + 3]);
205 }
206 for (size_t i = 16; i < 80; i++) {
207 w[i] = LeftRotate((w[i-3] ^ w[i-8] ^ w[i-14] ^ w[i-16]), 1);
208 }
209
210 uint32_t a = m_digest[0];
211 uint32_t b = m_digest[1];
212 uint32_t c = m_digest[2];
213 uint32_t d = m_digest[3];
214 uint32_t e = m_digest[4];
215
216 for (std::size_t i=0; i<80; ++i) {
217 uint32_t f = 0;
218 uint32_t k = 0;
219
220 if (i<20) {
221 f = (b & c) | (~b & d);
222 k = 0x5A827999;
223 } else if (i<40) {
224 f = b ^ c ^ d;
225 k = 0x6ED9EBA1;
226 } else if (i<60) {
227 f = (b & c) | (b & d) | (c & d);
228 k = 0x8F1BBCDC;
229 } else {
230 f = b ^ c ^ d;
231 k = 0xCA62C1D6;
232 }
233 uint32_t temp = LeftRotate(a, 5) + f + e + k + w[i];
234 e = d;
235 d = c;
236 c = LeftRotate(b, 30);
237 b = a;
238 a = temp;
239 }
240
241 m_digest[0] += a;
242 m_digest[1] += b;
243 m_digest[2] += c;
244 m_digest[3] += d;
245 m_digest[4] += e;
246 }
247 private:
248 digest32_t m_digest;
249 uint8_t m_block[64];
250 size_t m_blockByteIndex;
251 size_t m_byteCount;
252 };
253}
254#endif

270 Debug = 0
271 Info = 1
272 Warning = 2
273 Error = 3
274 Critical = 4
275
276 default to INFO
277*/

317// TODO(EDev): Adding C++20's [[likely]] and [[unlikely]] attributes might be useful
318#if defined(__GNUG__) || defined(__clang__)
319#define CROW_LIKELY(X) __builtin_expect(!!(X), 1)
320#define CROW_UNLIKELY(X) __builtin_expect(!!(X), 0)
321#else
322#define CROW_LIKELY(X) (X)
323#define CROW_UNLIKELY(X) (X)
324#endif

326namespace crow
327{
329 namespace black_magic
330 {
331#ifndef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
333 struct OutOfRange
334 {
335 OutOfRange(unsigned /*pos*/, unsigned /*length*/) {}
336 };
338 constexpr unsigned requires_in_range(unsigned i, unsigned len)
339 {
340 return i >= len ? throw OutOfRange(i, len) : i;
341 }
342
344 class const_str
345 {
346 const char* const begin_;
347 unsigned size_;
348
349 public:
350 template<unsigned N>
351 constexpr const_str(const char (&arr)[N]):
352 begin_(arr), size_(N - 1)
353 {
354 static_assert(N >= 1, "not a string literal");
355 }
356 constexpr char operator[](unsigned i) const
357 {
358 return requires_in_range(i, size_), begin_[i];
359 }
360
361 constexpr operator const char*() const
362 {
363 return begin_;
364 }
365
366 constexpr const char* begin() const { return begin_; }
367 constexpr const char* end() const { return begin_ + size_; }
368
369 constexpr unsigned size() const
370 {
371 return size_;
372 }
373 };
374
375 constexpr unsigned find_closing_tag(const_str s, unsigned p)
376 {
377 return s[p] == '>' ? p : find_closing_tag(s, p + 1);
378 }
379
381 constexpr bool is_valid(const_str s, unsigned i = 0, int f = 0)
382 {
383 return i == s.size() ? f == 0 :
384 f < 0 || f >= 2 ? false :
385 s[i] == '<' ? is_valid(s, i + 1, f + 1) :
386 s[i] == '>' ? is_valid(s, i + 1, f - 1) :
387 is_valid(s, i + 1, f);
388 }
389
390 constexpr bool is_equ_p(const char* a, const char* b, unsigned n)
391 {
392 return *a == 0 && *b == 0 && n == 0 ? true :
393 (*a == 0 || *b == 0) ? false :
394 n == 0 ? true :
395 *a != *b ? false :
396 is_equ_p(a + 1, b + 1, n - 1);
397 }
398
399 constexpr bool is_equ_n(const_str a, unsigned ai, const_str b, unsigned bi, unsigned n)
400 {
401 return ai + n > a.size() || bi + n > b.size() ? false :
402 n == 0 ? true :
403 a[ai] != b[bi] ? false :
404 is_equ_n(a, ai + 1, b, bi + 1, n - 1);
405 }
406
407 constexpr bool is_int(const_str s, unsigned i)
408 {
409 return is_equ_n(s, i, "<int>", 0, 5);
410 }
411
412 constexpr bool is_uint(const_str s, unsigned i)
413 {
414 return is_equ_n(s, i, "<uint>", 0, 6);
415 }
416
417 constexpr bool is_float(const_str s, unsigned i)
418 {
419 return is_equ_n(s, i, "<float>", 0, 7) ||
420 is_equ_n(s, i, "<double>", 0, 8);
421 }
422
423 constexpr bool is_str(const_str s, unsigned i)
424 {
425 return is_equ_n(s, i, "<str>", 0, 5) ||
426 is_equ_n(s, i, "<string>", 0, 8);
427 }
428
429 constexpr bool is_path(const_str s, unsigned i)
430 {
431 return is_equ_n(s, i, "<path>", 0, 6);
432 }
433#endif
434 template<typename T>
435 struct parameter_tag
436 {
437 static const int value = 0;
438 };
439#define CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(t, i) \
440 template<> \
441 struct parameter_tag<t> \
442 { \
443 static const int value = i; \
444 }
445 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(int, 1);
446 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(char, 1);
447 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(short, 1);
448 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(long, 1);
449 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(long long, 1);
450 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned int, 2);
451 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned char, 2);
452 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned short, 2);
453 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned long, 2);
454 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(unsigned long long, 2);
455 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(double, 3);
456 CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG(std::string, 4);
457#undef CROW_INTERNAL_PARAMETER_TAG
458 template<typename... Args>
459 struct compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list;
460
461 template<>
462 struct compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list<>
463 {
464 static const int value = 0;
465 };
466
467 template<typename Arg, typename... Args>
468 struct compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list<Arg, Args...>
469 {
470 static const int sub_value =
471 compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list<Args...>::value;
472 static const int value =
473 parameter_tag<typename std::decay<Arg>::type>::value ? sub_value * 6 + parameter_tag<typename std::decay<Arg>::type>::value : sub_value;
474 };
475
476 static inline bool is_parameter_tag_compatible(uint64_t a, uint64_t b)
477 {
478 if (a == 0)
479 return b == 0;
480 if (b == 0)
481 return a == 0;
482 int sa = a % 6;
483 int sb = a % 6;
484 if (sa == 5) sa = 4;
485 if (sb == 5) sb = 4;
486 if (sa != sb)
487 return false;
488 return is_parameter_tag_compatible(a / 6, b / 6);
489 }
490
491 static inline unsigned find_closing_tag_runtime(const char* s, unsigned p)
492 {
493 return s[p] == 0 ? throw std::runtime_error("unmatched tag <") :
494 s[p] == '>' ? p :
495 find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p + 1);
496 }
497
498 static inline uint64_t get_parameter_tag_runtime(const char* s, unsigned p = 0)
499 {
500 return s[p] == 0 ? 0 :
501 s[p] == '<' ? (
502 std::strncmp(s + p, "<int>", 5) == 0 ? get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 1 :
503 std::strncmp(s + p, "<uint>", 6) == 0 ? get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 2 :
504 (std::strncmp(s + p, "<float>", 7) == 0 ||
505 std::strncmp(s + p, "<double>", 8) == 0) ?
506 get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 3 :
507 (std::strncmp(s + p, "<str>", 5) == 0 ||
508 std::strncmp(s + p, "<string>", 8) == 0) ?
509 get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 4 :
510 std::strncmp(s + p, "<path>", 6) == 0 ? get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, find_closing_tag_runtime(s, p)) * 6 + 5 :
511 throw std::runtime_error("invalid parameter type")) :
512 get_parameter_tag_runtime(s, p + 1);
513 }
514#ifndef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
515 constexpr uint64_t get_parameter_tag(const_str s, unsigned p = 0)
516 {
517 return p == s.size() ? 0 :
518 s[p] == '<' ? (
519 is_int(s, p) ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 1 :
520 is_uint(s, p) ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 2 :
521 is_float(s, p) ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 3 :
522 is_str(s, p) ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 4 :
523 is_path(s, p) ? get_parameter_tag(s, find_closing_tag(s, p)) * 6 + 5 :
524 throw std::runtime_error("invalid parameter type")) :
525 get_parameter_tag(s, p + 1);
526 }
527#endif
528
529 template<typename... T>
530 struct S
531 {
532 template<typename U>
533 using push = S<U, T...>;
534 template<typename U>
535 using push_back = S<T..., U>;
536 template<template<typename... Args> class U>
537 using rebind = U<T...>;
538 };
539
540 // Check whether the template function can be called with specific arguments
541 template<typename F, typename Set>
542 struct CallHelper;
543 template<typename F, typename... Args>
544 struct CallHelper<F, S<Args...>>
545 {
546 template<typename F1, typename... Args1, typename = decltype(std::declval<F1>()(std::declval<Args1>()...))>
547 static char __test(int);
548
549 template<typename...>
550 static int __test(...);
551
552 static constexpr bool value = sizeof(__test<F, Args...>(0)) == sizeof(char);
553 };
554
555 // Check Tuple contains type T
556 template<typename T, typename Tuple>
557 struct has_type;
558
559 template<typename T>
560 struct has_type<T, std::tuple<>> : std::false_type
561 {};
562
563 template<typename T, typename U, typename... Ts>
564 struct has_type<T, std::tuple<U, Ts...>> : has_type<T, std::tuple<Ts...>>
565 {};
566
567 template<typename T, typename... Ts>
568 struct has_type<T, std::tuple<T, Ts...>> : std::true_type
569 {};
570
571 // Find index of type in tuple
572 template<class T, class Tuple>
573 struct tuple_index;
574
575 template<class T, class... Types>
576 struct tuple_index<T, std::tuple<T, Types...>>
577 {
578 static const int value = 0;
579 };
580
581 template<class T, class U, class... Types>
582 struct tuple_index<T, std::tuple<U, Types...>>
583 {
584 static const int value = 1 + tuple_index<T, std::tuple<Types...>>::value;
585 };
586
587 // Extract element from forward tuple or get default
588 template<typename T, typename Tup>
589 typename std::enable_if<has_type<T&, Tup>::value, typename std::decay<T>::type&&>::type
590 tuple_extract(Tup& tup)
591 {
592 return std::move(std::get<T&>(tup));
593 }
594
595 template<typename T, typename Tup>
596 typename std::enable_if<!has_type<T&, Tup>::value, T>::type
597 tuple_extract(Tup&)
598 {
599 return T{};
600 }
601
602 // Kind of fold expressions in C++11
603 template<bool...>
604 struct bool_pack;
605 template<bool... bs>
606 using all_true = std::is_same<bool_pack<bs..., true>, bool_pack<true, bs...>>;
607
608 template<int N>
609 struct single_tag_to_type
610 {};
611
612 template<>
613 struct single_tag_to_type<1>
614 {
615 using type = int64_t;
616 };
617
618 template<>
619 struct single_tag_to_type<2>
620 {
621 using type = uint64_t;
622 };
623
624 template<>
625 struct single_tag_to_type<3>
626 {
627 using type = double;
628 };
629
630 template<>
631 struct single_tag_to_type<4>
632 {
633 using type = std::string;
634 };
635
636 template<>
637 struct single_tag_to_type<5>
638 {
639 using type = std::string;
640 };
641
642
643 template<uint64_t Tag>
644 struct arguments
645 {
646 using subarguments = typename arguments<Tag / 6>::type;
647 using type =
648 typename subarguments::template push<typename single_tag_to_type<Tag % 6>::type>;
649 };
650
651 template<>
652 struct arguments<0>
653 {
654 using type = S<>;
655 };
656
657 template<typename... T>
658 struct last_element_type
659 {
660 using type = typename std::tuple_element<sizeof...(T) - 1, std::tuple<T...>>::type;
661 };
662
663
664 template<>
665 struct last_element_type<>
666 {};
667
668
669 // from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13072359/c11-compile-time-array-with-logarithmic-evaluation-depth
670 template<class T>
671 using Invoke = typename T::type;
672
673 template<unsigned...>
674 struct seq
675 {
676 using type = seq;
677 };
678
679 template<class S1, class S2>
680 struct concat;
681
682 template<unsigned... I1, unsigned... I2>
683 struct concat<seq<I1...>, seq<I2...>> : seq<I1..., (sizeof...(I1) + I2)...>
684 {};
685
686 template<class S1, class S2>
687 using Concat = Invoke<concat<S1, S2>>;
688
689 template<unsigned N>
690 struct gen_seq;
691 template<unsigned N>
692 using GenSeq = Invoke<gen_seq<N>>;
693
694 template<unsigned N>
695 struct gen_seq : Concat<GenSeq<N / 2>, GenSeq<N - N / 2>>
696 {};
697
698 template<>
699 struct gen_seq<0> : seq<>
700 {};
701 template<>
702 struct gen_seq<1> : seq<0>
703 {};
704
705 template<typename Seq, typename Tuple>
706 struct pop_back_helper;
707
708 template<unsigned... N, typename Tuple>
709 struct pop_back_helper<seq<N...>, Tuple>
710 {
711 template<template<typename... Args> class U>
712 using rebind = U<typename std::tuple_element<N, Tuple>::type...>;
713 };
714
715 template<typename... T>
716 struct pop_back //: public pop_back_helper<typename gen_seq<sizeof...(T)-1>::type, std::tuple<T...>>
717 {
718 template<template<typename... Args> class U>
719 using rebind = typename pop_back_helper<typename gen_seq<sizeof...(T) - 1>::type, std::tuple<T...>>::template rebind<U>;
720 };
721
722 template<>
723 struct pop_back<>
724 {
725 template<template<typename... Args> class U>
726 using rebind = U<>;
727 };
728
729 // from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2118541/check-if-c0x-parameter-pack-contains-a-type
730 template<typename Tp, typename... List>
731 struct contains : std::true_type
732 {};
733
734 template<typename Tp, typename Head, typename... Rest>
735 struct contains<Tp, Head, Rest...> : std::conditional<std::is_same<Tp, Head>::value, std::true_type, contains<Tp, Rest...>>::type
736 {};
737
738 template<typename Tp>
739 struct contains<Tp> : std::false_type
740 {};
741
742 template<typename T>
743 struct empty_context
744 {};
745
746 template<typename T>
747 struct promote
748 {
749 using type = T;
750 };
751
752#define CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(t1, t2) \
753 template<> \
754 struct promote<t1> \
755 { \
756 using type = t2; \
757 }
758
759 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(char, int64_t);
760 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(short, int64_t);
761 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(int, int64_t);
762 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(long, int64_t);
763 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(long long, int64_t);
764 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned char, uint64_t);
765 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned short, uint64_t);
766 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned int, uint64_t);
767 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned long, uint64_t);
768 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(unsigned long long, uint64_t);
769 CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE(float, double);
770#undef CROW_INTERNAL_PROMOTE_TYPE
771
772 template<typename T>
773 using promote_t = typename promote<T>::type;
774
775 } // namespace black_magic
776
777 namespace detail
778 {
779
780 template<class T, std::size_t N, class... Args>
781 struct get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl
782 {
783 static constexpr auto value = N;
784 };
785
786 template<class T, std::size_t N, class... Args>
787 struct get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, N, T, Args...>
788 {
789 static constexpr auto value = N;
790 };
791
792 template<class T, std::size_t N, class U, class... Args>
793 struct get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, N, U, Args...>
794 {
795 static constexpr auto value = get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, N + 1, Args...>::value;
796 };
797 } // namespace detail
798
799 namespace utility
800 {
801 template<class T, class... Args>
802 T& get_element_by_type(std::tuple<Args...>& t)
803 {
804 return std::get<detail::get_index_of_element_from_tuple_by_type_impl<T, 0, Args...>::value>(t);
805 }
806
807 template<typename T>
808 struct function_traits;
809
810#ifndef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
811 template<typename T>
812 struct function_traits : public function_traits<decltype(&T::operator())>
813 {
814 using parent_t = function_traits<decltype(&T::operator())>;
815 static const size_t arity = parent_t::arity;
816 using result_type = typename parent_t::result_type;
817 template<size_t i>
818 using arg = typename parent_t::template arg<i>;
819 };
820#endif
821
822 template<typename ClassType, typename R, typename... Args>
823 struct function_traits<R (ClassType::*)(Args...) const>
824 {
825 static const size_t arity = sizeof...(Args);
826
827 typedef R result_type;
828
829 template<size_t i>
830 using arg = typename std::tuple_element<i, std::tuple<Args...>>::type;
831 };
832
833 template<typename ClassType, typename R, typename... Args>
834 struct function_traits<R (ClassType::*)(Args...)>
835 {
836 static const size_t arity = sizeof...(Args);
837
838 typedef R result_type;
839
840 template<size_t i>
841 using arg = typename std::tuple_element<i, std::tuple<Args...>>::type;
842 };
843
844 template<typename R, typename... Args>
845 struct function_traits<std::function<R(Args...)>>
846 {
847 static const size_t arity = sizeof...(Args);
848
849 typedef R result_type;
850
851 template<size_t i>
852 using arg = typename std::tuple_element<i, std::tuple<Args...>>::type;
853 };
855
856 inline static std::string base64encode(const unsigned char* data, size_t size, const char* key = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/")
857 {
858 std::string ret;
859 ret.resize((size + 2) / 3 * 4);
860 auto it = ret.begin();
861 while (size >= 3)
862 {
863 *it++ = key[(static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xFC) >> 2];
864 unsigned char h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x03) << 4;
865 *it++ = key[h | ((static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xF0) >> 4)];
866 h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x0F) << 2;
867 *it++ = key[h | ((static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xC0) >> 6)];
868 *it++ = key[static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x3F];
869
870 size -= 3;
871 }
872 if (size == 1)
873 {
874 *it++ = key[(static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xFC) >> 2];
875 unsigned char h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x03) << 4;
876 *it++ = key[h];
877 *it++ = '=';
878 *it++ = '=';
879 }
880 else if (size == 2)
881 {
882 *it++ = key[(static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xFC) >> 2];
883 unsigned char h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x03) << 4;
884 *it++ = key[h | ((static_cast<unsigned char>(*data) & 0xF0) >> 4)];
885 h = (static_cast<unsigned char>(*data++) & 0x0F) << 2;
886 *it++ = key[h];
887 *it++ = '=';
888 }
889 return ret;
890 }
891
892 inline static std::string base64encode(std::string data, size_t size, const char* key = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/")
893 {
894 return base64encode((const unsigned char*)data.c_str(), size, key);
895 }
896
897 inline static std::string base64encode_urlsafe(const unsigned char* data, size_t size)
898 {
899 return base64encode(data, size, "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789-_");
900 }
901
902 inline static std::string base64encode_urlsafe(std::string data, size_t size)
903 {
904 return base64encode((const unsigned char*)data.c_str(), size, "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789-_");
905 }
906
907 inline static std::string base64decode(const char* data, size_t size)
908 {
909 // We accept both regular and url encoding here, as there does not seem to be any downside to that.
910 // If we want to distinguish that we should use +/ for non-url and -_ for url.
911
912 // Mapping logic from characters to [0-63]
913 auto key = [](char c) -> unsigned char {
914 if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z')) return c - 'A';
915 if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) return c - 'a' + 26;
916 if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) return c - '0' + 52;
917 if ((c == '+') || (c == '-')) return 62;
918 if ((c == '/') || (c == '_')) return 63;
919 return 0;
920 };
921
922 // Not padded
923 if (size % 4 == 2) // missing last 2 characters
924 size = (size / 4 * 3) + 1; // Not subtracting extra characters because they're truncated in int division
925 else if (size % 4 == 3) // missing last character
926 size = (size / 4 * 3) + 2; // Not subtracting extra characters because they're truncated in int division
927
928 // Padded
929 else if (size >= 2 && data[size - 2] == '=') // padded with '=='
930 size = (size / 4 * 3) - 2; // == padding means the last block only has 1 character instead of 3, hence the '-2'
931 else if (size >= 1 && data[size - 1] == '=') // padded with '='
932 size = (size / 4 * 3) - 1; // = padding means the last block only has 2 character instead of 3, hence the '-1'
933
934 // Padding not needed
935 else
936 size = size / 4 * 3;
937
938 std::string ret;
939 ret.resize(size);
940 auto it = ret.begin();
941
942 // These will be used to decode 1 character at a time
943 unsigned char odd; // char1 and char3
944 unsigned char even; // char2 and char4
945
946 // Take 4 character blocks to turn into 3
947 while (size >= 3)
948 {
949 // dec_char1 = (char1 shifted 2 bits to the left) OR ((char2 AND 00110000) shifted 4 bits to the right))
950 odd = key(*data++);
951 even = key(*data++);
952 *it++ = (odd << 2) | ((even & 0x30) >> 4);
953 // dec_char2 = ((char2 AND 00001111) shifted 4 bits left) OR ((char3 AND 00111100) shifted 2 bits right))
954 odd = key(*data++);
955 *it++ = ((even & 0x0F) << 4) | ((odd & 0x3C) >> 2);
956 // dec_char3 = ((char3 AND 00000011) shifted 6 bits left) OR (char4)
957 even = key(*data++);
958 *it++ = ((odd & 0x03) << 6) | (even);
959
960 size -= 3;
961 }
962 if (size == 2)
963 {
964 // d_char1 = (char1 shifted 2 bits to the left) OR ((char2 AND 00110000) shifted 4 bits to the right))
965 odd = key(*data++);
966 even = key(*data++);
967 *it++ = (odd << 2) | ((even & 0x30) >> 4);
968 // d_char2 = ((char2 AND 00001111) shifted 4 bits left) OR ((char3 AND 00111100) shifted 2 bits right))
969 odd = key(*data++);
970 *it++ = ((even & 0x0F) << 4) | ((odd & 0x3C) >> 2);
971 }
972 else if (size == 1)
973 {
974 // d_char1 = (char1 shifted 2 bits to the left) OR ((char2 AND 00110000) shifted 4 bits to the right))
975 odd = key(*data++);
976 even = key(*data++);
977 *it++ = (odd << 2) | ((even & 0x30) >> 4);
978 }
979 return ret;
980 }
981
982 inline static std::string base64decode(const std::string& data, size_t size)
983 {
984 return base64decode(data.data(), size);
985 }
986
987 inline static std::string base64decode(const std::string& data)
988 {
989 return base64decode(data.data(), data.length());
990 }
991
992 inline static std::string normalize_path(const std::string& directoryPath)
993 {
994 std::string normalizedPath = directoryPath;
995 std::replace(normalizedPath.begin(), normalizedPath.end(), '\\', '/');
996 if (!normalizedPath.empty() && normalizedPath.back() != '/')
997 normalizedPath += '/';
998 return normalizedPath;
999 }
1000
1001 inline static void sanitize_filename(std::string& data, char replacement = '_')
1002 {
1003 if (data.length() > 255)
1004 data.resize(255);
1005
1006 static const auto toUpper = [](char c) {
1007 return ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) ? (c - ('a' - 'A')) : c;
1008 };
1009 // Check for special device names. The Windows behavior is really odd here, it will consider both AUX and AUX.txt
1010 // a special device. Thus we search for the string (case-insensitive), and then check if the string ends or if
1011 // is has a dangerous follow up character (.:\/)
1012 auto sanitizeSpecialFile = [](std::string& source, unsigned ofs, const char* pattern, bool includeNumber, char replacement_) {
1013 unsigned i = ofs;
1014 size_t len = source.length();
1015 const char* p = pattern;
1016 while (*p)
1017 {
1018 if (i >= len) return;
1019 if (toUpper(source[i]) != *p) return;
1020 ++i;
1021 ++p;
1022 }
1023 if (includeNumber)
1024 {
1025 if ((i >= len) || (source[i] < '1') || (source[i] > '9')) return;
1026 ++i;
1027 }
1028 if ((i >= len) || (source[i] == '.') || (source[i] == ':') || (source[i] == '/') || (source[i] == '\\'))
1029 {
1030 source.erase(ofs + 1, (i - ofs) - 1);
1031 source[ofs] = replacement_;
1032 }
1033 };
1034 bool checkForSpecialEntries = true;
1035 for (unsigned i = 0; i < data.length(); ++i)
1036 {
1037 // Recognize directory traversals and the special devices CON/PRN/AUX/NULL/COM[1-]/LPT[1-9]
1038 if (checkForSpecialEntries)
1039 {
1040 checkForSpecialEntries = false;
1041 switch (toUpper(data[i]))
1042 {
1043 case 'A':
1044 sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "AUX", false, replacement);
1045 break;
1046 case 'C':
1047 sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "CON", false, replacement);
1048 sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "COM", true, replacement);
1049 break;
1050 case 'L':
1051 sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "LPT", true, replacement);
1052 break;
1053 case 'N':
1054 sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "NUL", false, replacement);
1055 break;
1056 case 'P':
1057 sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "PRN", false, replacement);
1058 break;
1059 case '.':
1060 sanitizeSpecialFile(data, i, "..", false, replacement);
1061 break;
1062 }
1063 }
1064
1065 // Sanitize individual characters
1066 unsigned char c = data[i];
1067 if ((c < ' ') || ((c >= 0x80) && (c <= 0x9F)) || (c == '?') || (c == '<') || (c == '>') || (c == ':') || (c == '*') || (c == '|') || (c == '\"'))
1068 {
1069 data[i] = replacement;
1070 }
1071 else if ((c == '/') || (c == '\\'))
1072 {
1073 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(i == 0)) //Prevent Unix Absolute Paths (Windows Absolute Paths are prevented with `(c == ':')`)
1074 {
1075 data[i] = replacement;
1076 }
1077 else
1078 {
1079 checkForSpecialEntries = true;
1080 }
1081 }
1082 }
1083 }
1084
1085 inline static std::string random_alphanum(std::size_t size)
1086 {
1087 static const char alphabet[] = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
1088 std::random_device dev;
1089 std::mt19937 rng(dev());
1090 std::uniform_int_distribution<std::mt19937::result_type> dist(0, sizeof(alphabet) - 2);
1091 std::string out;
1092 out.reserve(size);
1093 for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size; i++)
1094 out.push_back(alphabet[dist(rng)]);
1095 return out;
1096 }
1097
1098 inline static std::string join_path(std::string path, const std::string& fname)
1099 {
1100 return (std::filesystem::path(path) / fname).string();
1101 }
1102
1108 inline static bool string_equals(const std::string_view l, const std::string_view r, bool case_sensitive = false)
1109 {
1110 if (l.length() != r.length())
1111 return false;
1112
1113 for (size_t i = 0; i < l.length(); i++)
1114 {
1115 if (case_sensitive)
1116 {
1117 if (l[i] != r[i])
1118 return false;
1119 }
1120 else
1121 {
1122 if (std::toupper(l[i]) != std::toupper(r[i]))
1123 return false;
1124 }
1125 }
1126
1127 return true;
1128 }
1129
1130 template<typename T, typename U>
1131 inline static T lexical_cast(const U& v)
1132 {
1133 std::stringstream stream;
1134 T res;
1135
1136 stream << v;
1137 stream >> res;
1138
1139 return res;
1140 }
1141
1142 template<typename T>
1143 inline static T lexical_cast(const char* v, size_t count)
1144 {
1145 std::stringstream stream;
1146 T res;
1147
1148 stream.write(v, count);
1149 stream >> res;
1150
1151 return res;
1152 }
1153
1154
1157 inline static std::string trim(const std::string& v)
1158 {
1159 if (v.empty())
1160 return "";
1161
1162 size_t begin = 0, end = v.length();
1163
1164 size_t i;
1165 for (i = 0; i < v.length(); i++)
1166 {
1167 if (!std::isspace(v[i]))
1168 {
1169 begin = i;
1170 break;
1171 }
1172 }
1173
1174 if (i == v.length())
1175 return "";
1176
1177 for (i = v.length(); i > 0; i--)
1178 {
1179 if (!std::isspace(v[i - 1]))
1180 {
1181 end = i;
1182 break;
1183 }
1184 }
1185
1186 return v.substr(begin, end - begin);
1187 }
1188
1192 inline static std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& v, const std::string& separator)
1193 {
1194 std::vector<std::string> result;
1195 size_t startPos = 0;
1196
1197 for (size_t foundPos = v.find(separator); foundPos != std::string::npos; foundPos = v.find(separator, startPos))
1198 {
1199 result.push_back(v.substr(startPos, foundPos - startPos));
1200 startPos = foundPos + separator.size();
1201 }
1202
1203 result.push_back(v.substr(startPos));
1204 return result;
1205 }
1206
1215 template<typename Iter1, typename Iter2>
1216 inline static Iter1 find_first_of(Iter1 first1, Iter1 last1, Iter2 first2, Iter2 last2)
1217 {
1218 for (; first1 != last1; ++first1)
1219 {
1220 if (std::find(first2, last2, *first1) != last2)
1221 {
1222 return first1;
1223 }
1224 }
1225 return last1;
1226 }
1227 } // namespace utility
1228} // namespace crow
1229
1230
1231#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
1232#include <boost/asio.hpp>
1233#include <boost/asio/version.hpp>
1234#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
1235#include <boost/asio/ssl.hpp>
1236#endif
1237#else
1238#ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
1239#define ASIO_STANDALONE
1240#endif
1241#include <asio.hpp>
1242#include <asio/version.hpp>
1243#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
1244#include <asio/ssl.hpp>
1245#endif
1246#endif
1247
1248#if (CROW_USE_BOOST && BOOST_VERSION >= 107000) || (ASIO_VERSION >= 101300)
1249#define GET_IO_CONTEXT(s) ((asio::io_context&)(s).get_executor().context())
1250#else
1251#define GET_IO_CONTEXT(s) ((s).get_io_service())
1252#endif
1253
1254namespace crow
1255{
1256#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
1257 namespace asio = boost::asio;
1258 using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
1259#else
1260 using error_code = asio::error_code;
1261#endif
1262 using tcp = asio::ip::tcp;
1263
1265 struct SocketAdaptor
1266 {
1267 using context = void;
1268 SocketAdaptor(asio::io_context& io_context, context*):
1269 socket_(io_context)
1270 {}
1271
1272 asio::io_context& get_io_context()
1273 {
1274 return GET_IO_CONTEXT(socket_);
1275 }
1276
1278 tcp::socket& raw_socket()
1279 {
1280 return socket_;
1281 }
1282
1284 tcp::socket& socket()
1285 {
1286 return socket_;
1287 }
1288
1289 tcp::endpoint remote_endpoint()
1290 {
1291 return socket_.remote_endpoint();
1292 }
1293
1294 bool is_open()
1295 {
1296 return socket_.is_open();
1297 }
1298
1299 void close()
1300 {
1301 error_code ec;
1302 socket_.close(ec);
1303 }
1304
1305 void shutdown_readwrite()
1306 {
1307 error_code ec;
1308 socket_.shutdown(asio::socket_base::shutdown_type::shutdown_both, ec);
1309 }
1310
1311 void shutdown_write()
1312 {
1313 error_code ec;
1314 socket_.shutdown(asio::socket_base::shutdown_type::shutdown_send, ec);
1315 }
1316
1317 void shutdown_read()
1318 {
1319 error_code ec;
1320 socket_.shutdown(asio::socket_base::shutdown_type::shutdown_receive, ec);
1321 }
1322
1323 template<typename F>
1324 void start(F f)
1325 {
1326 f(error_code());
1327 }
1328
1329 tcp::socket socket_;
1330 };
1331
1332#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
1333 struct SSLAdaptor
1334 {
1335 using context = asio::ssl::context;
1336 using ssl_socket_t = asio::ssl::stream<tcp::socket>;
1337 SSLAdaptor(asio::io_context& io_context, context* ctx):
1338 ssl_socket_(new ssl_socket_t(io_context, *ctx))
1339 {}
1340
1341 asio::ssl::stream<tcp::socket>& socket()
1342 {
1343 return *ssl_socket_;
1344 }
1345
1346 tcp::socket::lowest_layer_type&
1347 raw_socket()
1348 {
1349 return ssl_socket_->lowest_layer();
1350 }
1351
1352 tcp::endpoint remote_endpoint()
1353 {
1354 return raw_socket().remote_endpoint();
1355 }
1356
1357 bool is_open()
1358 {
1359 return ssl_socket_ ? raw_socket().is_open() : false;
1360 }
1361
1362 void close()
1363 {
1364 if (is_open())
1365 {
1366 error_code ec;
1367 raw_socket().close(ec);
1368 }
1369 }
1370
1371 void shutdown_readwrite()
1372 {
1373 if (is_open())
1374 {
1375 error_code ec;
1376 raw_socket().shutdown(asio::socket_base::shutdown_type::shutdown_both, ec);
1377 }
1378 }
1379
1380 void shutdown_write()
1381 {
1382 if (is_open())
1383 {
1384 error_code ec;
1385 raw_socket().shutdown(asio::socket_base::shutdown_type::shutdown_send, ec);
1386 }
1387 }
1388
1389 void shutdown_read()
1390 {
1391 if (is_open())
1392 {
1393 error_code ec;
1394 raw_socket().shutdown(asio::socket_base::shutdown_type::shutdown_receive, ec);
1395 }
1396 }
1397
1398 asio::io_context& get_io_context()
1399 {
1400 return GET_IO_CONTEXT(raw_socket());
1401 }
1402
1403 template<typename F>
1404 void start(F f)
1405 {
1406 ssl_socket_->async_handshake(asio::ssl::stream_base::server,
1407 [f](const error_code& ec) {
1408 f(ec);
1409 });
1410 }
1411
1412 std::unique_ptr<asio::ssl::stream<tcp::socket>> ssl_socket_;
1413 };
1414#endif
1415} // namespace crow
1416
1417
1418#include <string>
1419
1420namespace crow
1421{
1423 struct returnable
1424 {
1425 std::string content_type;
1426 virtual std::string dump() const = 0;
1427
1428 returnable(std::string ctype):
1429 content_type{ctype}
1430 {}
1431
1432 virtual ~returnable(){};
1433 };
1434} // namespace crow
1435
1436
1437#include <stdio.h>
1438#include <string.h>
1439#include <string>
1440#include <vector>
1441#include <unordered_map>
1442#include <iostream>
1443#include <memory>
1444
1445namespace crow
1446{
1447
1448// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1449// qs_parse (modified)
1450// https://github.com/bartgrantham/qs_parse
1451// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1452/* Similar to strncmp, but handles URL-encoding for either string */
1453int qs_strncmp(const char* s, const char* qs, size_t n);
1454
1455
1456/* Finds the beginning of each key/value pair and stores a pointer in qs_kv.
1457 * Also decodes the value portion of the k/v pair *in-place*. In a future
1458 * enhancement it will also have a compile-time option of sorting qs_kv
1459 * alphabetically by key. */
1460size_t qs_parse(char* qs, char* qs_kv[], size_t qs_kv_size, bool parse_url);
1461
1462
1463/* Used by qs_parse to decode the value portion of a k/v pair */
1464int qs_decode(char * qs);
1465
1466
1467/* Looks up the value according to the key on a pre-processed query string
1468 * A future enhancement will be a compile-time option to look up the key
1469 * in a pre-sorted qs_kv array via a binary search. */
1470//char * qs_k2v(const char * key, char * qs_kv[], int qs_kv_size);
1471 char * qs_k2v(const char * key, char * const * qs_kv, size_t qs_kv_size, int nth);
1472
1473
1474/* Non-destructive lookup of value, based on key. User provides the
1475 * destinaton string and length. */
1476char * qs_scanvalue(const char * key, const char * qs, char * val, size_t val_len);
1477
1478// TODO: implement sorting of the qs_kv array; for now ensure it's not compiled
1479#undef _qsSORTING
1480
1481// isxdigit _is_ available in <ctype.h>, but let's avoid another header instead
1482#define CROW_QS_ISHEX(x) ((((x)>='0'&&(x)<='9') || ((x)>='A'&&(x)<='F') || ((x)>='a'&&(x)<='f')) ? 1 : 0)
1483#define CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(x) (((x)>='0'&&(x)<='9') ? (x)-48 : ((x)>='A'&&(x)<='F') ? (x)-55 : ((x)>='a'&&(x)<='f') ? (x)-87 : 0)
1484#define CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(x) ((((x)=='=')||((x)=='#')||((x)=='&')||((x)=='\0')) ? 0 : 1)
1485
1486inline int qs_strncmp(const char * s, const char * qs, size_t n)
1487{
1488 unsigned char u1, u2, unyb, lnyb;
1489
1490 while(n-- > 0)
1491 {
1492 u1 = static_cast<unsigned char>(*s++);
1493 u2 = static_cast<unsigned char>(*qs++);
1494
1495 if ( ! CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(u1) ) { u1 = '\0'; }
1496 if ( ! CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(u2) ) { u2 = '\0'; }
1497
1498 if ( u1 == '+' ) { u1 = ' '; }
1499 if ( u1 == '%' ) // easier/safer than scanf
1500 {
1501 unyb = static_cast<unsigned char>(*s++);
1502 lnyb = static_cast<unsigned char>(*s++);
1503 if ( CROW_QS_ISHEX(unyb) && CROW_QS_ISHEX(lnyb) )
1504 u1 = (CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(unyb) * 16) + CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(lnyb);
1505 else
1506 u1 = '\0';
1507 }
1508
1509 if ( u2 == '+' ) { u2 = ' '; }
1510 if ( u2 == '%' ) // easier/safer than scanf
1511 {
1512 unyb = static_cast<unsigned char>(*qs++);
1513 lnyb = static_cast<unsigned char>(*qs++);
1514 if ( CROW_QS_ISHEX(unyb) && CROW_QS_ISHEX(lnyb) )
1515 u2 = (CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(unyb) * 16) + CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(lnyb);
1516 else
1517 u2 = '\0';
1518 }
1519
1520 if ( u1 != u2 )
1521 return u1 - u2;
1522 if ( u1 == '\0' )
1523 return 0;
1524 }
1525 if ( CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(*qs) )
1526 return -1;
1527 else
1528 return 0;
1529}
1530
1531
1532inline size_t qs_parse(char* qs, char* qs_kv[], size_t qs_kv_size, bool parse_url = true)
1533{
1534 size_t i, j;
1535 char * substr_ptr;
1536
1537 for(i=0; i<qs_kv_size; i++) qs_kv[i] = NULL;
1538
1539 // find the beginning of the k/v substrings or the fragment
1540 substr_ptr = parse_url ? qs + strcspn(qs, "?#") : qs;
1541 if (parse_url)
1542 {
1543 if (substr_ptr[0] != '\0')
1544 substr_ptr++;
1545 else
1546 return 0; // no query or fragment
1547 }
1548
1549 i=0;
1550 while(i<qs_kv_size)
1551 {
1552 qs_kv[i] = substr_ptr;
1553 j = strcspn(substr_ptr, "&");
1554 if ( substr_ptr[j] == '\0' ) { i++; break; } // x &'s -> means x iterations of this loop -> means *x+1* k/v pairs
1555 substr_ptr += j + 1;
1556 i++;
1557 }
1558
1559 // we only decode the values in place, the keys could have '='s in them
1560 // which will hose our ability to distinguish keys from values later
1561 for(j=0; j<i; j++)
1562 {
1563 substr_ptr = qs_kv[j] + strcspn(qs_kv[j], "=&#");
1564 if ( substr_ptr[0] == '&' || substr_ptr[0] == '\0') // blank value: skip decoding
1565 substr_ptr[0] = '\0';
1566 else
1567 qs_decode(++substr_ptr);
1568 }
1569
1570#ifdef _qsSORTING
1571// TODO: qsort qs_kv, using qs_strncmp() for the comparison
1572#endif
1573
1574 return i;
1575}
1576
1577
1578inline int qs_decode(char * qs)
1579{
1580 int i=0, j=0;
1581
1582 while( CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(qs[j]) )
1583 {
1584 if ( qs[j] == '+' ) { qs[i] = ' '; }
1585 else if ( qs[j] == '%' ) // easier/safer than scanf
1586 {
1587 if ( ! CROW_QS_ISHEX(qs[j+1]) || ! CROW_QS_ISHEX(qs[j+2]) )
1588 {
1589 qs[i] = '\0';
1590 return i;
1591 }
1592 qs[i] = (CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(qs[j+1]) * 16) + CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(qs[j+2]);
1593 j+=2;
1594 }
1595 else
1596 {
1597 qs[i] = qs[j];
1598 }
1599 i++; j++;
1600 }
1601 qs[i] = '\0';
1602
1603 return i;
1604}
1605
1606
1607inline char * qs_k2v(const char * key, char * const * qs_kv, size_t qs_kv_size, int nth = 0)
1608{
1609 size_t i;
1610 size_t key_len, skip;
1611
1612 key_len = strlen(key);
1613
1614#ifdef _qsSORTING
1615// TODO: binary search for key in the sorted qs_kv
1616#else // _qsSORTING
1617 for(i=0; i<qs_kv_size; i++)
1618 {
1619 // we rely on the unambiguous '=' to find the value in our k/v pair
1620 if ( qs_strncmp(key, qs_kv[i], key_len) == 0 )
1621 {
1622 skip = strcspn(qs_kv[i], "=");
1623 if ( qs_kv[i][skip] == '=' )
1624 skip++;
1625 // return (zero-char value) ? ptr to trailing '\0' : ptr to value
1626 if(nth == 0)
1627 return qs_kv[i] + skip;
1628 else
1629 --nth;
1630 }
1631 }
1632#endif // _qsSORTING
1633
1634 return nullptr;
1635}
1636
1637inline std::unique_ptr<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> qs_dict_name2kv(const char * dict_name, char * const * qs_kv, size_t qs_kv_size, int nth = 0)
1638{
1639 size_t i;
1640 size_t name_len, skip_to_eq, skip_to_brace_open, skip_to_brace_close;
1641
1642 name_len = strlen(dict_name);
1643
1644#ifdef _qsSORTING
1645// TODO: binary search for key in the sorted qs_kv
1646#else // _qsSORTING
1647 for(i=0; i<qs_kv_size; i++)
1648 {
1649 if ( strncmp(dict_name, qs_kv[i], name_len) == 0 )
1650 {
1651 skip_to_eq = strcspn(qs_kv[i], "=");
1652 if ( qs_kv[i][skip_to_eq] == '=' )
1653 skip_to_eq++;
1654 skip_to_brace_open = strcspn(qs_kv[i], "[");
1655 if ( qs_kv[i][skip_to_brace_open] == '[' )
1656 skip_to_brace_open++;
1657 skip_to_brace_close = strcspn(qs_kv[i], "]");
1658
1659 if ( skip_to_brace_open <= skip_to_brace_close &&
1660 skip_to_brace_open > 0 &&
1661 skip_to_brace_close > 0 &&
1662 nth == 0 )
1663 {
1664 auto key = std::string(qs_kv[i] + skip_to_brace_open, skip_to_brace_close - skip_to_brace_open);
1665 auto value = std::string(qs_kv[i] + skip_to_eq);
1666 return std::unique_ptr<std::pair<std::string, std::string>>(new std::pair<std::string, std::string>(key, value));
1667 }
1668 else
1669 {
1670 --nth;
1671 }
1672 }
1673 }
1674#endif // _qsSORTING
1675
1676 return nullptr;
1677}
1678
1679
1680inline char * qs_scanvalue(const char * key, const char * qs, char * val, size_t val_len)
1681{
1682 size_t i, key_len;
1683 const char * tmp;
1684
1685 // find the beginning of the k/v substrings
1686 if ( (tmp = strchr(qs, '?')) != NULL )
1687 qs = tmp + 1;
1688
1689 key_len = strlen(key);
1690 while(qs[0] != '#' && qs[0] != '\0')
1691 {
1692 if ( qs_strncmp(key, qs, key_len) == 0 )
1693 break;
1694 qs += strcspn(qs, "&") + 1;
1695 }
1696
1697 if ( qs[0] == '\0' ) return NULL;
1698
1699 qs += strcspn(qs, "=&#");
1700 if ( qs[0] == '=' )
1701 {
1702 qs++;
1703 i = strcspn(qs, "&=#");
1704#ifdef _MSC_VER
1705 strncpy_s(val, val_len, qs, (val_len - 1)<(i + 1) ? (val_len - 1) : (i + 1));
1706#else
1707 strncpy(val, qs, (val_len - 1)<(i + 1) ? (val_len - 1) : (i + 1));
1708#endif
1709 qs_decode(val);
1710 }
1711 else
1712 {
1713 if ( val_len > 0 )
1714 val[0] = '\0';
1715 }
1716
1717 return val;
1718}
1719}
1720// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1721
1722
1723namespace crow
1724{
1725 struct request;
1727 class query_string
1728 {
1729 public:
1730 static const int MAX_KEY_VALUE_PAIRS_COUNT = 256;
1731
1732 query_string() = default;
1733
1734 query_string(const query_string& qs):
1735 url_(qs.url_)
1736 {
1737 for (auto p : qs.key_value_pairs_)
1738 {
1739 key_value_pairs_.push_back((char*)(p - qs.url_.c_str() + url_.c_str()));
1740 }
1741 }
1742
1743 query_string& operator=(const query_string& qs)
1744 {
1745 url_ = qs.url_;
1746 key_value_pairs_.clear();
1747 for (auto p : qs.key_value_pairs_)
1748 {
1749 key_value_pairs_.push_back((char*)(p - qs.url_.c_str() + url_.c_str()));
1750 }
1751 return *this;
1752 }
1753
1754 query_string& operator=(query_string&& qs) noexcept
1755 {
1756 key_value_pairs_ = std::move(qs.key_value_pairs_);
1757 char* old_data = (char*)qs.url_.c_str();
1758 url_ = std::move(qs.url_);
1759 for (auto& p : key_value_pairs_)
1760 {
1761 p += (char*)url_.c_str() - old_data;
1762 }
1763 return *this;
1764 }
1765
1766
1767 query_string(std::string params, bool url = true):
1768 url_(std::move(params))
1769 {
1770 if (url_.empty())
1771 return;
1772
1773 key_value_pairs_.resize(MAX_KEY_VALUE_PAIRS_COUNT);
1774 size_t count = qs_parse(&url_[0], &key_value_pairs_[0], MAX_KEY_VALUE_PAIRS_COUNT, url);
1775
1776 key_value_pairs_.resize(count);
1777 key_value_pairs_.shrink_to_fit();
1778 }
1779
1780 void clear()
1781 {
1782 key_value_pairs_.clear();
1783 url_.clear();
1784 }
1785
1786 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const query_string& qs)
1787 {
1788 os << "[ ";
1789 for (size_t i = 0; i < qs.key_value_pairs_.size(); ++i)
1790 {
1791 if (i)
1792 os << ", ";
1793 os << qs.key_value_pairs_[i];
1794 }
1795 os << " ]";
1796 return os;
1797 }
1798
1800
1803 char* get(const std::string& name) const
1804 {
1805 char* ret = qs_k2v(name.c_str(), key_value_pairs_.data(), key_value_pairs_.size());
1806 return ret;
1807 }
1808
1810 char* pop(const std::string& name)
1811 {
1812 char* ret = get(name);
1813 if (ret != nullptr)
1814 {
1815 const std::string key_name = name + '=';
1816 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < key_value_pairs_.size(); i++)
1817 {
1818 std::string str_item(key_value_pairs_[i]);
1819 if (str_item.find(key_name)==0)
1820 {
1821 key_value_pairs_.erase(key_value_pairs_.begin() + i);
1822 break;
1823 }
1824 }
1825 }
1826 return ret;
1827 }
1828
1830
1833 std::vector<char*> get_list(const std::string& name, bool use_brackets = true) const
1834 {
1835 std::vector<char*> ret;
1836 std::string plus = name + (use_brackets ? "[]" : "");
1837 char* element = nullptr;
1838
1839 int count = 0;
1840 while (1)
1841 {
1842 element = qs_k2v(plus.c_str(), key_value_pairs_.data(), key_value_pairs_.size(), count++);
1843 if (!element)
1844 break;
1845 ret.push_back(element);
1846 }
1847 return ret;
1848 }
1849
1851 std::vector<char*> pop_list(const std::string& name, bool use_brackets = true)
1852 {
1853 std::vector<char*> ret = get_list(name, use_brackets);
1854 const size_t name_len = name.length();
1855 if (!ret.empty())
1856 {
1857 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < key_value_pairs_.size(); i++)
1858 {
1859 std::string str_item(key_value_pairs_[i]);
1860 if (str_item.find(name)==0) {
1861 if (use_brackets && str_item.find("[]=",name_len)==name_len) {
1862 key_value_pairs_.erase(key_value_pairs_.begin() + i--);
1863 } else if (!use_brackets && str_item.find('=',name_len)==name_len ) {
1864 key_value_pairs_.erase(key_value_pairs_.begin() + i--);
1865 }
1866 }
1867 }
1868 }
1869 return ret;
1870 }
1871
1873
1878 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> get_dict(const std::string& name) const
1879 {
1880 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> ret;
1881
1882 int count = 0;
1883 while (1)
1884 {
1885 if (auto element = qs_dict_name2kv(name.c_str(), key_value_pairs_.data(), key_value_pairs_.size(), count++))
1886 ret.insert(*element);
1887 else
1888 break;
1889 }
1890 return ret;
1891 }
1892
1894 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> pop_dict(const std::string& name)
1895 {
1896 const std::string name_value = name +'[';
1897 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> ret = get_dict(name);
1898 if (!ret.empty())
1899 {
1900 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < key_value_pairs_.size(); i++)
1901 {
1902 std::string str_item(key_value_pairs_[i]);
1903 if (str_item.find(name_value)==0)
1904 {
1905 key_value_pairs_.erase(key_value_pairs_.begin() + i--);
1906 }
1907 }
1908 }
1909 return ret;
1910 }
1911
1912 std::vector<std::string> keys() const
1913 {
1914 std::vector<std::string> keys;
1915 keys.reserve(key_value_pairs_.size());
1916
1917 for (const char* const element : key_value_pairs_)
1918 {
1919 const char* delimiter = strchr(element, '=');
1920 if (delimiter)
1921 keys.emplace_back(element, delimiter);
1922 else
1923 keys.emplace_back(element);
1924 }
1925
1926 return keys;
1927 }
1928
1929 private:
1930 std::string url_;
1931 std::vector<char*> key_value_pairs_;
1932 };
1933
1934} // namespace crow
1935

1937#include <unordered_map>
1938#include <string>
1939

2055
2056
2057
2058#include <cstdio>
2059#include <cstdlib>
2060#include <ctime>
2061#include <iostream>
2062#include <sstream>
2063#include <string>
2064
2065namespace crow
2066{
2067 enum class LogLevel
2068 {
2069#ifndef ERROR
2070#ifndef DEBUG
2071 DEBUG = 0,
2072 INFO,
2073 WARNING,
2074 ERROR,
2075 CRITICAL,
2076#endif
2077#endif
2078
2079 Debug = 0,
2080 Info,
2081 Warning,
2082 Error,
2083 Critical,
2084 };
2085
2086 class ILogHandler
2087 {
2088 public:
2089 virtual ~ILogHandler() = default;
2090
2091 virtual void log(std::string message, LogLevel level) = 0;
2092 };
2093
2094 class CerrLogHandler : public ILogHandler
2095 {
2096 public:
2097 void log(std::string message, LogLevel level) override
2098 {
2099 std::string prefix;
2100 switch (level)
2101 {
2102 case LogLevel::Debug:
2103 prefix = "DEBUG ";
2104 break;
2105 case LogLevel::Info:
2106 prefix = "INFO ";
2107 break;
2108 case LogLevel::Warning:
2109 prefix = "WARNING ";
2110 break;
2111 case LogLevel::Error:
2112 prefix = "ERROR ";
2113 break;
2114 case LogLevel::Critical:
2115 prefix = "CRITICAL";
2116 break;
2117 }
2118 std::cerr << std::string("(") + timestamp() + std::string(") [") + prefix + std::string("] ") + message << std::endl;
2119 }
2120
2121 private:
2122 static std::string timestamp()
2123 {
2124 char date[32];
2125 time_t t = time(0);
2126
2127 tm my_tm;
2128
2129#if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)
2130#ifdef CROW_USE_LOCALTIMEZONE
2131 localtime_s(&my_tm, &t);
2132#else
2133 gmtime_s(&my_tm, &t);
2134#endif
2135#else
2136#ifdef CROW_USE_LOCALTIMEZONE
2137 localtime_r(&t, &my_tm);
2138#else
2139 gmtime_r(&t, &my_tm);
2140#endif
2141#endif
2142
2143 size_t sz = strftime(date, sizeof(date), "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", &my_tm);
2144 return std::string(date, date + sz);
2145 }
2146 };
2147
2148 class logger
2149 {
2150 public:
2151 logger(LogLevel level):
2152 level_(level)
2153 {}
2154 ~logger()
2155 {
2156#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_LOGGING
2157 if (level_ >= get_current_log_level())
2158 {
2159 get_handler_ref()->log(stringstream_.str(), level_);
2160 }
2161#endif
2162 }
2163
2164 //
2165 template<typename T>
2166 logger& operator<<(T const& value)
2167 {
2168#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_LOGGING
2169 if (level_ >= get_current_log_level())
2170 {
2171 stringstream_ << value;
2172 }
2173#endif
2174 return *this;
2175 }
2176
2177 //
2178 static void setLogLevel(LogLevel level) { get_log_level_ref() = level; }
2179
2180 static void setHandler(ILogHandler* handler) { get_handler_ref() = handler; }
2181
2182 static LogLevel get_current_log_level() { return get_log_level_ref(); }
2183
2184 private:
2185 //
2186 static LogLevel& get_log_level_ref()
2187 {
2188 static LogLevel current_level = static_cast<LogLevel>(CROW_LOG_LEVEL);
2189 return current_level;
2190 }
2191 static ILogHandler*& get_handler_ref()
2192 {
2193 static CerrLogHandler default_handler;
2194 static ILogHandler* current_handler = &default_handler;
2195 return current_handler;
2196 }
2197
2198 //
2199 std::ostringstream stringstream_;
2200 LogLevel level_;
2201 };
2202} // namespace crow
2203
2204#define CROW_LOG_CRITICAL \
2205 if (crow::logger::get_current_log_level() <= crow::LogLevel::Critical) \
2206 crow::logger(crow::LogLevel::Critical)
2207#define CROW_LOG_ERROR \
2208 if (crow::logger::get_current_log_level() <= crow::LogLevel::Error) \
2209 crow::logger(crow::LogLevel::Error)
2210#define CROW_LOG_WARNING \
2211 if (crow::logger::get_current_log_level() <= crow::LogLevel::Warning) \
2212 crow::logger(crow::LogLevel::Warning)
2213#define CROW_LOG_INFO \
2214 if (crow::logger::get_current_log_level() <= crow::LogLevel::Info) \
2215 crow::logger(crow::LogLevel::Info)
2216#define CROW_LOG_DEBUG \
2217 if (crow::logger::get_current_log_level() <= crow::LogLevel::Debug) \
2218 crow::logger(crow::LogLevel::Debug)
2219
2220
2221#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
2222#include <boost/asio.hpp>
2223#include <boost/asio/basic_waitable_timer.hpp>
2224#else
2225#ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
2226#define ASIO_STANDALONE
2227#endif
2228#include <asio.hpp>
2229#include <asio/basic_waitable_timer.hpp>
2230#endif
2231
2232#include <chrono>
2233#include <functional>
2234#include <map>
2235#include <vector>
2236
2237
2238namespace crow
2239{
2240#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
2241 namespace asio = boost::asio;
2242 using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
2243#else
2244 using error_code = asio::error_code;
2245#endif
2246 namespace detail
2247 {
2248
2252 class task_timer
2253 {
2254 public:
2255 using task_type = std::function<void()>;
2256 using identifier_type = size_t;
2257
2258 private:
2259 using clock_type = std::chrono::steady_clock;
2260 using time_type = clock_type::time_point;
2261 public:
2262 task_timer(asio::io_context& io_context,
2263 const std::chrono::milliseconds tick_length =
2264 std::chrono::seconds(1)) :
2265 io_context_(io_context), timer_(io_context_),
2266 tick_length_ms_(tick_length)
2267 {
2268 timer_.expires_after(tick_length_ms_);
2269 timer_.async_wait(
2270 std::bind(&task_timer::tick_handler, this,
2271 std::placeholders::_1));
2272 }
2273
2274 ~task_timer() { timer_.cancel(); }
2275
2279 void cancel(identifier_type id)
2280 {
2281 tasks_.erase(id);
2282 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "task_timer task cancelled: " << this << ' ' << id;
2283 }
2284
2287
2293 identifier_type schedule(const task_type& task)
2294 {
2295 return schedule(task, get_default_timeout());
2296 }
2297
2299
2307 identifier_type schedule(const task_type& task, uint8_t timeout)
2308 {
2309 tasks_.insert({++highest_id_,
2310 {clock_type::now() + (timeout * tick_length_ms_),
2311 task}});
2312 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "task_timer scheduled: " << this << ' ' <<
2313 highest_id_;
2314 return highest_id_;
2315 }
2316
2319
2324 void set_default_timeout(uint8_t timeout) {
2325 default_timeout_ = timeout;
2326 }
2327
2329 uint8_t get_default_timeout() const {
2330 return default_timeout_;
2331 }
2332
2334 std::chrono::milliseconds get_tick_length() const {
2335 return tick_length_ms_;
2336 }
2337
2338 private:
2339 void process_tasks()
2340 {
2341 time_type current_time = clock_type::now();
2342 std::vector<identifier_type> finished_tasks;
2343
2344 for (const auto& task : tasks_)
2345 {
2346 if (task.second.first < current_time)
2347 {
2348 (task.second.second)();
2349 finished_tasks.push_back(task.first);
2350 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "task_timer called: " << this <<
2351 ' ' << task.first;
2352 }
2353 }
2354
2355 for (const auto& task : finished_tasks)
2356 tasks_.erase(task);
2357
2358 // If no task is currently scheduled, reset the issued ids back
2359 // to 0.
2360 if (tasks_.empty()) highest_id_ = 0;
2361 }
2362
2363 void tick_handler(const error_code& ec)
2364 {
2365 if (ec) return;
2366
2367 process_tasks();
2368
2369 timer_.expires_after(tick_length_ms_);
2370 timer_.async_wait(
2371 std::bind(&task_timer::tick_handler, this, std::placeholders::_1));
2372 }
2373
2374 private:
2375 asio::io_context& io_context_;
2376 asio::basic_waitable_timer<clock_type> timer_;
2377 std::map<identifier_type, std::pair<time_type, task_type>> tasks_;
2378
2379 // A continuously increasing number to be issued to threads to
2380 // identify them. If no tasks are scheduled, it will be reset to 0.
2381 identifier_type highest_id_{0};
2382 std::chrono::milliseconds tick_length_ms_;
2383 uint8_t default_timeout_{5};
2384
2385 };
2386 } // namespace detail
2387} // namespace crow
2388
2389
2390//#define CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2391//#define CROW_JSON_USE_MAP
2392
2393#include <string>
2394#ifdef CROW_JSON_USE_MAP
2395#include <map>
2396#else
2397#include <unordered_map>
2398#endif
2399#include <iostream>
2400#include <algorithm>
2401#include <memory>
2402#include <vector>
2403#include <cmath>
2404#include <cfloat>
2405
2406
2407using std::isinf;
2408using std::isnan;
2409
2410
2411namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
2412{
2413 namespace mustache
2414 {
2415 class template_t;
2416 }
2417
2418 namespace json
2419 {
2420 static inline char to_hex(char c)
2421 {
2422 c = c & 0xf;
2423 if (c < 10)
2424 return '0' + c;
2425 return 'a' + c - 10;
2426 }
2427
2428 inline void escape(const std::string& str, std::string& ret)
2429 {
2430 ret.reserve(ret.size() + str.size() + str.size() / 4);
2431 for (auto c : str)
2432 {
2433 switch (c)
2434 {
2435 case '"': ret += "\\\""; break;
2436 case '\\': ret += "\\\\"; break;
2437 case '\n': ret += "\\n"; break;
2438 case '\b': ret += "\\b"; break;
2439 case '\f': ret += "\\f"; break;
2440 case '\r': ret += "\\r"; break;
2441 case '\t': ret += "\\t"; break;
2442 default:
2443 if (c >= 0 && c < 0x20)
2444 {
2445 ret += "\\u00";
2446 ret += to_hex(c / 16);
2447 ret += to_hex(c % 16);
2448 }
2449 else
2450 ret += c;
2451 break;
2452 }
2453 }
2454 }
2455 inline std::string escape(const std::string& str)
2456 {
2457 std::string ret;
2458 escape(str, ret);
2459 return ret;
2460 }
2461
2462 enum class type : char
2463 {
2464 Null,
2465 False,
2466 True,
2467 Number,
2468 String,
2469 List,
2470 Object,
2471 Function
2472 };
2473
2474 inline const char* get_type_str(type t)
2475 {
2476 switch (t)
2477 {
2478 case type::Number: return "Number";
2479 case type::False: return "False";
2480 case type::True: return "True";
2481 case type::List: return "List";
2482 case type::String: return "String";
2483 case type::Object: return "Object";
2484 case type::Function: return "Function";
2485 default: return "Unknown";
2486 }
2487 }
2488
2489 enum class num_type : char
2490 {
2491 Signed_integer,
2492 Unsigned_integer,
2493 Floating_point,
2494 Null,
2495 Double_precision_floating_point
2496 };
2497
2498 class rvalue;
2499 rvalue load(const char* data, size_t size);
2500
2501 namespace detail
2502 {
2504 struct r_string
2505 {
2506 r_string(){};
2507 r_string(char* s, char* e):
2508 s_(s), e_(e){};
2509 ~r_string()
2510 {
2511 if (owned_)
2512 delete[] s_;
2513 }
2514
2515 r_string(const r_string& r)
2516 {
2517 *this = r;
2518 }
2519
2520 r_string(r_string&& r)
2521 {
2522 *this = r;
2523 }
2524
2525 r_string& operator=(r_string&& r)
2526 {
2527 s_ = r.s_;
2528 e_ = r.e_;
2529 owned_ = r.owned_;
2530 if (r.owned_)
2531 r.owned_ = 0;
2532 return *this;
2533 }
2534
2535 r_string& operator=(const r_string& r)
2536 {
2537 s_ = r.s_;
2538 e_ = r.e_;
2539 owned_ = 0;
2540 return *this;
2541 }
2542
2543 operator std::string() const
2544 {
2545 return std::string(s_, e_);
2546 }
2547
2548
2549 const char* begin() const { return s_; }
2550 const char* end() const { return e_; }
2551 size_t size() const { return end() - begin(); }
2552
2553 using iterator = const char*;
2554 using const_iterator = const char*;
2555
2556 char* s_;
2557 mutable char* e_;
2558 uint8_t owned_{0};
2559 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const r_string& s)
2560 {
2561 os << static_cast<std::string>(s);
2562 return os;
2563 }
2564
2565 private:
2566 void force(char* s, uint32_t length)
2567 {
2568 s_ = s;
2569 e_ = s_ + length;
2570 owned_ = 1;
2571 }
2572 friend rvalue crow::json::load(const char* data, size_t size);
2573
2574 friend bool operator==(const r_string& l, const r_string& r);
2575 friend bool operator==(const std::string& l, const r_string& r);
2576 friend bool operator==(const r_string& l, const std::string& r);
2577
2578 template<typename T, typename U>
2579 inline static bool equals(const T& l, const U& r)
2580 {
2581 if (l.size() != r.size())
2582 return false;
2583
2584 for (size_t i = 0; i < l.size(); i++)
2585 {
2586 if (*(l.begin() + i) != *(r.begin() + i))
2587 return false;
2588 }
2589
2590 return true;
2591 }
2592 };
2593
2594 inline bool operator<(const r_string& l, const r_string& r)
2595 {
2596 return std::lexicographical_compare(l.begin(), l.end(), r.begin(), r.end());
2597 }
2598
2599 inline bool operator<(const r_string& l, const std::string& r)
2600 {
2601 return std::lexicographical_compare(l.begin(), l.end(), r.begin(), r.end());
2602 }
2603
2604 inline bool operator<(const std::string& l, const r_string& r)
2605 {
2606 return std::lexicographical_compare(l.begin(), l.end(), r.begin(), r.end());
2607 }
2608
2609 inline bool operator>(const r_string& l, const r_string& r)
2610 {
2611 return std::lexicographical_compare(l.begin(), l.end(), r.begin(), r.end());
2612 }
2613
2614 inline bool operator>(const r_string& l, const std::string& r)
2615 {
2616 return std::lexicographical_compare(l.begin(), l.end(), r.begin(), r.end());
2617 }
2618
2619 inline bool operator>(const std::string& l, const r_string& r)
2620 {
2621 return std::lexicographical_compare(l.begin(), l.end(), r.begin(), r.end());
2622 }
2623
2624 inline bool operator==(const r_string& l, const r_string& r)
2625 {
2626 return r_string::equals(l, r);
2627 }
2628
2629 inline bool operator==(const r_string& l, const std::string& r)
2630 {
2631 return r_string::equals(l, r);
2632 }
2633
2634 inline bool operator==(const std::string& l, const r_string& r)
2635 {
2636 return r_string::equals(l, r);
2637 }
2638
2639 inline bool operator!=(const r_string& l, const r_string& r)
2640 {
2641 return !(l == r);
2642 }
2643
2644 inline bool operator!=(const r_string& l, const std::string& r)
2645 {
2646 return !(l == r);
2647 }
2648
2649 inline bool operator!=(const std::string& l, const r_string& r)
2650 {
2651 return !(l == r);
2652 }
2653 } // namespace detail
2654
2656
2660 class rvalue
2661 {
2662 static const int cached_bit = 2;
2663 static const int error_bit = 4;
2664
2665 public:
2666 rvalue() noexcept:
2667 option_{error_bit}
2668 {
2669 }
2670 rvalue(type t) noexcept:
2671 lsize_{}, lremain_{}, t_{t}
2672 {
2673 }
2674 rvalue(type t, char* s, char* e) noexcept:
2675 start_{s}, end_{e}, t_{t}
2676 {
2677 determine_num_type();
2678 }
2679
2680 rvalue(const rvalue& r):
2681 start_(r.start_), end_(r.end_), key_(r.key_), t_(r.t_), nt_(r.nt_), option_(r.option_)
2682 {
2683 copy_l(r);
2684 }
2685
2686 rvalue(rvalue&& r) noexcept
2687 {
2688 *this = std::move(r);
2689 }
2690
2691 rvalue& operator=(const rvalue& r)
2692 {
2693 start_ = r.start_;
2694 end_ = r.end_;
2695 key_ = r.key_;
2696 t_ = r.t_;
2697 nt_ = r.nt_;
2698 option_ = r.option_;
2699 copy_l(r);
2700 return *this;
2701 }
2702 rvalue& operator=(rvalue&& r) noexcept
2703 {
2704 start_ = r.start_;
2705 end_ = r.end_;
2706 key_ = std::move(r.key_);
2707 l_ = std::move(r.l_);
2708 lsize_ = r.lsize_;
2709 lremain_ = r.lremain_;
2710 t_ = r.t_;
2711 nt_ = r.nt_;
2712 option_ = r.option_;
2713 return *this;
2714 }
2715
2716 explicit operator bool() const noexcept
2717 {
2718 return (option_ & error_bit) == 0;
2719 }
2720
2721 explicit operator int64_t() const
2722 {
2723 return i();
2724 }
2725
2726 explicit operator uint64_t() const
2727 {
2728 return u();
2729 }
2730
2731 explicit operator int() const
2732 {
2733 return static_cast<int>(i());
2734 }
2735
2737 explicit operator std::string() const
2738 {
2739#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2740 if (t() == type::Object || t() == type::List)
2741 throw std::runtime_error("json type container");
2742#endif
2743 switch (t())
2744 {
2745 case type::String:
2746 return std::string(s());
2747 case type::Null:
2748 return std::string("null");
2749 case type::True:
2750 return std::string("true");
2751 case type::False:
2752 return std::string("false");
2753 default:
2754 return std::string(start_, end_ - start_);
2755 }
2756 }
2757
2759 type t() const
2760 {
2761#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2762 if (option_ & error_bit)
2763 {
2764 throw std::runtime_error("invalid json object");
2765 }
2766#endif
2767 return t_;
2768 }
2769
2771 num_type nt() const
2772 {
2773#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2774 if (option_ & error_bit)
2775 {
2776 throw std::runtime_error("invalid json object");
2777 }
2778#endif
2779 return nt_;
2780 }
2781
2783 int64_t i() const
2784 {
2785#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2786 switch (t())
2787 {
2788 case type::Number:
2789 case type::String:
2790 return utility::lexical_cast<int64_t>(start_, end_ - start_);
2791 default:
2792 const std::string msg = "expected number, got: " + std::string(get_type_str(t()));
2793 throw std::runtime_error(msg);
2794 }
2795#endif
2796 return utility::lexical_cast<int64_t>(start_, end_ - start_);
2797 }
2798
2800 uint64_t u() const
2801 {
2802#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2803 switch (t())
2804 {
2805 case type::Number:
2806 case type::String:
2807 return utility::lexical_cast<uint64_t>(start_, end_ - start_);
2808 default:
2809 throw std::runtime_error(std::string("expected number, got: ") + get_type_str(t()));
2810 }
2811#endif
2812 return utility::lexical_cast<uint64_t>(start_, end_ - start_);
2813 }
2814
2816 double d() const
2817 {
2818#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2819 if (t() != type::Number)
2820 throw std::runtime_error("value is not number");
2821#endif
2822 return utility::lexical_cast<double>(start_, end_ - start_);
2823 }
2824
2826 bool b() const
2827 {
2828#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2829 if (t() != type::True && t() != type::False)
2830 throw std::runtime_error("value is not boolean");
2831#endif
2832 return t() == type::True;
2833 }
2834
2836 detail::r_string s() const
2837 {
2838#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2839 if (t() != type::String)
2840 throw std::runtime_error("value is not string");
2841#endif
2842 unescape();
2843 return detail::r_string{start_, end_};
2844 }
2845
2847 std::vector<rvalue> lo() const
2848 {
2849#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2850 if (t() != type::Object && t() != type::List)
2851 throw std::runtime_error("value is not a container");
2852#endif
2853 std::vector<rvalue> ret;
2854 ret.reserve(lsize_);
2855 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < lsize_; i++)
2856 {
2857 ret.emplace_back(l_[i]);
2858 }
2859 return ret;
2860 }
2861
2863 void unescape() const
2864 {
2865 if (*(start_ - 1))
2866 {
2867 char* head = start_;
2868 char* tail = start_;
2869 while (head != end_)
2870 {
2871 if (*head == '\\')
2872 {
2873 switch (*++head)
2874 {
2875 case '"': *tail++ = '"'; break;
2876 case '\\': *tail++ = '\\'; break;
2877 case '/': *tail++ = '/'; break;
2878 case 'b': *tail++ = '\b'; break;
2879 case 'f': *tail++ = '\f'; break;
2880 case 'n': *tail++ = '\n'; break;
2881 case 'r': *tail++ = '\r'; break;
2882 case 't': *tail++ = '\t'; break;
2883 case 'u':
2884 {
2885 auto from_hex = [](char c) {
2886 if (c >= 'a')
2887 return c - 'a' + 10;
2888 if (c >= 'A')
2889 return c - 'A' + 10;
2890 return c - '0';
2891 };
2892 unsigned int code =
2893 (from_hex(head[1]) << 12) +
2894 (from_hex(head[2]) << 8) +
2895 (from_hex(head[3]) << 4) +
2896 from_hex(head[4]);
2897 if (code >= 0x800)
2898 {
2899 *tail++ = 0xE0 | (code >> 12);
2900 *tail++ = 0x80 | ((code >> 6) & 0x3F);
2901 *tail++ = 0x80 | (code & 0x3F);
2902 }
2903 else if (code >= 0x80)
2904 {
2905 *tail++ = 0xC0 | (code >> 6);
2906 *tail++ = 0x80 | (code & 0x3F);
2907 }
2908 else
2909 {
2910 *tail++ = code;
2911 }
2912 head += 4;
2913 }
2914 break;
2915 }
2916 }
2917 else
2918 *tail++ = *head;
2919 head++;
2920 }
2921 end_ = tail;
2922 *end_ = 0;
2923 *(start_ - 1) = 0;
2924 }
2925 }
2926
2928 bool has(const char* str) const
2929 {
2930 return has(std::string(str));
2931 }
2932
2933 bool has(const std::string& str) const
2934 {
2935 struct Pred
2936 {
2937 bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const rvalue& r) const
2938 {
2939 return l.key_ < r.key_;
2940 };
2941 bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const std::string& r) const
2942 {
2943 return l.key_ < r;
2944 };
2945 bool operator()(const std::string& l, const rvalue& r) const
2946 {
2947 return l < r.key_;
2948 };
2949 };
2950 if (!is_cached())
2951 {
2952 std::sort(begin(), end(), Pred());
2953 set_cached();
2954 }
2955 auto it = lower_bound(begin(), end(), str, Pred());
2956 return it != end() && it->key_ == str;
2957 }
2958
2959 int count(const std::string& str) const
2960 {
2961 return has(str) ? 1 : 0;
2962 }
2963
2964 rvalue* begin() const
2965 {
2966#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2967 if (t() != type::Object && t() != type::List)
2968 throw std::runtime_error("value is not a container");
2969#endif
2970 return l_.get();
2971 }
2972 rvalue* end() const
2973 {
2974#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2975 if (t() != type::Object && t() != type::List)
2976 throw std::runtime_error("value is not a container");
2977#endif
2978 return l_.get() + lsize_;
2979 }
2980
2981 const detail::r_string& key() const
2982 {
2983 return key_;
2984 }
2985
2986 size_t size() const
2987 {
2988 if (t() == type::String)
2989 return s().size();
2990#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
2991 if (t() != type::Object && t() != type::List)
2992 throw std::runtime_error("value is not a container");
2993#endif
2994 return lsize_;
2995 }
2996
2997 const rvalue& operator[](int index) const
2998 {
2999#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
3000 if (t() != type::List)
3001 throw std::runtime_error("value is not a list");
3002 if (index >= static_cast<int>(lsize_) || index < 0)
3003 throw std::runtime_error("list out of bound");
3004#endif
3005 return l_[index];
3006 }
3007
3008 const rvalue& operator[](size_t index) const
3009 {
3010#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
3011 if (t() != type::List)
3012 throw std::runtime_error("value is not a list");
3013 if (index >= lsize_)
3014 throw std::runtime_error("list out of bound");
3015#endif
3016 return l_[index];
3017 }
3018
3019 const rvalue& operator[](const char* str) const
3020 {
3021 return this->operator[](std::string(str));
3022 }
3023
3024 const rvalue& operator[](const std::string& str) const
3025 {
3026#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
3027 if (t() != type::Object)
3028 throw std::runtime_error("value is not an object");
3029#endif
3030 struct Pred
3031 {
3032 bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const rvalue& r) const
3033 {
3034 return l.key_ < r.key_;
3035 };
3036 bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const std::string& r) const
3037 {
3038 return l.key_ < r;
3039 };
3040 bool operator()(const std::string& l, const rvalue& r) const
3041 {
3042 return l < r.key_;
3043 };
3044 };
3045 if (!is_cached())
3046 {
3047 std::sort(begin(), end(), Pred());
3048 set_cached();
3049 }
3050 auto it = lower_bound(begin(), end(), str, Pred());
3051 if (it != end() && it->key_ == str)
3052 return *it;
3053#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
3054 throw std::runtime_error("cannot find key: " + str);
3055#else
3056 static rvalue nullValue;
3057 return nullValue;
3058#endif
3059 }
3060
3061 void set_error()
3062 {
3063 option_ |= error_bit;
3064 }
3065
3066 bool error() const
3067 {
3068 return (option_ & error_bit) != 0;
3069 }
3070
3071 std::vector<std::string> keys() const
3072 {
3073#ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
3074 if (t() != type::Object)
3075 throw std::runtime_error("value is not an object");
3076#endif
3077 std::vector<std::string> ret;
3078 ret.reserve(lsize_);
3079 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < lsize_; i++)
3080 {
3081 ret.emplace_back(std::string(l_[i].key()));
3082 }
3083 return ret;
3084 }
3085
3086 private:
3087 bool is_cached() const
3088 {
3089 return (option_ & cached_bit) != 0;
3090 }
3091 void set_cached() const
3092 {
3093 option_ |= cached_bit;
3094 }
3095 void copy_l(const rvalue& r)
3096 {
3097 if (r.t() != type::Object && r.t() != type::List)
3098 return;
3099 lsize_ = r.lsize_;
3100 lremain_ = 0;
3101 l_.reset(new rvalue[lsize_]);
3102 std::copy(r.begin(), r.end(), begin());
3103 }
3104
3105 void emplace_back(rvalue&& v)
3106 {
3107 if (!lremain_)
3108 {
3109 int new_size = lsize_ + lsize_;
3110 if (new_size - lsize_ > 60000)
3111 new_size = lsize_ + 60000;
3112 if (new_size < 4)
3113 new_size = 4;
3114 rvalue* p = new rvalue[new_size];
3115 rvalue* p2 = p;
3116 for (auto& x : *this)
3117 *p2++ = std::move(x);
3118 l_.reset(p);
3119 lremain_ = new_size - lsize_;
3120 }
3121 l_[lsize_++] = std::move(v);
3122 lremain_--;
3123 }
3124
3126 void determine_num_type()
3127 {
3128 if (t_ != type::Number)
3129 {
3130 nt_ = num_type::Null;
3131 return;
3132 }
3133
3134 const std::size_t len = end_ - start_;
3135 const bool has_minus = std::memchr(start_, '-', len) != nullptr;
3136 const bool has_e = std::memchr(start_, 'e', len) != nullptr || std::memchr(start_, 'E', len) != nullptr;
3137 const bool has_dec_sep = std::memchr(start_, '.', len) != nullptr;
3138 if (has_dec_sep || has_e)
3139 nt_ = num_type::Floating_point;
3140 else if (has_minus)
3141 nt_ = num_type::Signed_integer;
3142 else
3143 nt_ = num_type::Unsigned_integer;
3144 }
3145
3146 mutable char* start_;
3147 mutable char* end_;
3148 detail::r_string key_;
3149 std::unique_ptr<rvalue[]> l_;
3150 uint32_t lsize_;
3151 uint16_t lremain_;
3152 type t_;
3153 num_type nt_{num_type::Null};
3154 mutable uint8_t option_{0};
3155
3156 friend rvalue load_nocopy_internal(char* data, size_t size);
3157 friend rvalue load(const char* data, size_t size);
3158 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const rvalue& r)
3159 {
3160 switch (r.t_)
3161 {
3162
3163 case type::Null: os << "null"; break;
3164 case type::False: os << "false"; break;
3165 case type::True: os << "true"; break;
3166 case type::Number:
3167 {
3168 switch (r.nt())
3169 {
3170 case num_type::Floating_point: os << r.d(); break;
3171 case num_type::Double_precision_floating_point: os << r.d(); break;
3172 case num_type::Signed_integer: os << r.i(); break;
3173 case num_type::Unsigned_integer: os << r.u(); break;
3174 case num_type::Null: throw std::runtime_error("Number with num_type Null");
3175 }
3176 }
3177 break;
3178 case type::String: os << '"' << r.s() << '"'; break;
3179 case type::List:
3180 {
3181 os << '[';
3182 bool first = true;
3183 for (auto& x : r)
3184 {
3185 if (!first)
3186 os << ',';
3187 first = false;
3188 os << x;
3189 }
3190 os << ']';
3191 }
3192 break;
3193 case type::Object:
3194 {
3195 os << '{';
3196 bool first = true;
3197 for (auto& x : r)
3198 {
3199 if (!first)
3200 os << ',';
3201 os << '"' << escape(x.key_) << "\":";
3202 first = false;
3203 os << x;
3204 }
3205 os << '}';
3206 }
3207 break;
3208 case type::Function: os << "custom function"; break;
3209 }
3210 return os;
3211 }
3212 };
3213 namespace detail
3214 {
3215 }
3216
3217 inline bool operator==(const rvalue& l, const std::string& r)
3218 {
3219 return l.s() == r;
3220 }
3221
3222 inline bool operator==(const std::string& l, const rvalue& r)
3223 {
3224 return l == r.s();
3225 }
3226
3227 inline bool operator!=(const rvalue& l, const std::string& r)
3228 {
3229 return l.s() != r;
3230 }
3231
3232 inline bool operator!=(const std::string& l, const rvalue& r)
3233 {
3234 return l != r.s();
3235 }
3236
3237 inline bool operator==(const rvalue& l, double r)
3238 {
3239 return l.d() == r;
3240 }
3241
3242 inline bool operator==(double l, const rvalue& r)
3243 {
3244 return l == r.d();
3245 }
3246
3247 inline bool operator!=(const rvalue& l, double r)
3248 {
3249 return l.d() != r;
3250 }
3251
3252 inline bool operator!=(double l, const rvalue& r)
3253 {
3254 return l != r.d();
3255 }
3256
3257
3258 inline rvalue load_nocopy_internal(char* data, size_t size)
3259 {
3260 // Defend against excessive recursion
3261 static constexpr unsigned max_depth = 10000;
3262
3263 //static const char* escaped = "\"\\/\b\f\n\r\t";
3264 struct Parser
3265 {
3266 Parser(char* data_, size_t /*size*/):
3267 data(data_)
3268 {
3269 }
3270
3271 bool consume(char c)
3272 {
3273 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(*data != c))
3274 return false;
3275 data++;
3276 return true;
3277 }
3278
3279 void ws_skip()
3280 {
3281 while (*data == ' ' || *data == '\t' || *data == '\r' || *data == '\n')
3282 ++data;
3283 };
3284
3285 rvalue decode_string()
3286 {
3287 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!consume('"')))
3288 return {};
3289 char* start = data;
3290 uint8_t has_escaping = 0;
3291 while (1)
3292 {
3293 if (CROW_LIKELY(*data != '"' && *data != '\\' && *data != '\0'))
3294 {
3295 data++;
3296 }
3297 else if (*data == '"')
3298 {
3299 *data = 0;
3300 *(start - 1) = has_escaping;
3301 data++;
3302 return {type::String, start, data - 1};
3303 }
3304 else if (*data == '\\')
3305 {
3306 has_escaping = 1;
3307 data++;
3308 switch (*data)
3309 {
3310 case 'u':
3311 {
3312 auto check = [](char c) {
3313 return ('0' <= c && c <= '9') ||
3314 ('a' <= c && c <= 'f') ||
3315 ('A' <= c && c <= 'F');
3316 };
3317 if (!(check(*(data + 1)) &&
3318 check(*(data + 2)) &&
3319 check(*(data + 3)) &&
3320 check(*(data + 4))))
3321 return {};
3322 }
3323 data += 5;
3324 break;
3325 case '"':
3326 case '\\':
3327 case '/':
3328 case 'b':
3329 case 'f':
3330 case 'n':
3331 case 'r':
3332 case 't':
3333 data++;
3334 break;
3335 default:
3336 return {};
3337 }
3338 }
3339 else
3340 return {};
3341 }
3342 return {};
3343 }
3344
3345 rvalue decode_list(unsigned depth)
3346 {
3347 rvalue ret(type::List);
3348 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!consume('[')) || CROW_UNLIKELY(depth > max_depth))
3349 {
3350 ret.set_error();
3351 return ret;
3352 }
3353 ws_skip();
3354 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(*data == ']'))
3355 {
3356 data++;
3357 return ret;
3358 }
3359
3360 while (1)
3361 {
3362 auto v = decode_value(depth + 1);
3363 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!v))
3364 {
3365 ret.set_error();
3366 break;
3367 }
3368 ws_skip();
3369 ret.emplace_back(std::move(v));
3370 if (*data == ']')
3371 {
3372 data++;
3373 break;
3374 }
3375 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!consume(',')))
3376 {
3377 ret.set_error();
3378 break;
3379 }
3380 ws_skip();
3381 }
3382 return ret;
3383 }
3384
3385 rvalue decode_number()
3386 {
3387 char* start = data;
3388
3389 enum NumberParsingState
3390 {
3391 Minus,
3392 AfterMinus,
3393 ZeroFirst,
3394 Digits,
3395 DigitsAfterPoints,
3396 E,
3397 DigitsAfterE,
3398 Invalid,
3399 } state{Minus};
3400 while (CROW_LIKELY(state != Invalid))
3401 {
3402 switch (*data)
3403 {
3404 case '0':
3405 state = static_cast<NumberParsingState>("\2\2\7\3\4\6\6"[state]);
3406 /*if (state == NumberParsingState::Minus || state == NumberParsingState::AfterMinus)
3407 {
3408 state = NumberParsingState::ZeroFirst;
3409 }
3410 else if (state == NumberParsingState::Digits ||
3411 state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE ||
3412 state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterPoints)
3413 {
3414 // ok; pass
3415 }
3416 else if (state == NumberParsingState::E)
3417 {
3418 state = NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE;
3419 }
3420 else
3421 return {};*/
3422 break;
3423 case '1':
3424 case '2':
3425 case '3':
3426 case '4':
3427 case '5':
3428 case '6':
3429 case '7':
3430 case '8':
3431 case '9':
3432 state = static_cast<NumberParsingState>("\3\3\7\3\4\6\6"[state]);
3433 while (*(data + 1) >= '0' && *(data + 1) <= '9')
3434 data++;
3435 /*if (state == NumberParsingState::Minus || state == NumberParsingState::AfterMinus)
3436 {
3437 state = NumberParsingState::Digits;
3438 }
3439 else if (state == NumberParsingState::Digits ||
