6522
6523 if (len == 0) {
6524 switch (parser->state) {
6525 case s_body_identity_eof:
6526 /* Use of CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY() here would erroneously return 1 byte read if we got paused. */
6527 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_NOADVANCE(message_complete);
6528 return 0;
6529
6530 case s_dead:
6531 case s_start_req:
6532 return 0;
6533
6534 default:
6535 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_EOF_STATE);
6536 return 1;
6537 }
6538 }
6539
6540
6541 if (parser->state == s_header_field)
6542 header_field_mark = data;
6543 if (parser->state == s_header_value)
6544 header_value_mark = data;
6545 switch (parser->state) {
6546 case s_req_path:
6547 case s_req_schema:
6548 case s_req_schema_slash:
6549 case s_req_schema_slash_slash:
6550 case s_req_server_start:
6551 case s_req_server:
6552 case s_req_server_with_at:
6553 case s_req_query_string_start:
6554 case s_req_query_string:
6555 url_mark = data;
6556 break;
6557 default:
6558 break;
6559 }
6560
6561 for (p=data; p != data + len; p++) {
6562 ch = *p;
6563
6564 if (CROW_PARSING_HEADER(parser->state))
6565 CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(1);
6566
6567reexecute:
6568 switch (parser->state) {
6569
6570 case s_dead:
6571 /* this state is used after a 'Connection: close' message
6572 * the parser will error out if it reads another message
6573 */
6574 if (CROW_LIKELY(ch == cr || ch == lf))
6575 break;
6576
6577 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_CLOSED_CONNECTION);
6578 goto error;
6579
6580 case s_start_req:
6581 {
6582 if (ch == cr || ch == lf)
6583 break;
6584 parser->flags = 0;
6585 parser->uses_transfer_encoding = 0;
6586 parser->content_length = CROW_ULLONG_MAX;
6587
6588 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_ALPHA(ch))) {
6589 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
6590 goto error;
6591 }
6592
6593 parser->method = 0;
6594 parser->index = 1;
6595 switch (ch) {
6596 case 'A': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Acl; break;
6597 case 'B': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Bind; break;
6598 case 'C': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Connect; /* or COPY, CHECKOUT */ break;
6599 case 'D': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Delete; break;
6600 case 'G': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Get; break;
6601 case 'H': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Head; break;
6602 case 'L': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Lock; /* or LINK */ break;
6603 case 'M': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::MkCol; /* or MOVE, MKACTIVITY, MERGE, M-SEARCH, MKCALENDAR */ break;
6604 case 'N': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Notify; break;
6605 case 'O': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Options; break;
6606 case 'P': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Post; /* or PROPFIND|PROPPATCH|PUT|PATCH|PURGE */ break;
6607 case 'R': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Report; /* or REBIND */ break;
6608 case 'S': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Subscribe; /* or SEARCH, SOURCE */ break;
6609 case 'T': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Trace; break;
6610 case 'U': parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Unlock; /* or UNSUBSCRIBE, UNBIND, UNLINK */ break;
6611 default:
6612 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
6613 goto error;
6614 }
6615 parser->state = s_req_method;
6616
6617 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_begin);
6618
6619 break;
6620 }
6621
6622 case s_req_method:
6623 {
6624 const char *matcher;
6625 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch == '\0')) {
6626 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
6627 goto error;
6628 }
6629
6630 matcher = method_strings[parser->method];
6631 if (ch == ' ' && matcher[parser->index] == '\0') {
6632 parser->state = s_req_spaces_before_url;
6633 } else if (ch == matcher[parser->index]) {
6634 ; /* nada */
6635 } else if ((ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') || ch == '-') {
6636
6637 switch (parser->method << 16 | parser->index << 8 | ch) {
6638#define CROW_XX(meth, pos, ch, new_meth) \
6639 case ((unsigned)HTTPMethod::meth << 16 | pos << 8 | ch): \
6640 parser->method = (unsigned)HTTPMethod::new_meth; break;
6641
6642 CROW_XX(Post, 1, 'U', Put)
6643 CROW_XX(Post, 1, 'A', Patch)
6644 CROW_XX(Post, 1, 'R', Propfind)
6645 CROW_XX(Put, 2, 'R', Purge)
6646 CROW_XX(Connect, 1, 'H', Checkout)
6647 CROW_XX(Connect, 2, 'P', Copy)
6648 CROW_XX(MkCol, 1, 'O', Move)
6649 CROW_XX(MkCol, 1, 'E', Merge)
6650 CROW_XX(MkCol, 1, '-', MSearch)
6651 CROW_XX(MkCol, 2, 'A', MkActivity)
6652 CROW_XX(MkCol, 3, 'A', MkCalendar)
6653 CROW_XX(Subscribe, 1, 'E', Search)
6654 CROW_XX(Subscribe, 1, 'O', Source)
6655 CROW_XX(Report, 2, 'B', Rebind)
6656 CROW_XX(Propfind, 4, 'P', Proppatch)
6657 CROW_XX(Lock, 1, 'I', Link)
6658 CROW_XX(Unlock, 2, 'S', Unsubscribe)
6659 CROW_XX(Unlock, 2, 'B', Unbind)
6660 CROW_XX(Unlock, 3, 'I', Unlink)
6661#undef CROW_XX
6662 default:
6663 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
6664 goto error;
6665 }
6666 } else {
6667 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_METHOD);
6668 goto error;
6669 }
6670
6671 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_NOADVANCE(method);
6672
6673 ++parser->index;
6674 break;
6675 }
6676
6677 case s_req_spaces_before_url:
6678 {
6679 if (ch == ' ') break;
6680
6681 CROW_MARK(url);
6682 CROW_MARK(url_start);
6683 if (parser->method == (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Connect) {
6684 parser->state = s_req_server_start;
6685 }
6686
6687 parser->state = parse_url_char(static_cast<state>(parser->state), ch, parser, url_start_mark, p);
6688 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->state == s_dead)) {
6689 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
6690 goto error;
6691 }
6692
6693 break;
6694 }
6695
6696 case s_req_schema:
6697 case s_req_schema_slash:
6698 case s_req_schema_slash_slash:
6699 case s_req_server_start:
6700 {
6701 switch (ch) {
6702 /* No whitespace allowed here */
6703 case ' ':
6704 case cr:
6705 case lf:
6706 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
6707 goto error;
6708 default:
6709 parser->state = parse_url_char(static_cast<state>(parser->state), ch, parser, url_start_mark, p);
6710 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->state == s_dead)) {
6711 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
6712 goto error;
6713 }
6714 }
6715
6716 break;
6717 }
6718
6719 case s_req_server:
6720 case s_req_server_with_at:
6721 case s_req_path:
6722 case s_req_query_string_start:
6723 case s_req_query_string:
6724 {
6725 switch (ch) {
6726 case ' ':
6727 parser->state = s_req_http_start;
6728 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(url);
6729 break;
6730 case cr: // No space after URL means no HTTP version. Which means the request is using HTTP/0.9
6731 case lf:
6732 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->method != (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Get)) // HTTP/0.9 doesn't define any method other than GET
6733 {
6734 parser->state = s_dead;
6735 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
6736 goto error;
6737 }
6738 parser->http_major = 0;
6739 parser->http_minor = 9;
6740 parser->state = (ch == cr) ?
6741 s_req_line_almost_done :
6742 s_header_field_start;
6743 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(url);
6744 break;
6745 default:
6746 parser->state = parse_url_char(static_cast<state>(parser->state), ch, parser, url_start_mark, p);
6747 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(parser->state == s_dead)) {
6748 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_URL);
6749 goto error;
6750 }
6751 }
6752 break;
6753 }
6754
6755 case s_req_http_start:
6756 switch (ch) {
6757 case ' ':
6758 break;
6759 case 'H':
6760 parser->state = s_req_http_H;
6761 break;
6762 case 'I':
6763 if (parser->method == (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Source) {
6764 parser->state = s_req_http_I;
6765 break;
6766 }
6767 /* fall through */
6768 default:
6769 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONSTANT);
6770 goto error;
6771 }
6772 break;
6773
6774 case s_req_http_H:
6775 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'T');
6776 parser->state = s_req_http_HT;
6777 break;
6778
6779 case s_req_http_HT:
6780 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'T');
6781 parser->state = s_req_http_HTT;
6782 break;
6783
6784 case s_req_http_HTT:
6785 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'P');
6786 parser->state = s_req_http_HTTP;
6787 break;
6788
6789 case s_req_http_I:
6790 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'C');
6791 parser->state = s_req_http_IC;
6792 break;
6793
6794 case s_req_http_IC:
6795 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != 'E');
6796 parser->state = s_req_http_HTTP; /* Treat "ICE" as "HTTP". */
6797 break;
6798
6799 case s_req_http_HTTP:
6800 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != '/');
6801 parser->state = s_req_http_major;
6802 break;
6803
6804 /* dot */
6805 case s_req_http_major:
6806 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
6807 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
6808 goto error;
6809 }
6810
6811 parser->http_major = ch - '0';
6812 parser->state = s_req_http_dot;
6813 break;
6814
6815 case s_req_http_dot:
6816 {
6817 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch != '.')) {
6818 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
6819 goto error;
6820 }
6821
6822 parser->state = s_req_http_minor;
6823 break;
6824 }
6825
6826 /* minor HTTP version */
6827 case s_req_http_minor:
6828 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
6829 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
6830 goto error;
6831 }
6832
6833 parser->http_minor = ch - '0';
6834 parser->state = s_req_http_end;
6835 break;
6836
6837 /* end of request line */
6838 case s_req_http_end:
6839 {
6840 if (ch == cr) {
6841 parser->state = s_req_line_almost_done;
6842 break;
6843 }
6844
6845 if (ch == lf) {
6846 parser->state = s_header_field_start;
6847 break;
6848 }
6849
6850 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_VERSION);
6851 goto error;
6852 break;
6853 }
6854
6855 /* end of request line */
6856 case s_req_line_almost_done:
6857 {
6858 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch != lf)) {
6859 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_LF_EXPECTED);
6860 goto error;
6861 }
6862
6863 parser->state = s_header_field_start;
6864 break;
6865 }
6866
6867 case s_header_field_start:
6868 {
6869 if (ch == cr) {
6870 parser->state = s_headers_almost_done;
6871 break;
6872 }
6873
6874 if (ch == lf) {
6875 /* they might be just sending \n instead of \r\n so this would be
6876 * the second \n to denote the end of headers*/
6877 parser->state = s_headers_almost_done;
6878 CROW_REEXECUTE();
6879 }
6880
6881 c = CROW_TOKEN(ch);
6882
6883 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!c)) {
6884 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
6885 goto error;
6886 }
6887
6888 CROW_MARK(header_field);
6889
6890 parser->index = 0;
6891 parser->state = s_header_field;
6892
6893 switch (c) {
6894 case 'c':
6895 parser->header_state = h_C;
6896 break;
6897
6898 case 'p':
6899 parser->header_state = h_matching_proxy_connection;
6900 break;
6901
6902 case 't':
6903 parser->header_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding;
6904 break;
6905
6906 case 'u':
6907 parser->header_state = h_matching_upgrade;
6908 break;
6909
6910 default:
6911 parser->header_state = h_general;
6912 break;
6913 }
6914 break;
6915 }
6916
6917 case s_header_field:
6918 {
6919 const char* start = p;
6920 for (; p != data + len; p++) {
6921 ch = *p;
6922 c = CROW_TOKEN(ch);
6923
6924 if (!c)
6925 break;
6926
6927 switch (parser->header_state) {
6928 case h_general: {
6929 size_t left = data + len - p;
6930 const char* pe = p + CROW_MIN(left, max_header_size);
6931 while (p+1 < pe && CROW_TOKEN(p[1])) {
6932 p++;
6933 }
6934 break;
6935 }
6936
6937 case h_C:
6938 parser->index++;
6939 parser->header_state = (c == 'o' ? h_CO : h_general);
6940 break;
6941
6942 case h_CO:
6943 parser->index++;
6944 parser->header_state = (c == 'n' ? h_CON : h_general);
6945 break;
6946
6947 case h_CON:
6948 parser->index++;
6949 switch (c) {
6950 case 'n':
6951 parser->header_state = h_matching_connection;
6952 break;
6953 case 't':
6954 parser->header_state = h_matching_content_length;
6955 break;
6956 default:
6957 parser->header_state = h_general;
6958 break;
6959 }
6960 break;
6961
6962 /* connection */
6963
6964 case h_matching_connection:
6965 parser->index++;
6966 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CONNECTION)-1 || c != CROW_CONNECTION[parser->index]) {
6967 parser->header_state = h_general;
6968 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CONNECTION)-2) {
6969 parser->header_state = h_connection;
6970 }
6971 break;
6972
6973 /* proxy-connection */
6974
6975 case h_matching_proxy_connection:
6976 parser->index++;
6977 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION)-1 || c != CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION[parser->index]) {
6978 parser->header_state = h_general;
6979 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION)-2) {
6980 parser->header_state = h_connection;
6981 }
6982 break;
6983
6984 /* content-length */
6985
6986 case h_matching_content_length:
6987 parser->index++;
6988 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH)-1 || c != CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH[parser->index]) {
6989 parser->header_state = h_general;
6990 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH)-2) {
6991 parser->header_state = h_content_length;
6992 }
6993 break;
6994
6995 /* transfer-encoding */
6996
6997 case h_matching_transfer_encoding:
6998 parser->index++;
6999 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING)-1 || c != CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING[parser->index]) {
7000 parser->header_state = h_general;
7001 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING)-2) {
7002 parser->header_state = h_transfer_encoding;
7003 parser->uses_transfer_encoding = 1;
7004 }
7005 break;
7006
7007 /* upgrade */
7008
7009 case h_matching_upgrade:
7010 parser->index++;
7011 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_UPGRADE)-1 || c != CROW_UPGRADE[parser->index]) {
7012 parser->header_state = h_general;
7013 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_UPGRADE)-2) {
7014 parser->header_state = h_upgrade;
7015 }
7016 break;
7017
7018 case h_connection:
7019 case h_content_length:
7020 case h_transfer_encoding:
7021 case h_upgrade:
7022 if (ch != ' ') parser->header_state = h_general;
7023 break;
7024
7025 default:
7026 assert(0 && "Unknown header_state");
7027 break;
7028 }
7029 }
7030
7031 if (p == data + len) {
7032 --p;
7033 CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
7034 break;
7035 }
7036
7037 CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
7038
7039 if (ch == ':') {
7040 parser->state = s_header_value_discard_ws;
7041 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_field);
7042 break;
7043 }
7044/* RFC-7230 Sec 3.2.4 expressly forbids line-folding in header field-names.
7045 if (ch == cr) {
7046 parser->state = s_header_almost_done;
7047 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_field);
7048 break;
7049 }
7050
7051 if (ch == lf) {
7052 parser->state = s_header_field_start;
7053 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_field);
7054 break;
7055 }
7056*/
7057 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
7058 goto error;
7059 }
7060
7061 case s_header_value_discard_ws:
7062 if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t') break;
7063
7064 if (ch == cr) {
7065 parser->state = s_header_value_discard_ws_almost_done;
7066 break;
7067 }
7068
7069 if (ch == lf) {
7070 parser->state = s_header_value_discard_lws;
7071 break;
7072 }
7073
7074 /* fall through */
7075
7076 case s_header_value_start:
7077 {
7078 CROW_MARK(header_value);
7079
7080 parser->state = s_header_value;
7081 parser->index = 0;
7082
7083 c = CROW_LOWER(ch);
7084
7085 switch (parser->header_state) {
7086 case h_upgrade:
7087 // Crow does not support HTTP/2 at the moment.
7088 // According to the RFC https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7540#section-3.2
7089 // "A server that does not support HTTP/2 can respond to the request as though the Upgrade header field were absent"
7090 // => `F_UPGRADE` is not set if the header starts by "h2".
7091 // This prevents the parser from skipping the request body.
7092 if (ch != 'h' || p+1 == (data + len) || *(p+1) != '2') {
7093 parser->flags |= F_UPGRADE;
7094 }
7095 parser->header_state = h_general;
7096 break;
7097
7098 case h_transfer_encoding:
7099 /* looking for 'Transfer-Encoding: chunked' */
7100 if ('c' == c) {
7101 parser->header_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_chunked;
7102 } else {
7103 parser->header_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
7104 }
7105 break;
7106
7107 /* Multi-value `Transfer-Encoding` header */
7108 case h_matching_transfer_encoding_token_start:
7109 break;
7110
7111 case h_content_length:
7112 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
7113 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7114 goto error;
7115 }
7116
7117 if (parser->flags & F_CONTENTLENGTH) {
7118 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7119 goto error;
7120 }
7121 parser->flags |= F_CONTENTLENGTH;
7122 parser->content_length = ch - '0';
7123 parser->header_state = h_content_length_num;
7124 break;
7125
7126 /* when obsolete line folding is encountered for content length
7127 * continue to the s_header_value state */
7128 case h_content_length_ws:
7129 break;
7130
7131 case h_connection:
7132 /* looking for 'Connection: keep-alive' */
7133 if (c == 'k') {
7134 parser->header_state = h_matching_connection_keep_alive;
7135 /* looking for 'Connection: close' */
7136 } else if (c == 'c') {
7137 parser->header_state = h_matching_connection_close;
7138 } else if (c == ' ' || c == '\t') {
7139 /* Skip lws */
7140 } else {
7141 parser->header_state = h_general;
7142 }
7143 break;
7144
7145 default:
7146 parser->header_state = h_general;
7147 break;
7148 }
7149 break;
7150 }
7151
7152 case s_header_value:
7153 {
7154 const char* start = p;
7155 enum header_states h_state = static_cast<header_states>(parser->header_state);
7156 for (; p != data + len; p++) {
7157 ch = *p;
7158
7159 if (ch == cr) {
7160 parser->state = s_header_almost_done;
7161 parser->header_state = h_state;
7162 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(header_value);
7163 break;
7164 }
7165
7166 if (ch == lf) {
7167 parser->state = s_header_almost_done;
7168 CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
7169 parser->header_state = h_state;
7170 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_value);
7171 CROW_REEXECUTE();
7172 }
7173
7174 if (!lenient && !CROW_IS_HEADER_CHAR(ch)) {
7175 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
7176 goto error;
7177 }
7178
7179 c = CROW_LOWER(ch);
7180
7181 switch (h_state) {
7182 case h_general:
7183 {
7184 size_t left = data + len - p;
7185 const char* pe = p + CROW_MIN(left, max_header_size);
7186
7187 for (; p != pe; p++) {
7188 ch = *p;
7189 if (ch == cr || ch == lf) {
7190 --p;
7191 break;
7192 }
7193 if (!lenient && !CROW_IS_HEADER_CHAR(ch)) {
7194 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_HEADER_TOKEN);
7195 goto error;
7196 }
7197 }
7198 if (p == data + len)
7199 --p;
7200 break;
7201 }
7202
7203 case h_connection:
7204 case h_transfer_encoding:
7205 assert(0 && "Shouldn't get here.");
7206 break;
7207
7208 case h_content_length:
7209 if (ch == ' ') break;
7210 h_state = h_content_length_num;
7211 /* fall through */
7212
7213 case h_content_length_num:
7214 {
7215 uint64_t t;
7216
7217 if (ch == ' ') {
7218 h_state = h_content_length_ws;
7219 break;
7220 }
7221
7222 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(!CROW_IS_NUM(ch))) {
7223 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7224 parser->header_state = h_state;
7225 goto error;
7226 }
7227
7228 t = parser->content_length;
7229 t *= 10;
7230 t += ch - '0';
7231
7232 /* Overflow? Test against a conservative limit for simplicity. */
7233 if (CROW_UNLIKELY((CROW_ULLONG_MAX - 10) / 10 < parser->content_length)) {
7234 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7235 parser->header_state = h_state;
7236 goto error;
7237 }
7238
7239 parser->content_length = t;
7240 break;
7241 }
7242
7243 case h_content_length_ws:
7244 if (ch == ' ') break;
7245 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7246 parser->header_state = h_state;
7247 goto error;
7248
7249 /* Transfer-Encoding: chunked */
7250 case h_matching_transfer_encoding_token_start:
7251 /* looking for 'Transfer-Encoding: chunked' */
7252 if ('c' == c) {
7253 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_chunked;
7254 } else if (CROW_TOKEN(c)) {
7255 /* TODO(indutny): similar code below does this, but why?
7256 * At the very least it seems to be inconsistent given that
7257 * h_matching_transfer_encoding_token does not check for
7258 * `STRICT_TOKEN`
7259 */
7260 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
7261 } else if (c == ' ' || c == '\t') {
7262 /* Skip lws */
7263 } else {
7264 h_state = h_general;
7265 }
7266 break;
7267
7268 case h_matching_transfer_encoding_chunked:
7269 parser->index++;
7270 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CHUNKED)-1 || c != CROW_CHUNKED[parser->index]) {
7271 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
7272 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CHUNKED)-2) {
7273 h_state = h_transfer_encoding_chunked;
7274 }
7275 break;
7276
7277 case h_matching_transfer_encoding_token:
7278 if (ch == ',') {
7279 h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token_start;
7280 parser->index = 0;
7281 }
7282 break;
7283
7284 /* looking for 'Connection: keep-alive' */
7285 case h_matching_connection_keep_alive:
7286 parser->index++;
7287 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_KEEP_ALIVE)-1 || c != CROW_KEEP_ALIVE[parser->index]) {
7288 h_state = h_general;
7289 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_KEEP_ALIVE)-2) {
7290 h_state = h_connection_keep_alive;
7291 }
7292 break;
7293
7294 /* looking for 'Connection: close' */
7295 case h_matching_connection_close:
7296 parser->index++;
7297 if (parser->index > sizeof(CROW_CLOSE)-1 || c != CROW_CLOSE[parser->index]) {
7298 h_state = h_general;
7299 } else if (parser->index == sizeof(CROW_CLOSE)-2) {
7300 h_state = h_connection_close;
7301 }
7302 break;
7303
7304 // Edited from original (because of commits that werent included)
7305 case h_transfer_encoding_chunked:
7306 if (ch != ' ') h_state = h_matching_transfer_encoding_token;
7307 break;
7308 case h_connection_keep_alive:
7309 case h_connection_close:
7310 if (ch != ' ') h_state = h_general;
7311 break;
7312
7313 default:
7314 parser->state = s_header_value;
7315 h_state = h_general;
7316 break;
7317 }
7318 }
7319 parser->header_state = h_state;
7320
7321
7322 if (p == data + len)
7323 --p;
7324
7325 CROW_COUNT_HEADER_SIZE(p - start);
7326 break;
7327 }
7328
7329 case s_header_almost_done:
7330 {
7331 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(ch != lf)) {
7332 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_LF_EXPECTED);
7333 goto error;
7334 }
7335
7336 parser->state = s_header_value_lws;
7337 break;
7338 }
7339
7340 case s_header_value_lws:
7341 {
7342 if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t') {
7343 if (parser->header_state == h_content_length_num) {
7344 /* treat obsolete line folding as space */
7345 parser->header_state = h_content_length_ws;
7346 }
7347 parser->state = s_header_value_start;
7348 CROW_REEXECUTE();
7349 }
7350
7351 /* finished the header */
7352 switch (parser->header_state) {
7353 case h_connection_keep_alive:
7354 parser->flags |= F_CONNECTION_KEEP_ALIVE;
7355 break;
7356 case h_connection_close:
7357 parser->flags |= F_CONNECTION_CLOSE;
7358 break;
7359 case h_transfer_encoding_chunked:
7360 parser->flags |= F_CHUNKED;
7361 break;
7362 default:
7363 break;
7364 }
7365
7366 parser->state = s_header_field_start;
7367 CROW_REEXECUTE();
7368 }
7369
7370 case s_header_value_discard_ws_almost_done:
7371 {
7372 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
7373 parser->state = s_header_value_discard_lws;
7374 break;
7375 }
7376
7377 case s_header_value_discard_lws:
7378 {
7379 if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t') {
7380 parser->state = s_header_value_discard_ws;
7381 break;
7382 } else {
7383 /* header value was empty */
7384 CROW_MARK(header_value);
7385 parser->state = s_header_field_start;
7386 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_value);
7387 CROW_REEXECUTE();
7388 }
7389 }
7390
7391 case s_headers_almost_done:
7392 {
7393 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
7394
7395 if (parser->flags & F_TRAILING) {
7396 /* End of a chunked request */
7397 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
7398 break;
7399 }
7400
7401 /* Cannot use transfer-encoding and a content-length header together
7402 per the HTTP specification. (RFC 7230 Section 3.3.3) */
7403 if ((parser->uses_transfer_encoding == 1) &&
7404 (parser->flags & F_CONTENTLENGTH)) {
7405 /* Allow it for lenient parsing as long as `Transfer-Encoding` is
7406 * not `chunked` or allow_length_with_encoding is set
7407 */
7408 if (parser->flags & F_CHUNKED) {
7409 if (!allow_chunked_length) {
7410 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7411 goto error;
7412 }
7413 } else if (!lenient) {
7414 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7415 goto error;
7416 }
7417 }
7418
7419 parser->state = s_headers_done;
7420
7421 /* Set this here so that on_headers_complete() callbacks can see it */
7422 parser->upgrade =
7423 (parser->flags & F_UPGRADE || parser->method == (unsigned)HTTPMethod::Connect);
7424
7425 /* Here we call the headers_complete callback. This is somewhat
7426 * different than other callbacks because if the user returns 1, we
7427 * will interpret that as saying that this message has no body. This
7428 * is needed for the annoying case of recieving a response to a HEAD
7429 * request.
7430 *
7431 * We'd like to use CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_NOADVANCE() here but we cannot, so
7432 * we have to simulate it by handling a change in errno below.
7433 */
7434 if (settings->on_headers_complete) {
7435 switch (settings->on_headers_complete(parser)) {
7436 case 0:
7437 break;
7438
7439 case 2:
7440 parser->upgrade = 1;
7441 //break;
7442
7443 /* fall through */
7444 case 1:
7445 parser->flags |= F_SKIPBODY;
7446 break;
7447
7448 default:
7449 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_CB_headers_complete);
7450 parser->nread = nread;
7451 return p - data; /* Error */
7452 }
7453 }
7454
7455 if (CROW_HTTP_PARSER_ERRNO(parser) != CHPE_OK) {
7456 parser->nread = nread;
7457 return p - data;
7458 }
7459
7460 CROW_REEXECUTE();
7461 }
7462
7463 case s_headers_done:
7464 {
7465 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
7466
7467 parser->nread = 0;
7468 nread = 0;
7469
7470 /* Exit, the rest of the connect is in a different protocol. */
7471 if (parser->upgrade) {
7472 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
7473 parser->nread = nread;
7474 return (p - data) + 1;
7475 }
7476
7477 if (parser->flags & F_SKIPBODY) {
7478 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
7479 } else if (parser->flags & F_CHUNKED) {
7480 /* chunked encoding - ignore Content-Length header,
7481 * prepare for a chunk */
7482 parser->state = s_chunk_size_start;
7483 }
7484 else if (parser->uses_transfer_encoding == 1)
7485 {
7486 if (!lenient)
7487 {
7488 /* RFC 7230 3.3.3 */
7489
7490 /* If a Transfer-Encoding header field
7491 * is present in a request and the chunked transfer coding is not
7492 * the final encoding, the message body length cannot be determined
7493 * reliably; the server MUST respond with the 400 (Bad Request)
7494 * status code and then close the connection.
7495 */
7496 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_TRANSFER_ENCODING);
7497 parser->nread = nread;
7498 return (p - data); /* Error */
7499 }
7500 else
7501 {
7502 /* RFC 7230 3.3.3 */
7503
7504 /* If a Transfer-Encoding header field is present in a response and
7505 * the chunked transfer coding is not the final encoding, the
7506 * message body length is determined by reading the connection until
7507 * it is closed by the server.
7508 */
7509 parser->state = s_body_identity_eof;
7510 }
7511 }
7512 else
7513 {
7514 if (parser->content_length == 0)
7515 {
7516 /* Content-Length header given but zero: Content-Length: 0\r\n */
7517 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
7518 }
7519 else if (parser->content_length != CROW_ULLONG_MAX)
7520 {
7521 /* Content-Length header given and non-zero */
7522 parser->state = s_body_identity;
7523 }
7524 else
7525 {
7526 /* Assume content-length 0 - read the next */
7527 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
7528 }
7529 }
7530
7531 break;
7532 }
7533
7534 case s_body_identity:
7535 {
7536 uint64_t to_read = CROW_MIN(parser->content_length,
7537 (uint64_t) ((data + len) - p));
7538
7539 assert(parser->content_length != 0
7540 && parser->content_length != CROW_ULLONG_MAX);
7541
7542 /* The difference between advancing content_length and p is because
7543 * the latter will automaticaly advance on the next loop iteration.
7544 * Further, if content_length ends up at 0, we want to see the last
7545 * byte again for our message complete callback.
7546 */
7547 CROW_MARK(body);
7548 parser->content_length -= to_read;
7549 p += to_read - 1;
7550
7551 if (parser->content_length == 0) {
7552 parser->state = s_message_done;
7553
7554 /* Mimic CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE() but with one extra byte.
7555 *
7556 * The alternative to doing this is to wait for the next byte to
7557 * trigger the data callback, just as in every other case. The
7558 * problem with this is that this makes it difficult for the test
7559 * harness to distinguish between complete-on-EOF and
7560 * complete-on-length. It's not clear that this distinction is
7561 * important for applications, but let's keep it for now.
7562 */
7563 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_(body, p - body_mark + 1, p - data);
7564 CROW_REEXECUTE();
7565 }
7566
7567 break;
7568 }
7569
7570 /* read until EOF */
7571 case s_body_identity_eof:
7572 CROW_MARK(body);
7573 p = data + len - 1;
7574
7575 break;
7576
7577 case s_message_done:
7578 CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY(message_complete);
7579 break;
7580
7581 case s_chunk_size_start:
7582 {
7583 assert(nread == 1);
7584 assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
7585
7586 unhex_val = unhex[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
7587 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(unhex_val == -1)) {
7588 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CHUNK_SIZE);
7589 goto error;
7590 }
7591
7592 parser->content_length = unhex_val;
7593 parser->state = s_chunk_size;
7594 break;
7595 }
7596
7597 case s_chunk_size:
7598 {
7599 uint64_t t;
7600
7601 assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
7602
7603 if (ch == cr) {
7604 parser->state = s_chunk_size_almost_done;
7605 break;
7606 }
7607
7608 unhex_val = unhex[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
7609
7610 if (unhex_val == -1) {
7611 if (ch == ';' || ch == ' ') {
7612 parser->state = s_chunk_parameters;
7613 break;
7614 }
7615
7616 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CHUNK_SIZE);
7617 goto error;
7618 }
7619
7620 t = parser->content_length;
7621 t *= 16;
7622 t += unhex_val;
7623
7624 /* Overflow? Test against a conservative limit for simplicity. */
7625 if (CROW_UNLIKELY((CROW_ULLONG_MAX - 16) / 16 < parser->content_length)) {
7626 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_CONTENT_LENGTH);
7627 goto error;
7628 }
7629
7630 parser->content_length = t;
7631 break;
7632 }
7633
7634 case s_chunk_parameters:
7635 {
7636 assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
7637 /* just ignore this shit. TODO check for overflow */
7638 if (ch == cr) {
7639 parser->state = s_chunk_size_almost_done;
7640 break;
7641 }
7642 break;
7643 }
7644
7645 case s_chunk_size_almost_done:
7646 {
7647 assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
7648 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
7649
7650 parser->nread = 0;
7651 nread = 0;
7652
7653 if (parser->content_length == 0) {
7654 parser->flags |= F_TRAILING;
7655 parser->state = s_header_field_start;
7656 } else {
7657 parser->state = s_chunk_data;
7658 }
7659 break;
7660 }
7661
7662 case s_chunk_data:
7663 {
7664 uint64_t to_read = CROW_MIN(parser->content_length,
7665 (uint64_t) ((data + len) - p));
7666
7667 assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
7668 assert(parser->content_length != 0
7669 && parser->content_length != CROW_ULLONG_MAX);
7670
7671 /* See the explanation in s_body_identity for why the content
7672 * length and data pointers are managed this way.
7673 */
7674 CROW_MARK(body);
7675 parser->content_length -= to_read;
7676 p += to_read - 1;
7677
7678 if (parser->content_length == 0) {
7679 parser->state = s_chunk_data_almost_done;
7680 }
7681
7682 break;
7683 }
7684
7685 case s_chunk_data_almost_done:
7686 assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
7687 assert(parser->content_length == 0);
7688 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != cr);
7689 parser->state = s_chunk_data_done;
7690 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA(body);
7691 break;
7692
7693 case s_chunk_data_done:
7694 assert(parser->flags & F_CHUNKED);
7695 CROW_STRICT_CHECK(ch != lf);
7696 parser->nread = 0;
7697 nread = 0;
7698 parser->state = s_chunk_size_start;
7699 break;
7700
7701 default:
7702 assert(0 && "unhandled state");
7703 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_INVALID_INTERNAL_STATE);
7704 goto error;
7705 }
7706 }
7707
7708 /* Run callbacks for any marks that we have leftover after we ran out of
7709 * bytes. There should be at most one of these set, so it's OK to invoke
7710 * them in series (unset marks will not result in callbacks).
7711 *
7712 * We use the NOADVANCE() variety of callbacks here because 'p' has already
7713 * overflowed 'data' and this allows us to correct for the off-by-one that
7714 * we'd otherwise have (since CROW_CALLBACK_DATA() is meant to be run with a 'p'
7715 * value that's in-bounds).
7716 */
7717
7718 assert(((header_field_mark ? 1 : 0) +
7719 (header_value_mark ? 1 : 0) +
7720 (url_mark ? 1 : 0) +
7721 (body_mark ? 1 : 0)) <= 1);
7722
7723 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_field);
7724 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(header_value);
7725 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(url);
7726 CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE(body);
7727
7728 parser->nread = nread;
7729 return len;
7730
7731error:
7732 if (CROW_HTTP_PARSER_ERRNO(parser) == CHPE_OK) {
7733 CROW_SET_ERRNO(CHPE_UNKNOWN);
7734 }
7735
7736 parser->nread = nread;
7737 return (p - data);
7738}
7739
7740inline void
7741 http_parser_init(http_parser* parser)
7742{
7743 void *data = parser->data; /* preserve application data */
7744 memset(parser, 0, sizeof(*parser));
7745 parser->data = data;
7746 parser->state = s_start_req;
7747 parser->http_errno = CHPE_OK;
7748}
7749
7750/* Return a string name of the given error */
7751inline const char *
7752http_errno_name(enum http_errno err) {
7753/* Map errno values to strings for human-readable output */
7754#define CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN(n, s) { "CHPE_" #n, s },
7755static struct {
7756 const char *name;
7757 const char *description;
7758} http_strerror_tab[] = {
7759 CROW_HTTP_ERRNO_MAP(CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN)
7760};
7761#undef CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN
7762 assert(((size_t) err) < CROW_ARRAY_SIZE(http_strerror_tab));
7763 return http_strerror_tab[err].name;
7764}
7765
7766/* Return a string description of the given error */
7767inline const char *
7768http_errno_description(enum http_errno err) {
7769/* Map errno values to strings for human-readable output */
7770#define CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN(n, s) { "CHPE_" #n, s },
7771static struct {
7772 const char *name;
7773 const char *description;
7774} http_strerror_tab[] = {
7775 CROW_HTTP_ERRNO_MAP(CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN)
7776};
7777#undef CROW_HTTP_STRERROR_GEN
7778 assert(((size_t) err) < CROW_ARRAY_SIZE(http_strerror_tab));
7779 return http_strerror_tab[err].description;
7780}
7781
7782/* Checks if this is the final chunk of the body. */
7783inline int
7784http_body_is_final(const struct http_parser *parser) {
7785 return parser->state == s_message_done;
7786}
7787
7788/* Change the maximum header size provided at compile time. */
7789inline void
7790http_parser_set_max_header_size(uint32_t size) {
7791 max_header_size = size;
7792}
7793
7794#undef CROW_HTTP_ERRNO_MAP
7795#undef CROW_SET_ERRNO
7796#undef CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_
7797#undef CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY
7798#undef CROW_CALLBACK_NOTIFY_NOADVANCE
7799#undef CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_
7800#undef CROW_CALLBACK_DATA
7801#undef CROW_CALLBACK_DATA_NOADVANCE
7802#undef CROW_MARK
7803#undef CROW_PROXY_CONNECTION
7804#undef CROW_CONNECTION
7805#undef CROW_CONTENT_LENGTH
7806#undef CROW_TRANSFER_ENCODING
7807#undef CROW_UPGRADE
7808#undef CROW_CHUNKED
7809#undef CROW_KEEP_ALIVE
7810#undef CROW_CLOSE
7811#undef CROW_PARSING_HEADER
7812#undef CROW_LOWER
7813#undef CROW_IS_ALPHA
7814#undef CROW_IS_NUM
7815#undef CROW_IS_ALPHANUM
7816//#undef CROW_IS_HEX
7817#undef CROW_IS_MARK
7818#undef CROW_IS_USERINFO_CHAR
7819#undef CROW_TOKEN
7820#undef CROW_IS_URL_CHAR
7821//#undef CROW_IS_HOST_CHAR
7822#undef CROW_STRICT_CHECK
7823
7824}
7825
7826// clang-format on
7827
7828
7829#include <string_view>
7830#include <locale>
7831#include <unordered_map>
7832
7833
7834namespace crow
7835{
7837 struct ci_hash
7838 {
7839 size_t operator()(const std::string_view key) const
7840 {
7841 std::size_t seed = 0;
7842 std::locale locale;
7843
7844 for (auto c : key)
7845 hash_combine(seed, std::toupper(c, locale));
7846
7847 return seed;
7848 }
7849
7850 private:
7851 static inline void hash_combine(std::size_t& seed, char v)
7852 {
7853 std::hash<char> hasher;
7854 seed ^= hasher(v) + 0x9e3779b9 + (seed << 6) + (seed >> 2);
7855 }
7856 };
7857
7859 struct ci_key_eq
7860 {
7861 bool operator()(const std::string_view l, const std::string_view r) const
7862 {
7863 return utility::string_equals(l, r);
7864 }
7865 };
7866
7867 using ci_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string, std::string, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
7868} // namespace crow
7869
7870
7871#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
7872#include <boost/asio.hpp>
7873#else
7874#ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
7875#define ASIO_STANDALONE
7876#endif
7877#include <asio.hpp>
7878#endif
7879
7880
7881namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
7882{
7883#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
7884 namespace asio = boost::asio;
7885#endif
7886
7888 template<typename T>
7889 inline const std::string& get_header_value(const T& headers, const std::string& key)
7890 {
7891 if (headers.count(key))
7892 {
7893 return headers.find(key)->second;
7894 }
7895 static std::string empty;
7896 return empty;
7897 }
7898
7900 struct request
7901 {
7902 HTTPMethod method;
7903 std::string raw_url;
7904 std::string url;
7905 query_string url_params;
7906 ci_map headers;
7907 std::string body;
7908 std::string remote_ip_address;
7909 unsigned char http_ver_major, http_ver_minor;
7910 bool keep_alive,
7911 close_connection,
7912 upgrade;
7913
7914 void* middleware_context{};
7915 void* middleware_container{};
7916 asio::io_context* io_context{};
7917
7919 request():
7920 method(HTTPMethod::Get)
7921 {}
7922
7924 request(HTTPMethod method_, std::string raw_url_, std::string url_, query_string url_params_, ci_map headers_, std::string body_, unsigned char http_major, unsigned char http_minor, bool has_keep_alive, bool has_close_connection, bool is_upgrade):
7925 method(method_), raw_url(std::move(raw_url_)), url(std::move(url_)), url_params(std::move(url_params_)), headers(std::move(headers_)), body(std::move(body_)), http_ver_major(http_major), http_ver_minor(http_minor), keep_alive(has_keep_alive), close_connection(has_close_connection), upgrade(is_upgrade)
7926 {}
7927
7928 void add_header(std::string key, std::string value)
7929 {
7930 headers.emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
7931 }
7932
7933 const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key) const
7934 {
7935 return crow::get_header_value(headers, key);
7936 }
7937
7938 bool check_version(unsigned char major, unsigned char minor) const
7939 {
7940 return http_ver_major == major && http_ver_minor == minor;
7941 }
7942
7944
7947 const query_string get_body_params() const
7948 {
7949 return query_string(body, false);
7950 }
7951
7953 template<typename CompletionHandler>
7954 void post(CompletionHandler handler)
7955 {
7956 asio::post(io_context, handler);
7957 }
7958
7960 template<typename CompletionHandler>
7961 void dispatch(CompletionHandler handler)
7962 {
7963 asio::dispatch(io_context, handler);
7964 }
7965 };
7966} // namespace crow
7967
7968#include <array>
7969
7970namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
7971{
7972#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
7973 namespace asio = boost::asio;
7974 using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
7975#else
7976 using error_code = asio::error_code;
7977#endif
7978
7986 namespace websocket
7987 {
7988 enum class WebSocketReadState
7989 {
7990 MiniHeader,
7991 Len16,
7992 Len64,
7993 Mask,
7994 Payload,
7995 };
7996
7997 // Codes taken from https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6455#section-7.4.1
7998 enum CloseStatusCode : uint16_t {
7999 NormalClosure = 1000,
8000 EndpointGoingAway = 1001,
8001 ProtocolError = 1002,
8002 UnacceptableData = 1003,
8003 InconsistentData = 1007,
8004 PolicyViolated = 1008,
8005 MessageTooBig = 1009,
8006 ExtensionsNotNegotiated = 1010,
8007 UnexpectedCondition = 1011,
8008
8009 // Reserved for applications only, should not send/receive these to/from clients
8010 NoStatusCodePresent = 1005,
8011 ClosedAbnormally = 1006,
8012 TLSHandshakeFailure = 1015,
8013
8014 StartStatusCodesForLibraries = 3000,
8015 StartStatusCodesForPrivateUse = 4000,
8016 // Status code should be between 1000 and 4999 inclusive
8017 StartStatusCodes = NormalClosure,
8018 EndStatusCodes = 4999,
8019 };
8020
8022 struct connection
8023 {
8024 virtual void send_binary(std::string msg) = 0;
8025 virtual void send_text(std::string msg) = 0;
8026 virtual void send_ping(std::string msg) = 0;
8027 virtual void send_pong(std::string msg) = 0;
8028 virtual void close(std::string const& msg = "quit", uint16_t status_code = CloseStatusCode::NormalClosure) = 0;
8029 virtual std::string get_remote_ip() = 0;
8030 virtual std::string get_subprotocol() const = 0;
8031 virtual ~connection() = default;
8032
8033 void userdata(void* u) { userdata_ = u; }
8034 void* userdata() { return userdata_; }
8035
8036 private:
8037 void* userdata_;
8038 };
8039
8040 // Modified version of the illustration in RFC6455 Section-5.2
8041 //
8042 //
8043 // 0 1 2 3 -byte
8044 // 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 -bit
8045 // +-+-+-+-+-------+-+-------------+-------------------------------+
8046 // |F|R|R|R| opcode|M| Payload len | Extended payload length |
8047 // |I|S|S|S| (4) |A| (7) | (16/64) |
8048 // |N|V|V|V| |S| | (if payload len==126/127) |
8049 // | |1|2|3| |K| | |
8050 // +-+-+-+-+-------+-+-------------+ - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +
8051 // | Extended payload length continued, if payload len == 127 |
8052 // + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +-------------------------------+
8053 // | |Masking-key, if MASK set to 1 |
8054 // +-------------------------------+-------------------------------+
8055 // | Masking-key (continued) | Payload Data |
8056 // +-------------------------------- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +
8057 // : Payload Data continued ... :
8058 // + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - +
8059 // | Payload Data continued ... |
8060 // +---------------------------------------------------------------+
8061 //
8062
8064
8065 template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler>
8066 class Connection : public connection
8067 {
8068 public:
8070
8074 Connection(const crow::request& req, Adaptor&& adaptor, Handler* handler,
8075 uint64_t max_payload, const std::vector<std::string>& subprotocols,
8076 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&)> open_handler,
8077 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, bool)> message_handler,
8078 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, uint16_t)> close_handler,
8079 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&)> error_handler,
8080 std::function<bool(const crow::request&, void**)> accept_handler,
8081 bool mirror_protocols):
8082 adaptor_(std::move(adaptor)),
8083 handler_(handler),
8084 max_payload_bytes_(max_payload),
8085 open_handler_(std::move(open_handler)),
8086 message_handler_(std::move(message_handler)),
8087 close_handler_(std::move(close_handler)),
8088 error_handler_(std::move(error_handler)),
8089 accept_handler_(std::move(accept_handler))
8090 {
8091 if (!utility::string_equals(req.get_header_value("upgrade"), "websocket"))
8092 {
8093 adaptor_.close();
8094 handler_->remove_websocket(this);
8095 delete this;
8096 return;
8097 }
8098
8099 std::string requested_subprotocols_header = req.get_header_value("Sec-WebSocket-Protocol");
8100 if (!subprotocols.empty() || !requested_subprotocols_header.empty())
8101 {
8102 auto requested_subprotocols = utility::split(requested_subprotocols_header, ", ");
8103 auto subprotocol = utility::find_first_of(subprotocols.begin(), subprotocols.end(), requested_subprotocols.begin(), requested_subprotocols.end());
8104 if (subprotocol != subprotocols.end())
8105 {
8106 subprotocol_ = *subprotocol;
8107 }
8108 }
8109
8110 if (mirror_protocols & !requested_subprotocols_header.empty())
8111 {
8112 subprotocol_ = requested_subprotocols_header;
8113 }
8114
8115 if (accept_handler_)
8116 {
8117 void* ud = nullptr;
8118 if (!accept_handler_(req, &ud))
8119 {
8120 adaptor_.close();
8121 handler_->remove_websocket(this);
8122 delete this;
8123 return;
8124 }
8125 userdata(ud);
8126 }
8127
8128 // Sec-WebSocket-Key: dGhlIHNhbXBsZSBub25jZQ==
8129 // Sec-WebSocket-Version: 13
8130 std::string magic = req.get_header_value("Sec-WebSocket-Key") + "258EAFA5-E914-47DA-95CA-C5AB0DC85B11";
8131 sha1::SHA1 s;
8132 s.processBytes(magic.data(), magic.size());
8133 uint8_t digest[20];
8134 s.getDigestBytes(digest);
8135
8136 start(crow::utility::base64encode((unsigned char*)digest, 20));
8137 }
8138
8139 ~Connection() noexcept override
8140 {
8141 // Do not modify anchor_ here since writing shared_ptr is not atomic.
8142 auto watch = std::weak_ptr<void>{anchor_};
8143
8144 // Wait until all unhandled asynchronous operations to join.
8145 // As the deletion occurs inside 'check_destroy()', which already locks
8146 // anchor, use count can be 1 on valid deletion context.
8147 while (watch.use_count() > 2) // 1 for 'check_destroy() routine', 1 for 'this->anchor_'
8148 {
8149 std::this_thread::yield();
8150 }
8151 }
8152
8153 template<typename Callable>
8154 struct WeakWrappedMessage
8155 {
8156 Callable callable;
8157 std::weak_ptr<void> watch;
8158
8159 void operator()()
8160 {
8161 if (auto anchor = watch.lock())
8162 {
8163 std::move(callable)();
8164 }
8165 }
8166 };
8167
8169 template<typename CompletionHandler>
8170 void dispatch(CompletionHandler&& handler)
8171 {
8172 asio::dispatch(adaptor_.get_io_context(),
8173 WeakWrappedMessage<typename std::decay<CompletionHandler>::type>{
8174 std::forward<CompletionHandler>(handler), anchor_});
8175 }
8176
8178 template<typename CompletionHandler>
8179 void post(CompletionHandler&& handler)
8180 {
8181 asio::post(adaptor_.get_io_context(),
8182 WeakWrappedMessage<typename std::decay<CompletionHandler>::type>{
8183 std::forward<CompletionHandler>(handler), anchor_});
8184 }
8185
8187
8190 void send_ping(std::string msg) override
8191 {
8192 send_data(0x9, std::move(msg));
8193 }
8194
8196
8199 void send_pong(std::string msg) override
8200 {
8201 send_data(0xA, std::move(msg));
8202 }
8203
8205 void send_binary(std::string msg) override
8206 {
8207 send_data(0x2, std::move(msg));
8208 }
8209
8211 void send_text(std::string msg) override
8212 {
8213 send_data(0x1, std::move(msg));
8214 }
8215
8217
8220 void close(std::string const& msg, uint16_t status_code) override
8221 {
8222 dispatch([this, msg, status_code]() mutable {
8223 has_sent_close_ = true;
8224 if (has_recv_close_ && !is_close_handler_called_)
8225 {
8226 is_close_handler_called_ = true;
8227 if (close_handler_)
8228 close_handler_(*this, msg, status_code);
8229 }
8230 auto header = build_header(0x8, msg.size() + 2);
8231 char status_buf[2];
8232 *(uint16_t*)(status_buf) = htons(status_code);
8233
8234 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(header));
8235 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::string(status_buf, 2));
8236 write_buffers_.emplace_back(msg);
8237 do_write();
8238 });
8239 }
8240
8241 std::string get_remote_ip() override
8242 {
8243 return adaptor_.remote_endpoint().address().to_string();
8244 }
8245
8246 void set_max_payload_size(uint64_t payload)
8247 {
8248 max_payload_bytes_ = payload;
8249 }
8250
8252 std::string get_subprotocol() const override
8253 {
8254 return subprotocol_;
8255 }
8256
8257 protected:
8259 std::string build_header(int opcode, size_t size)
8260 {
8261 char buf[2 + 8] = "\x80\x00";
8262 buf[0] += opcode;
8263 if (size < 126)
8264 {
8265 buf[1] += static_cast<char>(size);
8266 return {buf, buf + 2};
8267 }
8268 else if (size < 0x10000)
8269 {
8270 buf[1] += 126;
8271 *(uint16_t*)(buf + 2) = htons(static_cast<uint16_t>(size));
8272 return {buf, buf + 4};
8273 }
8274 else
8275 {
8276 buf[1] += 127;
8277 *reinterpret_cast<uint64_t*>(buf + 2) = ((1 == htonl(1)) ? static_cast<uint64_t>(size) : (static_cast<uint64_t>(htonl((size)&0xFFFFFFFF)) << 32) | htonl(static_cast<uint64_t>(size) >> 32));
8278 return {buf, buf + 10};
8279 }
8280 }
8281
8283
8286 void start(std::string&& hello)
8287 {
8288 static const std::string header =
8289 "HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols\r\n"
8290 "Upgrade: websocket\r\n"
8291 "Connection: Upgrade\r\n"
8292 "Sec-WebSocket-Accept: ";
8293 write_buffers_.emplace_back(header);
8294 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(hello));
8295 write_buffers_.emplace_back(crlf);
8296 if (!subprotocol_.empty())
8297 {
8298 write_buffers_.emplace_back("Sec-WebSocket-Protocol: ");
8299 write_buffers_.emplace_back(subprotocol_);
8300 write_buffers_.emplace_back(crlf);
8301 }
8302 write_buffers_.emplace_back(crlf);
8303 do_write();
8304 if (open_handler_)
8305 open_handler_(*this);
8306 do_read();
8307 }
8308
8310
8316 void do_read()
8317 {
8318 if (has_sent_close_ && has_recv_close_)
8319 {
8320 close_connection_ = true;
8321 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8322 adaptor_.close();
8323 check_destroy();
8324 return;
8325 }
8326
8327 is_reading = true;
8328 switch (state_)
8329 {
8330 case WebSocketReadState::MiniHeader:
8331 {
8332 mini_header_ = 0;
8333 //asio::async_read(adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer(&mini_header_, 1),
8334 adaptor_.socket().async_read_some(
8335 asio::buffer(&mini_header_, 2),
8336 [this](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
8337#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8338 bytes_transferred
8339#endif
8340 )
8341
8342 {
8343 is_reading = false;
8344 mini_header_ = ntohs(mini_header_);
8345#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8346
8347 if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 2)
8348 {
8349 throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:MiniHeader:async_read fail:asio bug?");
8350 }
8351#endif
8352
8353 if (!ec)
8354 {
8355 if ((mini_header_ & 0x80) == 0x80)
8356 has_mask_ = true;
8357 else //if the websocket specification is enforced and the message isn't masked, terminate the connection
8358 {
8359#ifndef CROW_ENFORCE_WS_SPEC
8360 has_mask_ = false;
8361#else
8362 close_connection_ = true;
8363 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8364 adaptor_.close();
8365 if (error_handler_)
8366 error_handler_(*this, "Client connection not masked.");
8367 check_destroy(CloseStatusCode::UnacceptableData);
8368#endif
8369 }
8370
8371 if ((mini_header_ & 0x7f) == 127)
8372 {
8373 state_ = WebSocketReadState::Len64;
8374 }
8375 else if ((mini_header_ & 0x7f) == 126)
8376 {
8377 state_ = WebSocketReadState::Len16;
8378 }
8379 else
8380 {
8381 remaining_length_ = mini_header_ & 0x7f;
8382 state_ = WebSocketReadState::Mask;
8383 }
8384 do_read();
8385 }
8386 else
8387 {
8388 close_connection_ = true;
8389 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8390 adaptor_.close();
8391 if (error_handler_)
8392 error_handler_(*this, ec.message());
8393 check_destroy();
8394 }
8395 });
8396 }
8397 break;
8398 case WebSocketReadState::Len16:
8399 {
8400 remaining_length_ = 0;
8401 remaining_length16_ = 0;
8402 asio::async_read(
8403 adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer(&remaining_length16_, 2),
8404 [this](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
8405#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8406 bytes_transferred
8407#endif
8408 ) {
8409 is_reading = false;
8410 remaining_length16_ = ntohs(remaining_length16_);
8411 remaining_length_ = remaining_length16_;
8412#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8413 if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 2)
8414 {
8415 throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:Len16:async_read fail:asio bug?");
8416 }
8417#endif
8418
8419 if (!ec)
8420 {
8421 state_ = WebSocketReadState::Mask;
8422 do_read();
8423 }
8424 else
8425 {
8426 close_connection_ = true;
8427 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8428 adaptor_.close();
8429 if (error_handler_)
8430 error_handler_(*this, ec.message());
8431 check_destroy();
8432 }
8433 });
8434 }
8435 break;
8436 case WebSocketReadState::Len64:
8437 {
8438 asio::async_read(
8439 adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer(&remaining_length_, 8),
8440 [this](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
8441#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8442 bytes_transferred
8443#endif
8444 ) {
8445 is_reading = false;
8446 remaining_length_ = ((1 == ntohl(1)) ? (remaining_length_) : (static_cast<uint64_t>(ntohl((remaining_length_)&0xFFFFFFFF)) << 32) | ntohl((remaining_length_) >> 32));
8447#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8448 if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 8)
8449 {
8450 throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:Len16:async_read fail:asio bug?");
8451 }
8452#endif
8453
8454 if (!ec)
8455 {
8456 state_ = WebSocketReadState::Mask;
8457 do_read();
8458 }
8459 else
8460 {
8461 close_connection_ = true;
8462 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8463 adaptor_.close();
8464 if (error_handler_)
8465 error_handler_(*this, ec.message());
8466 check_destroy();
8467 }
8468 });
8469 }
8470 break;
8471 case WebSocketReadState::Mask:
8472 if (remaining_length_ > max_payload_bytes_)
8473 {
8474 close_connection_ = true;
8475 adaptor_.close();
8476 if (error_handler_)
8477 error_handler_(*this, "Message length exceeds maximum payload.");
8478 check_destroy(MessageTooBig);
8479 }
8480 else if (has_mask_)
8481 {
8482 asio::async_read(
8483 adaptor_.socket(), asio::buffer((char*)&mask_, 4),
8484 [this](const error_code& ec, std::size_t
8485#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8486 bytes_transferred
8487#endif
8488 ) {
8489 is_reading = false;
8490#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
8491 if (!ec && bytes_transferred != 4)
8492 {
8493 throw std::runtime_error("WebSocket:Mask:async_read fail:asio bug?");
8494 }
8495#endif
8496
8497 if (!ec)
8498 {
8499 state_ = WebSocketReadState::Payload;
8500 do_read();
8501 }
8502 else
8503 {
8504 close_connection_ = true;
8505 if (error_handler_)
8506 error_handler_(*this, ec.message());
8507 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8508 adaptor_.close();
8509 check_destroy();
8510 }
8511 });
8512 }
8513 else
8514 {
8515 state_ = WebSocketReadState::Payload;
8516 do_read();
8517 }
8518 break;
8519 case WebSocketReadState::Payload:
8520 {
8521 auto to_read = static_cast<std::uint64_t>(buffer_.size());
8522 if (remaining_length_ < to_read)
8523 to_read = remaining_length_;
8524 adaptor_.socket().async_read_some(
8525 asio::buffer(buffer_, static_cast<std::size_t>(to_read)),
8526 [this](const error_code& ec, std::size_t bytes_transferred) {
8527 is_reading = false;
8528
8529 if (!ec)
8530 {
8531 fragment_.insert(fragment_.end(), buffer_.begin(), buffer_.begin() + bytes_transferred);
8532 remaining_length_ -= bytes_transferred;
8533 if (remaining_length_ == 0)
8534 {
8535 if (handle_fragment())
8536 {
8537 state_ = WebSocketReadState::MiniHeader;
8538 do_read();
8539 }
8540 }
8541 else
8542 do_read();
8543 }
8544 else
8545 {
8546 close_connection_ = true;
8547 if (error_handler_)
8548 error_handler_(*this, ec.message());
8549 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8550 adaptor_.close();
8551 check_destroy();
8552 }
8553 });
8554 }
8555 break;
8556 }
8557 }
8558
8560 bool is_FIN()
8561 {
8562 return mini_header_ & 0x8000;
8563 }
8564
8566 int opcode()
8567 {
8568 return (mini_header_ & 0x0f00) >> 8;
8569 }
8570
8572
8575 bool handle_fragment()
8576 {
8577 if (has_mask_)
8578 {
8579 for (decltype(fragment_.length()) i = 0; i < fragment_.length(); i++)
8580 {
8581 fragment_[i] ^= ((char*)&mask_)[i % 4];
8582 }
8583 }
8584 switch (opcode())
8585 {
8586 case 0: // Continuation
8587 {
8588 message_ += fragment_;
8589 if (is_FIN())
8590 {
8591 if (message_handler_)
8592 message_handler_(*this, message_, is_binary_);
8593 message_.clear();
8594 }
8595 }
8596 break;
8597 case 1: // Text
8598 {
8599 is_binary_ = false;
8600 message_ += fragment_;
8601 if (is_FIN())
8602 {
8603 if (message_handler_)
8604 message_handler_(*this, message_, is_binary_);
8605 message_.clear();
8606 }
8607 }
8608 break;
8609 case 2: // Binary
8610 {
8611 is_binary_ = true;
8612 message_ += fragment_;
8613 if (is_FIN())
8614 {
8615 if (message_handler_)
8616 message_handler_(*this, message_, is_binary_);
8617 message_.clear();
8618 }
8619 }
8620 break;
8621 case 0x8: // Close
8622 {
8623 has_recv_close_ = true;
8624
8625
8626 uint16_t status_code = NoStatusCodePresent;
8627 std::string::size_type message_start = 2;
8628 if (fragment_.size() >= 2)
8629 {
8630 status_code = ntohs(((uint16_t*)fragment_.data())[0]);
8631 } else {
8632 // no message will crash substr
8633 message_start = 0;
8634 }
8635
8636 if (!has_sent_close_)
8637 {
8638 close(fragment_.substr(message_start), status_code);
8639 }
8640 else
8641 {
8642
8643 close_connection_ = true;
8644 if (!is_close_handler_called_)
8645 {
8646 if (close_handler_)
8647 close_handler_(*this, fragment_.substr(message_start), status_code);
8648 is_close_handler_called_ = true;
8649 }
8650 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
8651 adaptor_.close();
8652
8653 // Close handler must have been called at this point so code does not matter
8654 check_destroy();
8655 return false;
8656 }
8657 }
8658 break;
8659 case 0x9: // Ping
8660 {
8661 send_pong(fragment_);
8662 }
8663 break;
8664 case 0xA: // Pong
8665 {
8666 pong_received_ = true;
8667 }
8668 break;
8669 }
8670
8671 fragment_.clear();
8672 return true;
8673 }
8674
8676
8679 void do_write()
8680 {
8681 if (sending_buffers_.empty())
8682 {
8683 sending_buffers_.swap(write_buffers_);
8684 std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers;
8685 buffers.reserve(sending_buffers_.size());
8686 for (auto& s : sending_buffers_)
8687 {
8688 buffers.emplace_back(asio::buffer(s));
8689 }
8690 auto watch = std::weak_ptr<void>{anchor_};
8691 asio::async_write(
8692 adaptor_.socket(), buffers,
8693 [&, watch](const error_code& ec, std::size_t /*bytes_transferred*/) {
8694 if (!ec && !close_connection_)
8695 {
8696 sending_buffers_.clear();
8697 if (!write_buffers_.empty())
8698 do_write();
8699 if (has_sent_close_)
8700 close_connection_ = true;
8701 }
8702 else
8703 {
8704 auto anchor = watch.lock();
8705 if (anchor == nullptr) { return; }
8706
8707 sending_buffers_.clear();
8708 close_connection_ = true;
8709 check_destroy();
8710 }
8711 });
8712 }
8713 }
8714
8716 void check_destroy(websocket::CloseStatusCode code = CloseStatusCode::ClosedAbnormally)
8717 {
8718 // Note that if the close handler was not yet called at this point we did not receive a close packet (or send one)
8719 // and thus we use ClosedAbnormally unless instructed otherwise
8720 if (!is_close_handler_called_)
8721 if (close_handler_)
8722 close_handler_(*this, "uncleanly", code);
8723 handler_->remove_websocket(this);
8724 if (sending_buffers_.empty() && !is_reading)
8725 delete this;
8726 }
8727
8728
8729 struct SendMessageType
8730 {
8731 std::string payload;
8732 Connection* self;
8733 int opcode;
8734
8735 void operator()()
8736 {
8737 self->send_data_impl(this);
8738 }
8739 };
8740
8741 void send_data_impl(SendMessageType* s)
8742 {
8743 auto header = build_header(s->opcode, s->payload.size());
8744 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(header));
8745 write_buffers_.emplace_back(std::move(s->payload));
8746 do_write();
8747 }
8748
8749 void send_data(int opcode, std::string&& msg)
8750 {
8751 SendMessageType event_arg{
8752 std::move(msg),
8753 this,
8754 opcode};
8755
8756 post(std::move(event_arg));
8757 }
8758
8759 private:
8760 Adaptor adaptor_;
8761 Handler* handler_;
8762
8763 std::vector<std::string> sending_buffers_;
8764 std::vector<std::string> write_buffers_;
8765
8766 std::array<char, 4096> buffer_;
8767 bool is_binary_;
8768 std::string message_;
8769 std::string fragment_;
8770 WebSocketReadState state_{WebSocketReadState::MiniHeader};
8771 uint16_t remaining_length16_{0};
8772 uint64_t remaining_length_{0};
8773 uint64_t max_payload_bytes_{UINT64_MAX};
8774 std::string subprotocol_;
8775 bool close_connection_{false};
8776 bool is_reading{false};
8777 bool has_mask_{false};
8778 uint32_t mask_;
8779 uint16_t mini_header_;
8780 bool has_sent_close_{false};
8781 bool has_recv_close_{false};
8782 bool error_occurred_{false};
8783 bool pong_received_{false};
8784 bool is_close_handler_called_{false};
8785
8786 std::shared_ptr<void> anchor_ = std::make_shared<int>(); // Value is just for placeholding
8787
8788 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&)> open_handler_;
8789 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, bool)> message_handler_;
8790 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, uint16_t status_code)> close_handler_;
8791 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&)> error_handler_;
8792 std::function<bool(const crow::request&, void**)> accept_handler_;
8793 };
8794 } // namespace websocket
8795} // namespace crow
8796
8797
8798#include <string>
8799#include <unordered_map>
8800#include <algorithm>
8801
8802
8803namespace crow
8804{
8806
8809 template<typename Handler>
8810 struct HTTPParser : public http_parser
8811 {
8812 static int on_message_begin(http_parser*)
8813 {
8814 return 0;
8815 }
8816 static int on_method(http_parser* self_)
8817 {
8818 HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
8819 self->req.method = static_cast<HTTPMethod>(self->method);
8820
8821 return 0;
8822 }
8823 static int on_url(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
8824 {
8825 HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
8826 self->req.raw_url.insert(self->req.raw_url.end(), at, at + length);
8827 self->req.url_params = query_string(self->req.raw_url);
8828 self->req.url = self->req.raw_url.substr(0, self->qs_point != 0 ? self->qs_point : std::string::npos);
8829
8830 self->process_url();
8831
8832 return 0;
8833 }
8834 static int on_header_field(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
8835 {
8836 HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
8837 switch (self->header_building_state)
8838 {
8839 case 0:
8840 if (!self->header_value.empty())
8841 {
8842 self->req.headers.emplace(std::move(self->header_field), std::move(self->header_value));
8843 }
8844 self->header_field.assign(at, at + length);
8845 self->header_building_state = 1;
8846 break;
8847 case 1:
8848 self->header_field.insert(self->header_field.end(), at, at + length);
8849 break;
8850 }
8851 return 0;
8852 }
8853 static int on_header_value(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
8854 {
8855 HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
8856 switch (self->header_building_state)
8857 {
8858 case 0:
8859 self->header_value.insert(self->header_value.end(), at, at + length);
8860 break;
8861 case 1:
8862 self->header_building_state = 0;
8863 self->header_value.assign(at, at + length);
8864 break;
8865 }
8866 return 0;
8867 }
8868 static int on_headers_complete(http_parser* self_)
8869 {
8870 HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
8871 if (!self->header_field.empty())
8872 {
8873 self->req.headers.emplace(std::move(self->header_field), std::move(self->header_value));
8874 }
8875
8876 self->set_connection_parameters();
8877
8878 self->process_header();
8879 return 0;
8880 }
8881 static int on_body(http_parser* self_, const char* at, size_t length)
8882 {
8883 HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
8884 self->req.body.insert(self->req.body.end(), at, at + length);
8885 return 0;
8886 }
8887 static int on_message_complete(http_parser* self_)
8888 {
8889 HTTPParser* self = static_cast<HTTPParser*>(self_);
8890
8891 self->message_complete = true;
8892 self->process_message();
8893 return 0;
8894 }
8895 HTTPParser(Handler* handler):
8896 http_parser(),
8897 handler_(handler)
8898 {
8899 http_parser_init(this);
8900 }
8901
8902 // return false on error
8904 bool feed(const char* buffer, int length)
8905 {
8906 if (message_complete)
8907 return true;
8908
8909 const static http_parser_settings settings_{
8910 on_message_begin,
8911 on_method,
8912 on_url,
8913 on_header_field,
8914 on_header_value,
8915 on_headers_complete,
8916 on_body,
8917 on_message_complete,
8918 };
8919
8920 int nparsed = http_parser_execute(this, &settings_, buffer, length);
8921 if (http_errno != CHPE_OK)
8922 {
8923 return false;
8924 }
8925 return nparsed == length;
8926 }
8927
8928 bool done()
8929 {
8930 return feed(nullptr, 0);
8931 }
8932
8933 void clear()
8934 {
8935 req = crow::request();
8936 header_field.clear();
8937 header_value.clear();
8938 header_building_state = 0;
8939 qs_point = 0;
8940 message_complete = false;
8941 state = CROW_NEW_MESSAGE();
8942 }
8943
8944 inline void process_url()
8945 {
8946 handler_->handle_url();
8947 }
8948
8949 inline void process_header()
8950 {
8951 handler_->handle_header();
8952 }
8953
8954 inline void process_message()
8955 {
8956 handler_->handle();
8957 }
8958
8959 inline void set_connection_parameters()
8960 {
8961 req.http_ver_major = http_major;
8962 req.http_ver_minor = http_minor;
8963
8964 //NOTE(EDev): it seems that the problem is with crow's policy on closing the connection for HTTP_VERSION < 1.0, the behaviour for that in crow is "don't close the connection, but don't send a keep-alive either"
8965
8966 // HTTP1.1 = always send keep_alive, HTTP1.0 = only send if header exists, HTTP?.? = never send
8967 req.keep_alive = (http_major == 1 && http_minor == 0) ?
8968 ((flags & F_CONNECTION_KEEP_ALIVE) ? true : false) :
8969 ((http_major == 1 && http_minor == 1) ? true : false);
8970
8971 // HTTP1.1 = only close if close header exists, HTTP1.0 = always close unless keep_alive header exists, HTTP?.?= never close
8972 req.close_connection = (http_major == 1 && http_minor == 0) ?
8973 ((flags & F_CONNECTION_KEEP_ALIVE) ? false : true) :
8974 ((http_major == 1 && http_minor == 1) ? ((flags & F_CONNECTION_CLOSE) ? true : false) : false);
8975 req.upgrade = static_cast<bool>(upgrade);
8976 }
8977
8981 request req;
8982
8983 private:
8984 int header_building_state = 0;
8985 bool message_complete = false;
8986 std::string header_field;
8987 std::string header_value;
8988
8989 Handler* handler_;
8990 };
8991} // namespace crow
8992
8993#undef CROW_NEW_MESSAGE
8994#undef CROW_start_state
8995
8996
8997#include <string>
8998#include <vector>
8999#include <sstream>
9000
9001
9002namespace crow
9003{
9004
9006 namespace multipart
9007 {
9008
9009 const std::string dd = "--";
9010
9012 struct header
9013 {
9014 std::string value;
9015 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> params;
9016
9017 operator int() const { return std::stoi(value); }
9018 operator double() const { return std::stod(value); }
9019 };
9020
9022 using mph_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string, header, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
9023
9025 template<typename O, typename T>
9026 inline const O& get_header_value_object(const T& headers, const std::string& key)
9027 {
9028 if (headers.count(key))
9029 {
9030 return headers.find(key)->second;
9031 }
9032 static O empty;
9033 return empty;
9034 }
9035
9037 template<typename T>
9038 inline const header& get_header_object(const T& headers, const std::string& key)
9039 {
9040 return get_header_value_object<header>(headers, key);
9041 }
9042
9044
9047 struct part
9048 {
9049 mph_map headers;
9050 std::string body;
9051
9052 operator int() const { return std::stoi(body); }
9053 operator double() const { return std::stod(body); }
9054
9055 const header& get_header_object(const std::string& key) const
9056 {
9057 return multipart::get_header_object(headers, key);
9058 }
9059 };
9060
9062 using mp_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string, part, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
9063
9065 struct message : public returnable
9066 {
9067 ci_map headers;
9068 std::string boundary;
9069 std::vector<part> parts;
9070 mp_map part_map;
9071
9072 const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key) const
9073 {
9074 return crow::get_header_value(headers, key);
9075 }
9076
9077 part get_part_by_name(const std::string& name)
9078 {
9079 mp_map::iterator result = part_map.find(name);
9080 if (result != part_map.end())
9081 return result->second;
9082 else
9083 return {};
9084 }
9085
9087 std::string dump() const override
9088 {
9089 std::stringstream str;
9090 std::string delimiter = dd + boundary;
9091
9092 for (unsigned i = 0; i < parts.size(); i++)
9093 {
9094 str << delimiter << crlf;
9095 str << dump(i);
9096 }
9097 str << delimiter << dd << crlf;
9098 return str.str();
9099 }
9100
9102 std::string dump(int part_) const
9103 {
9104 std::stringstream str;
9105 part item = parts[part_];
9106 for (auto& item_h : item.headers)
9107 {
9108 str << item_h.first << ": " << item_h.second.value;
9109 for (auto& it : item_h.second.params)
9110 {
9111 str << "; " << it.first << '=' << pad(it.second);
9112 }
9113 str << crlf;
9114 }
9115 str << crlf;
9116 str << item.body << crlf;
9117 return str.str();
9118 }
9119
9121 message(const ci_map& headers_, const std::string& boundary_, const std::vector<part>& sections):
9122 returnable("multipart/form-data; boundary=CROW-BOUNDARY"), headers(headers_), boundary(boundary_), parts(sections)
9123 {
9124 if (!boundary.empty())
9125 content_type = "multipart/form-data; boundary=" + boundary;
9126 for (auto& item : parts)
9127 {
9128 part_map.emplace(
9129 (get_header_object(item.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
9130 item);
9131 }
9132 }
9133
9135 explicit message(const request& req):
9136 returnable("multipart/form-data; boundary=CROW-BOUNDARY"),
9137 headers(req.headers),
9138 boundary(get_boundary(get_header_value("Content-Type")))
9139 {
9140 if (!boundary.empty())
9141 {
9142 content_type = "multipart/form-data; boundary=" + boundary;
9143 parse_body(req.body);
9144 }
9145 else
9146 {
9147 throw bad_request("Empty boundary in multipart message");
9148 }
9149 }
9150
9151 private:
9152 std::string get_boundary(const std::string& header) const
9153 {
9154 constexpr char boundary_text[] = "boundary=";
9155 size_t found = header.find(boundary_text);
9156 if (found != std::string::npos)
9157 {
9158 std::string to_return(header.substr(found + strlen(boundary_text)));
9159 if (to_return[0] == '\"')
9160 {
9161 to_return = to_return.substr(1, to_return.length() - 2);
9162 }
9163 return to_return;
9164 }
9165 return std::string();
9166 }
9167
9168 void parse_body(std::string body)
9169 {
9170 std::string delimiter = dd + boundary;
9171
9172 // TODO(EDev): Exit on error
9173 while (body != (crlf))
9174 {
9175 size_t found = body.find(delimiter);
9176 if (found == std::string::npos)
9177 {
9178 // did not find delimiter; probably an ill-formed body; throw to indicate the issue to user
9179 throw bad_request("Unable to find delimiter in multipart message. Probably ill-formed body");
9180 }
9181 std::string section = body.substr(0, found);
9182
9183 // +2 is the CRLF.
9184 // We don't check it and delete it so that the same delimiter can be used for The last delimiter (--delimiter--CRLF).
9185 body.erase(0, found + delimiter.length() + 2);
9186 if (!section.empty())
9187 {
9188 part parsed_section(parse_section(section));
9189 part_map.emplace(
9190 (get_header_object(parsed_section.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
9191 parsed_section);
9192 parts.push_back(std::move(parsed_section));
9193 }
9194 }
9195 }
9196
9197 part parse_section(std::string& section)
9198 {
9199 struct part to_return;
9200
9201 size_t found = section.find(crlf + crlf);
9202 std::string head_line = section.substr(0, found + 2);
9203 section.erase(0, found + 4);
9204
9205 parse_section_head(head_line, to_return);
9206 to_return.body = section.substr(0, section.length() - 2);
9207 return to_return;
9208 }
9209
9210 void parse_section_head(std::string& lines, part& part)
9211 {
9212 while (!lines.empty())
9213 {
9214 header to_add;
9215
9216 const size_t found_crlf = lines.find(crlf);
9217 std::string line = lines.substr(0, found_crlf);
9218 std::string key;
9219 lines.erase(0, found_crlf + 2);
9220 // Add the header if available
9221 if (!line.empty())
9222 {
9223 const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
9224 std::string header = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
9225 if (found_semicolon != std::string::npos)
9226 line.erase(0, found_semicolon + 2);
9227 else
9228 line = std::string();
9229
9230 size_t header_split = header.find(": ");
9231 key = header.substr(0, header_split);
9232
9233 to_add.value = header.substr(header_split + 2);
9234 }
9235
9236 // Add the parameters
9237 while (!line.empty())
9238 {
9239 const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
9240 std::string param = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
9241 if (found_semicolon != std::string::npos)
9242 line.erase(0, found_semicolon + 2);
9243 else
9244 line = std::string();
9245
9246 size_t param_split = param.find('=');
9247
9248 std::string value = param.substr(param_split + 1);
9249
9250 to_add.params.emplace(param.substr(0, param_split), trim(value));
9251 }
9252 part.headers.emplace(key, to_add);
9253 }
9254 }
9255
9256 inline std::string trim(std::string& string, const char& excess = '"') const
9257 {
9258 if (string.length() > 1 && string[0] == excess && string[string.length() - 1] == excess)
9259 return string.substr(1, string.length() - 2);
9260 return string;
9261 }
9262
9263 inline std::string pad(std::string& string, const char& padding = '"') const
9264 {
9265 return (padding + string + padding);
9266 }
9267 };
9268 } // namespace multipart
9269} // namespace crow
9270
9271
9272#include <charconv>
9273#include <string>
9274#include <vector>
9275#include <string_view>
9276#include <sstream>
9277
9278// for crow::multipart::dd
9279
9280namespace crow
9281{
9282
9284 namespace multipart
9285 {
9287 struct header_view
9288 {
9289 std::string_view value;
9290 std::unordered_map<std::string_view, std::string_view> params;
9291
9293 operator int() const
9294 {
9295 int result = 0;
9296 std::from_chars(value.data(), value.data() + value.size(), result);
9297 return result;
9298 }
9299
9301 operator double() const
9302 {
9303 // There's no std::from_chars for floating-point types in a lot of STLs
9304 return std::stod(static_cast<std::string>(value));
9305 }
9306 };
9307
9309 using mph_view_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string_view, header_view, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
9310
9312 inline const header_view& get_header_object(const mph_view_map& headers, const std::string_view key)
9313 {
9314 const auto header = headers.find(key);
9315 if (header != headers.cend())
9316 {
9317 return header->second;
9318 }
9319
9320 static header_view empty;
9321 return empty;
9322 }
9323
9325 struct padded
9326 {
9327 std::string_view value;
9328 const char padding = '"';
9329
9331 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& stream, const padded value_)
9332 {
9333 return stream << value_.padding << value_.value << value_.padding;
9334 }
9335 };
9336
9338
9341 struct part_view
9342 {
9343 mph_view_map headers;
9344 std::string_view body;
9345
9347 operator int() const
9348 {
9349 int result = 0;
9350 std::from_chars(body.data(), body.data() + body.size(), result);
9351 return result;
9352 }
9353
9355 operator double() const
9356 {
9357 // There's no std::from_chars for floating-point types in a lot of STLs
9358 return std::stod(static_cast<std::string>(body));
9359 }
9360
9361 const header_view& get_header_object(const std::string_view key) const
9362 {
9363 return multipart::get_header_object(headers, key);
9364 }
9365
9366 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& stream, const part_view& part)
9367 {
9368 for (const auto& [header_key, header_value] : part.headers)
9369 {
9370 stream << header_key << ": " << header_value.value;
9371 for (const auto& [param_key, param_value] : header_value.params)
9372 {
9373 stream << "; " << param_key << '=' << padded{param_value};
9374 }
9375 stream << crlf;
9376 }
9377 stream << crlf;
9378 stream << part.body << crlf;
9379 return stream;
9380 }
9381 };
9382
9384 using mp_view_map = std::unordered_multimap<std::string_view, part_view, ci_hash, ci_key_eq>;
9385
9387 struct message_view
9388 {
9389 std::reference_wrapper<const ci_map> headers;
9390 std::string boundary;
9391 std::vector<part_view> parts;
9392 mp_view_map part_map;
9393
9394 const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key) const
9395 {
9396 return crow::get_header_value(headers.get(), key);
9397 }
9398
9399 part_view get_part_by_name(const std::string_view name)
9400 {
9401 mp_view_map::iterator result = part_map.find(name);
9402 if (result != part_map.end())
9403 return result->second;
9404 else
9405 return {};
9406 }
9407
9408 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& stream, const message_view message)
9409 {
9410 std::string delimiter = dd + message.boundary;
9411
9412 for (const part_view& part : message.parts)
9413 {
9414 stream << delimiter << crlf;
9415 stream << part;
9416 }
9417 stream << delimiter << dd << crlf;
9418
9419 return stream;
9420 }
9421
9423 std::string dump() const
9424 {
9425 std::ostringstream str;
9426 str << *this;
9427 return std::move(str).str();
9428 }
9429
9431 std::string dump(int part_) const
9432 {
9433 std::ostringstream str;
9434 str << parts.at(part_);
9435 return std::move(str).str();
9436 }
9437
9439 message_view(const ci_map& headers_, const std::string& boundary_, const std::vector<part_view>& sections):
9440 headers(headers_), boundary(boundary_), parts(sections)
9441 {
9442 for (const part_view& item : parts)
9443 {
9444 part_map.emplace(
9445 (get_header_object(item.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
9446 item);
9447 }
9448 }
9449
9451 explicit message_view(const request& req):
9452 headers(req.headers),
9453 boundary(get_boundary(get_header_value("Content-Type")))
9454 {
9455 parse_body(req.body);
9456 }
9457
9458 private:
9459 std::string_view get_boundary(const std::string_view header) const
9460 {
9461 constexpr std::string_view boundary_text = "boundary=";
9462 const size_t found = header.find(boundary_text);
9463 if (found == std::string_view::npos)
9464 {
9465 return std::string_view();
9466 }
9467
9468 const std::string_view to_return = header.substr(found + boundary_text.size());
9469 if (to_return[0] == '\"')
9470 {
9471 return to_return.substr(1, to_return.length() - 2);
9472 }
9473 return to_return;
9474 }
9475
9476 void parse_body(std::string_view body)
9477 {
9478 const std::string delimiter = dd + boundary;
9479
9480 // TODO(EDev): Exit on error
9481 while (body != (crlf))
9482 {
9483 const size_t found = body.find(delimiter);
9484 if (found == std::string_view::npos)
9485 {
9486 // did not find delimiter; probably an ill-formed body; ignore the rest
9487 break;
9488 }
9489
9490 const std::string_view section = body.substr(0, found);
9491
9492 // +2 is the CRLF.
9493 // We don't check it and delete it so that the same delimiter can be used for The last delimiter (--delimiter--CRLF).
9494 body = body.substr(found + delimiter.length() + 2);
9495 if (!section.empty())
9496 {
9497 part_view parsed_section = parse_section(section);
9498 part_map.emplace(
9499 (get_header_object(parsed_section.headers, "Content-Disposition").params.find("name")->second),
9500 parsed_section);
9501 parts.push_back(std::move(parsed_section));
9502 }
9503 }
9504 }
9505
9506 part_view parse_section(std::string_view section)
9507 {
9508 constexpr static std::string_view crlf2 = "\r\n\r\n";
9509
9510 const size_t found = section.find(crlf2);
9511 const std::string_view head_line = section.substr(0, found + 2);
9512 section = section.substr(found + 4);
9513
9514 return part_view{
9515 parse_section_head(head_line),
9516 section.substr(0, section.length() - 2),
9517 };
9518 }
9519
9520 mph_view_map parse_section_head(std::string_view lines)
9521 {
9522 mph_view_map result;
9523
9524 while (!lines.empty())
9525 {
9526 header_view to_add;
9527
9528 const size_t found_crlf = lines.find(crlf);
9529 std::string_view line = lines.substr(0, found_crlf);
9530 std::string_view key;
9531 lines = lines.substr(found_crlf + 2);
9532 // Add the header if available
9533 if (!line.empty())
9534 {
9535 const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
9536 std::string_view header = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
9537 if (found_semicolon != std::string_view::npos)
9538 line = line.substr(found_semicolon + 2);
9539 else
9540 line = std::string_view();
9541
9542 const size_t header_split = header.find(": ");
9543 key = header.substr(0, header_split);
9544
9545 to_add.value = header.substr(header_split + 2);
9546 }
9547
9548 // Add the parameters
9549 while (!line.empty())
9550 {
9551 const size_t found_semicolon = line.find("; ");
9552 std::string_view param = line.substr(0, found_semicolon);
9553 if (found_semicolon != std::string_view::npos)
9554 line = line.substr(found_semicolon + 2);
9555 else
9556 line = std::string_view();
9557
9558 const size_t param_split = param.find('=');
9559
9560 const std::string_view value = param.substr(param_split + 1);
9561
9562 to_add.params.emplace(param.substr(0, param_split), trim(value));
9563 }
9564 result.emplace(key, to_add);
9565 }
9566
9567 return result;
9568 }
