9569
9570 inline std::string_view trim(const std::string_view string, const char excess = '"') const
9571 {
9572 if (string.length() > 1 && string[0] == excess && string[string.length() - 1] == excess)
9573 return string.substr(1, string.length() - 2);
9574 return string;
9575 }
9576 };
9577 } // namespace multipart
9578} // namespace crow
9579
9580#include <string>
9581#include <unordered_map>
9582#include <ios>
9583#include <fstream>
9584#include <sstream>
9585// S_ISREG is not defined for windows
9586// This defines it like suggested in https://stackoverflow.com/a/62371749
9587#if defined(_MSC_VER)
9588#define _CRT_INTERNAL_NONSTDC_NAMES 1
9589#endif
9590#include <sys/stat.h>
9591#if !defined(S_ISREG) && defined(S_IFMT) && defined(S_IFREG)
9592#define S_ISREG(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
9593#endif
9594
9595
9596
9597namespace crow
9598{
9599 template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler, typename... Middlewares>
9600 class Connection;
9601
9602 class Router;
9603
9605 struct response
9606 {
9607 template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler, typename... Middlewares>
9608 friend class crow::Connection;
9609
9610 friend class Router;
9611
9612 int code{200};
9613 std::string body;
9614 ci_map headers;
9615
9616#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
9617 bool compressed = true;
9618#endif
9619 bool skip_body = false;
9620 bool manual_length_header = false;
9621
9623 void set_header(std::string key, std::string value)
9624 {
9625 headers.erase(key);
9626 headers.emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
9627 }
9628
9630 void add_header(std::string key, std::string value)
9631 {
9632 headers.emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
9633 }
9634
9635 const std::string& get_header_value(const std::string& key)
9636 {
9637 return crow::get_header_value(headers, key);
9638 }
9639
9640 // naive validation of a mime-type string
9641 static bool validate_mime_type(const std::string& candidate) noexcept
9642 {
9643 // Here we simply check that the candidate type starts with
9644 // a valid parent type, and has at least one character afterwards.
9645 std::array<std::string, 10> valid_parent_types = {
9646 "application/", "audio/", "font/", "example/",
9647 "image/", "message/", "model/", "multipart/",
9648 "text/", "video/"};
9649 for (const std::string& parent : valid_parent_types)
9650 {
9651 // ensure the candidate is *longer* than the parent,
9652 // to avoid unnecessary string comparison and to
9653 // reject zero-length subtypes.
9654 if (candidate.size() <= parent.size())
9655 {
9656 continue;
9657 }
9658 // strncmp is used rather than substr to avoid allocation,
9659 // but a string_view approach would be better if Crow
9660 // migrates to C++17.
9661 if (strncmp(parent.c_str(), candidate.c_str(), parent.size()) == 0)
9662 {
9663 return true;
9664 }
9665 }
9666 return false;
9667 }
9668
9669 // Find the mime type from the content type either by lookup,
9670 // or by the content type itself, if it is a valid a mime type.
9671 // Defaults to text/plain.
9672 static std::string get_mime_type(const std::string& contentType)
9673 {
9674 const auto mimeTypeIterator = mime_types.find(contentType);
9675 if (mimeTypeIterator != mime_types.end())
9676 {
9677 return mimeTypeIterator->second;
9678 }
9679 else if (validate_mime_type(contentType))
9680 {
9681 return contentType;
9682 }
9683 else
9684 {
9685 CROW_LOG_WARNING << "Unable to interpret mime type for content type '" << contentType << "'. Defaulting to text/plain.";
9686 return "text/plain";
9687 }
9688 }
9689
9690
9691 // clang-format off
9692 response() {}
9693 explicit response(int code_) : code(code_) {}
9694 response(std::string body_) : body(std::move(body_)) {}
9695 response(int code_, std::string body_) : code(code_), body(std::move(body_)) {}
9696 // clang-format on
9697 response(returnable&& value)
9698 {
9699 body = value.dump();
9700 set_header("Content-Type", value.content_type);
9701 }
9702 response(returnable& value)
9703 {
9704 body = value.dump();
9705 set_header("Content-Type", value.content_type);
9706 }
9707 response(int code_, returnable& value):
9708 code(code_)
9709 {
9710 body = value.dump();
9711 set_header("Content-Type", value.content_type);
9712 }
9713 response(int code_, returnable&& value):
9714 code(code_), body(value.dump())
9715 {
9716 set_header("Content-Type", std::move(value.content_type));
9717 }
9718
9719 response(response&& r)
9720 {
9721 *this = std::move(r);
9722 }
9723
9724 response(std::string contentType, std::string body_):
9725 body(std::move(body_))
9726 {
9727 set_header("Content-Type", get_mime_type(contentType));
9728 }
9729
9730 response(int code_, std::string contentType, std::string body_):
9731 code(code_), body(std::move(body_))
9732 {
9733 set_header("Content-Type", get_mime_type(contentType));
9734 }
9735
9736 response& operator=(const response& r) = delete;
9737
9738 response& operator=(response&& r) noexcept
9739 {
9740 body = std::move(r.body);
9741 code = r.code;
9742 headers = std::move(r.headers);
9743 completed_ = r.completed_;
9744 file_info = std::move(r.file_info);
9745 return *this;
9746 }
9747
9749 bool is_completed() const noexcept
9750 {
9751 return completed_;
9752 }
9753
9754 void clear()
9755 {
9756 body.clear();
9757 code = 200;
9758 headers.clear();
9759 completed_ = false;
9760 file_info = static_file_info{};
9761 }
9762
9764
9767 void redirect(const std::string& location)
9768 {
9769 code = 307;
9770 set_header("Location", location);
9771 }
9772
9774
9777 void redirect_perm(const std::string& location)
9778 {
9779 code = 308;
9780 set_header("Location", location);
9781 }
9782
9784
9787 void moved(const std::string& location)
9788 {
9789 code = 302;
9790 set_header("Location", location);
9791 }
9792
9794
9797 void moved_perm(const std::string& location)
9798 {
9799 code = 301;
9800 set_header("Location", location);
9801 }
9802
9803 void write(const std::string& body_part)
9804 {
9805 body += body_part;
9806 }
9807
9809 void end()
9810 {
9811 if (!completed_)
9812 {
9813 completed_ = true;
9814 if (skip_body)
9815 {
9816 set_header("Content-Length", std::to_string(body.size()));
9817 body = "";
9818 manual_length_header = true;
9819 }
9820 if (complete_request_handler_)
9821 {
9822 complete_request_handler_();
9823 manual_length_header = false;
9824 skip_body = false;
9825 }
9826 }
9827 }
9828
9830 void end(const std::string& body_part)
9831 {
9832 body += body_part;
9833 end();
9834 }
9835
9837 bool is_alive()
9838 {
9839 return is_alive_helper_ && is_alive_helper_();
9840 }
9841
9843 bool is_static_type()
9844 {
9845 return file_info.path.size();
9846 }
9847
9849
9852 struct static_file_info
9853 {
9854 std::string path = "";
9855 struct stat statbuf;
9856 int statResult;
9857 };
9858
9860 void set_static_file_info(std::string path)
9861 {
9862 utility::sanitize_filename(path);
9863 set_static_file_info_unsafe(path);
9864 }
9865
9867 void set_static_file_info_unsafe(std::string path)
9868 {
9869 file_info.path = path;
9870 file_info.statResult = stat(file_info.path.c_str(), &file_info.statbuf);
9871#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
9872 compressed = false;
9873#endif
9874 if (file_info.statResult == 0 && S_ISREG(file_info.statbuf.st_mode))
9875 {
9876 std::size_t last_dot = path.find_last_of('.');
9877 std::string extension = path.substr(last_dot + 1);
9878 code = 200;
9879 this->add_header("Content-Length", std::to_string(file_info.statbuf.st_size));
9880
9881 if (!extension.empty())
9882 {
9883 this->add_header("Content-Type", get_mime_type(extension));
9884 }
9885 }
9886 else
9887 {
9888 code = 404;
9889 file_info.path.clear();
9890 }
9891 }
9892
9893 private:
9894 bool completed_{};
9895 std::function<void()> complete_request_handler_;
9896 std::function<bool()> is_alive_helper_;
9897 static_file_info file_info;
9898 };
9899} // namespace crow
9900
9901
9902namespace crow
9903{
9904
9905 struct UTF8
9906 {
9907 struct context
9908 {};
9909
9910 void before_handle(request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, context& /*ctx*/)
9911 {}
9912
9913 void after_handle(request& /*req*/, response& res, context& /*ctx*/)
9914 {
9915 if (get_header_value(res.headers, "Content-Type").empty())
9916 {
9917 res.set_header("Content-Type", "text/plain; charset=utf-8");
9918 }
9919 }
9920 };
9921
9922} // namespace crow
9923
9924#include <iomanip>
9925#include <memory>
9926
9927namespace crow
9928{
9929 // Any middleware requires following 3 members:
9930
9931 // struct context;
9932 // storing data for the middleware; can be read from another middleware or handlers
9933
9934 // before_handle
9935 // called before handling the request.
9936 // if res.end() is called, the operation is halted.
9937 // (still call after_handle of this middleware)
9938 // 2 signatures:
9939 // void before_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx)
9940 // if you only need to access this middlewares context.
9941 // template <typename AllContext>
9942 // void before_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
9943 // you can access another middlewares' context by calling `all_ctx.template get<MW>()'
9944 // ctx == all_ctx.template get<CurrentMiddleware>()
9945
9946 // after_handle
9947 // called after handling the request.
9948 // void after_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx)
9949 // template <typename AllContext>
9950 // void after_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
9951
9952 struct CookieParser
9953 {
9954 // Cookie stores key, value and attributes
9955 struct Cookie
9956 {
9957 enum class SameSitePolicy
9958 {
9959 Strict,
9960 Lax,
9961 None
9962 };
9963
9964 template<typename U>
9965 Cookie(const std::string& key, U&& value):
9966 Cookie()
9967 {
9968 key_ = key;
9969 value_ = std::forward<U>(value);
9970 }
9971
9972 Cookie(const std::string& key):
9973 Cookie(key, "") {}
9974
9975 // format cookie to HTTP header format
9976 std::string dump() const
9977 {
9978 const static char* HTTP_DATE_FORMAT = "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT";
9979
9980 std::stringstream ss;
9981 ss << key_ << '=';
9982 ss << (value_.empty() ? "\"\"" : value_);
9983 dumpString(ss, !domain_.empty(), "Domain=", domain_);
9984 dumpString(ss, !path_.empty(), "Path=", path_);
9985 dumpString(ss, secure_, "Secure");
9986 dumpString(ss, httponly_, "HttpOnly");
9987 if (expires_at_)
9988 {
9989 ss << DIVIDER << "Expires="
9990 << std::put_time(expires_at_.get(), HTTP_DATE_FORMAT);
9991 }
9992 if (max_age_)
9993 {
9994 ss << DIVIDER << "Max-Age=" << *max_age_;
9995 }
9996 if (same_site_)
9997 {
9998 ss << DIVIDER << "SameSite=";
9999 switch (*same_site_)
10000 {
10001 case SameSitePolicy::Strict:
10002 ss << "Strict";
10003 break;
10004 case SameSitePolicy::Lax:
10005 ss << "Lax";
10006 break;
10007 case SameSitePolicy::None:
10008 ss << "None";
10009 break;
10010 }
10011 }
10012 return ss.str();
10013 }
10014
10015 const std::string& name()
10016 {
10017 return key_;
10018 }
10019
10020 template<typename U>
10021 Cookie& value(U&& value)
10022 {
10023 value_ = std::forward<U>(value);
10024 return *this;
10025 }
10026
10027 // Expires attribute
10028 Cookie& expires(const std::tm& time)
10029 {
10030 expires_at_ = std::unique_ptr<std::tm>(new std::tm(time));
10031 return *this;
10032 }
10033
10034 // Max-Age attribute
10035 Cookie& max_age(long long seconds)
10036 {
10037 max_age_ = std::unique_ptr<long long>(new long long(seconds));
10038 return *this;
10039 }
10040
10041 // Domain attribute
10042 Cookie& domain(const std::string& name)
10043 {
10044 domain_ = name;
10045 return *this;
10046 }
10047
10048 // Path attribute
10049 Cookie& path(const std::string& path)
10050 {
10051 path_ = path;
10052 return *this;
10053 }
10054
10055 // Secured attribute
10056 Cookie& secure()
10057 {
10058 secure_ = true;
10059 return *this;
10060 }
10061
10062 // HttpOnly attribute
10063 Cookie& httponly()
10064 {
10065 httponly_ = true;
10066 return *this;
10067 }
10068
10069 // SameSite attribute
10070 Cookie& same_site(SameSitePolicy ssp)
10071 {
10072 same_site_ = std::unique_ptr<SameSitePolicy>(new SameSitePolicy(ssp));
10073 return *this;
10074 }
10075
10076 Cookie(const Cookie& c):
10077 key_(c.key_),
10078 value_(c.value_),
10079 domain_(c.domain_),
10080 path_(c.path_),
10081 secure_(c.secure_),
10082 httponly_(c.httponly_)
10083 {
10084 if (c.max_age_)
10085 max_age_ = std::unique_ptr<long long>(new long long(*c.max_age_));
10086
10087 if (c.expires_at_)
10088 expires_at_ = std::unique_ptr<std::tm>(new std::tm(*c.expires_at_));
10089
10090 if (c.same_site_)
10091 same_site_ = std::unique_ptr<SameSitePolicy>(new SameSitePolicy(*c.same_site_));
10092 }
10093
10094 private:
10095 Cookie() = default;
10096
10097 static void dumpString(std::stringstream& ss, bool cond, const char* prefix,
10098 const std::string& value = "")
10099 {
10100 if (cond)
10101 {
10102 ss << DIVIDER << prefix << value;
10103 }
10104 }
10105
10106 private:
10107 std::string key_;
10108 std::string value_;
10109 std::unique_ptr<long long> max_age_{};
10110 std::string domain_ = "";
10111 std::string path_ = "";
10112 bool secure_ = false;
10113 bool httponly_ = false;
10114 std::unique_ptr<std::tm> expires_at_{};
10115 std::unique_ptr<SameSitePolicy> same_site_{};
10116
10117 static constexpr const char* DIVIDER = "; ";
10118 };
10119
10120
10121 struct context
10122 {
10123 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> jar;
10124
10125 std::string get_cookie(const std::string& key) const
10126 {
10127 auto cookie = jar.find(key);
10128 if (cookie != jar.end())
10129 return cookie->second;
10130 return {};
10131 }
10132
10133 template<typename U>
10134 Cookie& set_cookie(const std::string& key, U&& value)
10135 {
10136 cookies_to_add.emplace_back(key, std::forward<U>(value));
10137 return cookies_to_add.back();
10138 }
10139
10140 Cookie& set_cookie(Cookie cookie)
10141 {
10142 cookies_to_add.push_back(std::move(cookie));
10143 return cookies_to_add.back();
10144 }
10145
10146 private:
10147 friend struct CookieParser;
10148 std::vector<Cookie> cookies_to_add;
10149 };
10150
10151 void before_handle(request& req, response& res, context& ctx)
10152 {
10153 // TODO(dranikpg): remove copies, use string_view with c++17
10154 int count = req.headers.count("Cookie");
10155 if (!count)
10156 return;
10157 if (count > 1)
10158 {
10159 res.code = 400;
10160 res.end();
10161 return;
10162 }
10163 std::string cookies = req.get_header_value("Cookie");
10164 size_t pos = 0;
10165 while (pos < cookies.size())
10166 {
10167 size_t pos_equal = cookies.find('=', pos);
10168 if (pos_equal == cookies.npos)
10169 break;
10170 std::string name = cookies.substr(pos, pos_equal - pos);
10171 name = utility::trim(name);
10172 pos = pos_equal + 1;
10173 if (pos == cookies.size())
10174 break;
10175
10176 size_t pos_semicolon = cookies.find(';', pos);
10177 std::string value = cookies.substr(pos, pos_semicolon - pos);
10178
10179 value = utility::trim(value);
10180 if (value[0] == '"' && value[value.size() - 1] == '"')
10181 {
10182 value = value.substr(1, value.size() - 2);
10183 }
10184
10185 ctx.jar.emplace(std::move(name), std::move(value));
10186
10187 pos = pos_semicolon;
10188 if (pos == cookies.npos)
10189 break;
10190 pos++;
10191 }
10192 }
10193
10194 void after_handle(request& /*req*/, response& res, context& ctx)
10195 {
10196 for (const auto& cookie : ctx.cookies_to_add)
10197 {
10198 res.add_header("Set-Cookie", cookie.dump());
10199 }
10200 }
10201 };
10202
10203 /*
10204 App<CookieParser, AnotherJarMW> app;
10205 A B C
10206 A::context
10207 int aa;
10208
10209 ctx1 : public A::context
10210 ctx2 : public ctx1, public B::context
10211 ctx3 : public ctx2, public C::context
10212
10213 C depends on A
10214
10215 C::handle
10216 context.aaa
10217
10218 App::context : private CookieParser::context, ...
10219 {
10220 jar
10221
10222 }
10223
10224 SimpleApp
10225 */
10226} // namespace crow
10227
10228
10229
10230#include <unordered_map>
10231#include <unordered_set>
10232#include <set>
10233#include <queue>
10234
10235#include <memory>
10236#include <string>
10237#include <cstdio>
10238#include <mutex>
10239
10240#include <fstream>
10241#include <sstream>
10242
10243#include <type_traits>
10244#include <functional>
10245#include <chrono>
10246
10247#include <variant>
10248
10249namespace
10250{
10251 // convert all integer values to int64_t
10252 template<typename T>
10253 using wrap_integral_t = typename std::conditional<
10254 std::is_integral<T>::value && !std::is_same<bool, T>::value
10255 // except for uint64_t because that could lead to overflow on conversion
10256 && !std::is_same<uint64_t, T>::value,
10257 int64_t, T>::type;
10258
10259 // convert char[]/char* to std::string
10260 template<typename T>
10261 using wrap_char_t = typename std::conditional<
10262 std::is_same<typename std::decay<T>::type, char*>::value,
10263 std::string, T>::type;
10264
10265 // Upgrade to correct type for multi_variant use
10266 template<typename T>
10267 using wrap_mv_t = wrap_char_t<wrap_integral_t<T>>;
10268} // namespace
10269
10270namespace crow
10271{
10272 namespace session
10273 {
10274
10275 using multi_value_types = black_magic::S<bool, int64_t, double, std::string>;
10276
10278 struct multi_value
10279 {
10280 json::wvalue json() const
10281 {
10282 // clang-format off
10283 return std::visit([](auto arg) {
10284 return json::wvalue(arg);
10285 }, v_);
10286 // clang-format on
10287 }
10288
10289 static multi_value from_json(const json::rvalue&);
10290
10291 std::string string() const
10292 {
10293 // clang-format off
10294 return std::visit([](auto arg) {
10295 if constexpr (std::is_same_v<decltype(arg), std::string>)
10296 return arg;
10297 else
10298 return std::to_string(arg);
10299 }, v_);
10300 // clang-format on
10301 }
10302
10303 template<typename T, typename RT = wrap_mv_t<T>>
10304 RT get(const T& fallback)
10305 {
10306 if (const RT* val = std::get_if<RT>(&v_)) return *val;
10307 return fallback;
10308 }
10309
10310 template<typename T, typename RT = wrap_mv_t<T>>
10311 void set(T val)
10312 {
10313 v_ = RT(std::move(val));
10314 }
10315
10316 typename multi_value_types::rebind<std::variant> v_;
10317 };
10318
10319 inline multi_value multi_value::from_json(const json::rvalue& rv)
10320 {
10321 using namespace json;
10322 switch (rv.t())
10323 {
10324 case type::Number:
10325 {
10326 if (rv.nt() == num_type::Floating_point || rv.nt() == num_type::Double_precision_floating_point)
10327 return multi_value{rv.d()};
10328 else if (rv.nt() == num_type::Unsigned_integer)
10329 return multi_value{int64_t(rv.u())};
10330 else
10331 return multi_value{rv.i()};
10332 }
10333 case type::False: return multi_value{false};
10334 case type::True: return multi_value{true};
10335 case type::String: return multi_value{std::string(rv)};
10336 default: return multi_value{false};
10337 }
10338 }
10339
10341 struct ExpirationTracker
10342 {
10343 using DataPair = std::pair<uint64_t /*time*/, std::string /*key*/>;
10344
10347 void add(std::string key, uint64_t time)
10348 {
10349 auto it = times_.find(key);
10350 if (it != times_.end()) remove(key);
10351 times_[key] = time;
10352 queue_.insert({time, std::move(key)});
10353 }
10354
10355 void remove(const std::string& key)
10356 {
10357 auto it = times_.find(key);
10358 if (it != times_.end())
10359 {
10360 queue_.erase({it->second, key});
10361 times_.erase(it);
10362 }
10363 }
10364
10366 uint64_t peek_first() const
10367 {
10368 if (queue_.empty()) return std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max();
10369 return queue_.begin()->first;
10370 }
10371
10372 std::string pop_first()
10373 {
10374 auto it = times_.find(queue_.begin()->second);
10375 auto key = it->first;
10376 times_.erase(it);
10377 queue_.erase(queue_.begin());
10378 return key;
10379 }
10380
10381 using iterator = typename std::set<DataPair>::const_iterator;
10382
10383 iterator begin() const { return queue_.cbegin(); }
10384
10385 iterator end() const { return queue_.cend(); }
10386
10387 private:
10388 std::set<DataPair> queue_;
10389 std::unordered_map<std::string, uint64_t> times_;
10390 };
10391
10393 struct CachedSession
10394 {
10395 std::string session_id;
10396 std::string requested_session_id; // session hasn't been created yet, but a key was requested
10397
10398 std::unordered_map<std::string, multi_value> entries;
10399 std::unordered_set<std::string> dirty; // values that were changed after last load
10400
10401 void* store_data;
10402 bool requested_refresh;
10403
10404 // number of references held - used for correctly destroying the cache.
10405 // No need to be atomic, all SessionMiddleware accesses are synchronized
10406 int referrers;
10407 std::recursive_mutex mutex;
10408 };
10409 } // namespace session
10410
10411 // SessionMiddleware allows storing securely and easily small snippets of user information
10412 template<typename Store>
10413 struct SessionMiddleware
10414 {
10415 using lock = std::scoped_lock<std::mutex>;
10416 using rc_lock = std::scoped_lock<std::recursive_mutex>;
10417
10418 struct context
10419 {
10420 // Get a mutex for locking this session
10421 std::recursive_mutex& mutex()
10422 {
10423 check_node();
10424 return node->mutex;
10425 }
10426
10427 // Check whether this session is already present
10428 bool exists() { return bool(node); }
10429
10430 // Get a value by key or fallback if it doesn't exist or is of another type
10431 template<typename F>
10432 auto get(const std::string& key, const F& fallback = F())
10433 // This trick lets the multi_value deduce the return type from the fallback
10434 // which allows both:
10435 // context.get<std::string>("key")
10436 // context.get("key", "") -> char[] is transformed into string by multivalue
10437 // to return a string
10438 -> decltype(std::declval<session::multi_value>().get<F>(std::declval<F>()))
10439 {
10440 if (!node) return fallback;
10441 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
10442
10443 auto it = node->entries.find(key);
10444 if (it != node->entries.end()) return it->second.get<F>(fallback);
10445 return fallback;
10446 }
10447
10448 // Set a value by key
10449 template<typename T>
10450 void set(const std::string& key, T value)
10451 {
10452 check_node();
10453 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
10454
10455 node->dirty.insert(key);
10456 node->entries[key].set(std::move(value));
10457 }
10458
10459 bool contains(const std::string& key)
10460 {
10461 if (!node) return false;
10462 return node->entries.find(key) != node->entries.end();
10463 }
10464
10465 // Atomically mutate a value with a function
10466 template<typename Func>
10467 void apply(const std::string& key, const Func& f)
10468 {
10469 using traits = utility::function_traits<Func>;
10470 using arg = typename std::decay<typename traits::template arg<0>>::type;
10471 using retv = typename std::decay<typename traits::result_type>::type;
10472 check_node();
10473 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
10474 node->dirty.insert(key);
10475 node->entries[key].set<retv>(f(node->entries[key].get(arg{})));
10476 }
10477
10478 // Remove a value from the session
10479 void remove(const std::string& key)
10480 {
10481 if (!node) return;
10482 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
10483 node->dirty.insert(key);
10484 node->entries.erase(key);
10485 }
10486
10487 // Format value by key as a string
10488 std::string string(const std::string& key)
10489 {
10490 if (!node) return "";
10491 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
10492
10493 auto it = node->entries.find(key);
10494 if (it != node->entries.end()) return it->second.string();
10495 return "";
10496 }
10497
10498 // Get a list of keys present in session
10499 std::vector<std::string> keys()
10500 {
10501 if (!node) return {};
10502 rc_lock l(node->mutex);
10503
10504 std::vector<std::string> out;
10505 for (const auto& p : node->entries)
10506 out.push_back(p.first);
10507 return out;
10508 }
10509
10510 // Delay expiration by issuing another cookie with an updated expiration time
10511 // and notifying the store
10512 void refresh_expiration()
10513 {
10514 if (!node) return;
10515 node->requested_refresh = true;
10516 }
10517
10518 private:
10519 friend struct SessionMiddleware;
10520
10521 void check_node()
10522 {
10523 if (!node) node = std::make_shared<session::CachedSession>();
10524 }
10525
10526 std::shared_ptr<session::CachedSession> node;
10527 };
10528
10529 template<typename... Ts>
10530 SessionMiddleware(
10531 CookieParser::Cookie cookie,
10532 int id_length,
10533 Ts... ts):
10534 id_length_(id_length),
10535 cookie_(cookie),
10536 store_(std::forward<Ts>(ts)...), mutex_(new std::mutex{})
10537 {}
10538
10539 template<typename... Ts>
10540 SessionMiddleware(Ts... ts):
10541 SessionMiddleware(
10542 CookieParser::Cookie("session").path("/").max_age(/*month*/ 30 * 24 * 60 * 60),
10543 /*id_length */ 20, // around 10^34 possible combinations, but small enough to fit into SSO
10544 std::forward<Ts>(ts)...)
10545 {}
10546
10547 template<typename AllContext>
10548 void before_handle(request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
10549 {
10550 lock l(*mutex_);
10551
10552 auto& cookies = all_ctx.template get<CookieParser>();
10553 auto session_id = load_id(cookies);
10554 if (session_id == "") return;
10555
10556 // search entry in cache
10557 auto it = cache_.find(session_id);
10558 if (it != cache_.end())
10559 {
10560 it->second->referrers++;
10561 ctx.node = it->second;
10562 return;
10563 }
10564
10565 // check this is a valid entry before loading
10566 if (!store_.contains(session_id)) return;
10567
10568 auto node = std::make_shared<session::CachedSession>();
10569 node->session_id = session_id;
10570 node->referrers = 1;
10571
10572 try
10573 {
10574 store_.load(*node);
10575 }
10576 catch (...)
10577 {
10578 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Exception occurred during session load";
10579 return;
10580 }
10581
10582 ctx.node = node;
10583 cache_[session_id] = node;
10584 }
10585
10586 template<typename AllContext>
10587 void after_handle(request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, context& ctx, AllContext& all_ctx)
10588 {
10589 lock l(*mutex_);
10590 if (!ctx.node || --ctx.node->referrers > 0) return;
10591 ctx.node->requested_refresh |= ctx.node->session_id == "";
10592
10593 // generate new id
10594 if (ctx.node->session_id == "")
10595 {
10596 // check for requested id
10597 ctx.node->session_id = std::move(ctx.node->requested_session_id);
10598 if (ctx.node->session_id == "")
10599 {
10600 ctx.node->session_id = utility::random_alphanum(id_length_);
10601 }
10602 }
10603 else
10604 {
10605 cache_.erase(ctx.node->session_id);
10606 }
10607
10608 if (ctx.node->requested_refresh)
10609 {
10610 auto& cookies = all_ctx.template get<CookieParser>();
10611 store_id(cookies, ctx.node->session_id);
10612 }
10613
10614 try
10615 {
10616 store_.save(*ctx.node);
10617 }
10618 catch (...)
10619 {
10620 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Exception occurred during session save";
10621 return;
10622 }
10623 }
10624
10625 private:
10626 std::string next_id()
10627 {
10628 std::string id;
10629 do
10630 {
10631 id = utility::random_alphanum(id_length_);
10632 } while (store_.contains(id));
10633 return id;
10634 }
10635
10636 std::string load_id(const CookieParser::context& cookies)
10637 {
10638 return cookies.get_cookie(cookie_.name());
10639 }
10640
10641 void store_id(CookieParser::context& cookies, const std::string& session_id)
10642 {
10643 cookie_.value(session_id);
10644 cookies.set_cookie(cookie_);
10645 }
10646
10647 private:
10648 int id_length_;
10649
10650 // prototype for cookie
10651 CookieParser::Cookie cookie_;
10652
10653 Store store_;
10654
10655 // mutexes are immovable
10656 std::unique_ptr<std::mutex> mutex_;
10657 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::shared_ptr<session::CachedSession>> cache_;
10658 };
10659
10661 struct InMemoryStore
10662 {
10663 // Load a value into the session cache.
10664 // A load is always followed by a save, no loads happen consecutively
10665 void load(session::CachedSession& cn)
10666 {
10667 // load & stores happen sequentially, so moving is safe
10668 cn.entries = std::move(entries[cn.session_id]);
10669 }
10670
10671 // Persist session data
10672 void save(session::CachedSession& cn)
10673 {
10674 entries[cn.session_id] = std::move(cn.entries);
10675 // cn.dirty is a list of changed keys since the last load
10676 }
10677
10678 bool contains(const std::string& key)
10679 {
10680 return entries.count(key) > 0;
10681 }
10682
10683 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::unordered_map<std::string, session::multi_value>> entries;
10684 };
10685
10686 // FileStore stores all data as json files in a folder.
10687 // Files are deleted after expiration. Expiration refreshes are automatically picked up.
10688 struct FileStore
10689 {
10690 FileStore(const std::string& folder, uint64_t expiration_seconds = /*month*/ 30 * 24 * 60 * 60):
10691 path_(folder), expiration_seconds_(expiration_seconds)
10692 {
10693 std::ifstream ifs(get_filename(".expirations", false));
10694
10695 auto current_ts = chrono_time();
10696 std::string key;
10697 uint64_t time;
10698 while (ifs >> key >> time)
10699 {
10700 if (current_ts > time)
10701 {
10702 evict(key);
10703 }
10704 else if (contains(key))
10705 {
10706 expirations_.add(key, time);
10707 }
10708 }
10709 }
10710
10711 ~FileStore()
10712 {
10713 std::ofstream ofs(get_filename(".expirations", false), std::ios::trunc);
10714 for (const auto& p : expirations_)
10715 ofs << p.second << " " << p.first << "\n";
10716 }
10717
10718 // Delete expired entries
10719 // At most 3 to prevent freezes
10720 void handle_expired()
10721 {
10722 int deleted = 0;
10723 auto current_ts = chrono_time();
10724 while (current_ts > expirations_.peek_first() && deleted < 3)
10725 {
10726 evict(expirations_.pop_first());
10727 deleted++;
10728 }
10729 }
10730
10731 void load(session::CachedSession& cn)
10732 {
10733 handle_expired();
10734
10735 std::ifstream file(get_filename(cn.session_id));
10736
10737 std::stringstream buffer;
10738 buffer << file.rdbuf() << std::endl;
10739
10740 for (const auto& p : json::load(buffer.str()))
10741 cn.entries[p.key()] = session::multi_value::from_json(p);
10742 }
10743
10744 void save(session::CachedSession& cn)
10745 {
10746 if (cn.requested_refresh)
10747 expirations_.add(cn.session_id, chrono_time() + expiration_seconds_);
10748 if (cn.dirty.empty()) return;
10749
10750 std::ofstream file(get_filename(cn.session_id));
10751 json::wvalue jw;
10752 for (const auto& p : cn.entries)
10753 jw[p.first] = p.second.json();
10754 file << jw.dump() << std::flush;
10755 }
10756
10757 std::string get_filename(const std::string& key, bool suffix = true)
10758 {
10759 return utility::join_path(path_, key + (suffix ? ".json" : ""));
10760 }
10761
10762 bool contains(const std::string& key)
10763 {
10764 std::ifstream file(get_filename(key));
10765 return file.good();
10766 }
10767
10768 void evict(const std::string& key)
10769 {
10770 std::remove(get_filename(key).c_str());
10771 }
10772
10773 uint64_t chrono_time() const
10774 {
10775 return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::seconds>(
10776 std::chrono::system_clock::now().time_since_epoch())
10777 .count();
10778 }
10779
10780 std::string path_;
10781 uint64_t expiration_seconds_;
10782 session::ExpirationTracker expirations_;
10783 };
10784
10785} // namespace crow
10786
10787
10788
10789namespace crow
10790{
10791 namespace detail
10792 {
10793
10794
10795 template<typename... Middlewares>
10796 struct partial_context : public black_magic::pop_back<Middlewares...>::template rebind<partial_context>, public black_magic::last_element_type<Middlewares...>::type::context
10797 {
10798 using parent_context = typename black_magic::pop_back<Middlewares...>::template rebind<::crow::detail::partial_context>;
10799 template<int N>
10800 using partial = typename std::conditional<N == sizeof...(Middlewares) - 1, partial_context, typename parent_context::template partial<N>>::type;
10801
10802 template<typename T>
10803 typename T::context& get()
10804 {
10805 return static_cast<typename T::context&>(*this);
10806 }
10807 };
10808
10809
10810
10811 template<>
10812 struct partial_context<>
10813 {
10814 template<int>
10815 using partial = partial_context;
10816 };
10817
10818
10819 template<typename... Middlewares>
10820 struct context : private partial_context<Middlewares...>
10821 //struct context : private Middlewares::context... // simple but less type-safe
10822 {
10823 template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
10824 friend typename std::enable_if<(N == 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res);
10825 template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
10826 friend typename std::enable_if<(N > 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res);
10827
10828 template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
10829 friend typename std::enable_if<(N < std::tuple_size<typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::value), bool>::type
10830 middleware_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx);
10831
10832 template<typename T>
10833 typename T::context& get()
10834 {
10835 return static_cast<typename T::context&>(*this);
10836 }
10837
10838 template<int N>
10839 using partial = typename partial_context<Middlewares...>::template partial<N>;
10840 };
10841 } // namespace detail
10842} // namespace crow
10843
10844
10845
10846#include <tuple>
10847#include <type_traits>
10848#include <iostream>
10849#include <utility>
10850
10851namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
10852{
10853
10855 struct ILocalMiddleware
10856 {
10857 using call_global = std::false_type;
10858 };
10859
10860 namespace detail
10861 {
10862 template<typename MW>
10863 struct check_before_handle_arity_3_const
10864 {
10865 template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) const = &T::before_handle>
10866 struct get
10867 {};
10868 };
10869
10870 template<typename MW>
10871 struct check_before_handle_arity_3
10872 {
10873 template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) = &T::before_handle>
10874 struct get
10875 {};
10876 };
10877
10878 template<typename MW>
10879 struct check_after_handle_arity_3_const
10880 {
10881 template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) const = &T::after_handle>
10882 struct get
10883 {};
10884 };
10885
10886 template<typename MW>
10887 struct check_after_handle_arity_3
10888 {
10889 template<typename T, void (T::*)(request&, response&, typename MW::context&) = &T::after_handle>
10890 struct get
10891 {};
10892 };
10893
10894 template<typename MW>
10895 struct check_global_call_false
10896 {
10897 template<typename T, typename std::enable_if<T::call_global::value == false, bool>::type = true>
10898 struct get
10899 {};
10900 };
10901
10902 template<typename T>
10903 struct is_before_handle_arity_3_impl
10904 {
10905 template<typename C>
10906 static std::true_type f(typename check_before_handle_arity_3_const<T>::template get<C>*);
10907
10908 template<typename C>
10909 static std::true_type f(typename check_before_handle_arity_3<T>::template get<C>*);
10910
10911 template<typename C>
10912 static std::false_type f(...);
10913
10914 public:
10915 static const bool value = decltype(f<T>(nullptr))::value;
10916 };
10917
10918 template<typename T>
10919 struct is_after_handle_arity_3_impl
10920 {
10921 template<typename C>
10922 static std::true_type f(typename check_after_handle_arity_3_const<T>::template get<C>*);
10923
10924 template<typename C>
10925 static std::true_type f(typename check_after_handle_arity_3<T>::template get<C>*);
10926
10927 template<typename C>
10928 static std::false_type f(...);
10929
10930 public:
10931 static constexpr bool value = decltype(f<T>(nullptr))::value;
10932 };
10933
10934 template<typename MW>
10935 struct is_middleware_global
10936 {
10937 template<typename C>
10938 static std::false_type f(typename check_global_call_false<MW>::template get<C>*);
10939
10940 template<typename C>
10941 static std::true_type f(...);
10942
10943 static const bool value = decltype(f<MW>(nullptr))::value;
10944 };
10945
10946 template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
10947 typename std::enable_if<!is_before_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
10948 before_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
10949 {
10950 mw.before_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>(), ctx);
10951 }
10952
10953 template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
10954 typename std::enable_if<is_before_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
10955 before_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
10956 {
10957 mw.before_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>());
10958 }
10959
10960 template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
10961 typename std::enable_if<!is_after_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
10962 after_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
10963 {
10964 mw.after_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>(), ctx);
10965 }
10966
10967 template<typename MW, typename Context, typename ParentContext>
10968 typename std::enable_if<is_after_handle_arity_3_impl<MW>::value>::type
10969 after_handler_call(MW& mw, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx, ParentContext& /*parent_ctx*/)
10970 {
10971 mw.after_handle(req, res, ctx.template get<MW>());
10972 }
10973
10974
10975 template<typename CallCriteria,
10976 int N, typename Context, typename Container>
10977 typename std::enable_if<(N < std::tuple_size<typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::value), bool>::type
10978 middleware_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, request& req, response& res, Context& ctx)
10979 {
10980
10981 using CurrentMW = typename std::tuple_element<N, typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::type;
10982
10983 if (!cc.template enabled<CurrentMW>(N))
10984 {
10985 return middleware_call_helper<CallCriteria, N + 1, Context, Container>(cc, middlewares, req, res, ctx);
10986 }
10987
10988 using parent_context_t = typename Context::template partial<N - 1>;
10989 before_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
10990 if (res.is_completed())
10991 {
10992 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
10993 return true;
10994 }
10995
10996 if (middleware_call_helper<CallCriteria, N + 1, Context, Container>(cc, middlewares, req, res, ctx))
10997 {
10998 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
10999 return true;
11000 }
11001
11002 return false;
11003 }
11004
11005 template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
11006 typename std::enable_if<(N >= std::tuple_size<typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::value), bool>::type
11007 middleware_call_helper(const CallCriteria& /*cc*/, Container& /*middlewares*/, request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/, Context& /*ctx*/)
11008 {
11009 return false;
11010 }
11011
11012 template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
11013 typename std::enable_if<(N < 0)>::type
11014 after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& /*cc*/, Container& /*middlewares*/, Context& /*context*/, request& /*req*/, response& /*res*/)
11015 {
11016 }
11017
11018 template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
11019 typename std::enable_if<(N == 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res)
11020 {
11021 using parent_context_t = typename Context::template partial<N - 1>;
11022 using CurrentMW = typename std::tuple_element<N, typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::type;
11023 if (cc.template enabled<CurrentMW>(N))
11024 {
11025 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
11026 }
11027 }
11028
11029 template<typename CallCriteria, int N, typename Context, typename Container>
11030 typename std::enable_if<(N > 0)>::type after_handlers_call_helper(const CallCriteria& cc, Container& middlewares, Context& ctx, request& req, response& res)
11031 {
11032 using parent_context_t = typename Context::template partial<N - 1>;
11033 using CurrentMW = typename std::tuple_element<N, typename std::remove_reference<Container>::type>::type;
11034 if (cc.template enabled<CurrentMW>(N))
11035 {
11036 after_handler_call<CurrentMW, Context, parent_context_t>(std::get<N>(middlewares), req, res, ctx, static_cast<parent_context_t&>(ctx));
11037 }
11038 after_handlers_call_helper<CallCriteria, N - 1, Context, Container>(cc, middlewares, ctx, req, res);
11039 }
11040
11041 // A CallCriteria that accepts only global middleware
11042 struct middleware_call_criteria_only_global
11043 {
11044 template<typename MW>
11045 constexpr bool enabled(int) const
11046 {
11047 return is_middleware_global<MW>::value;
11048 }
11049 };
11050
11051 template<typename F, typename... Args>
11052 typename std::enable_if<black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value, void>::type
11053 wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& /*req*/, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
11054 {
11055 static_assert(!std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
11056 "Handler function cannot have void return type; valid return types: string, int, crow::response, crow::returnable");
11057
11058 res = crow::response(f(std::forward<Args>(args)...));
11059 res.end();
11060 }
11061
11062 template<typename F, typename... Args>
11063 typename std::enable_if<
11064 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
11065 black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value,
11066 void>::type
11067 wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
11068 {
11069 static_assert(!std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
11070 "Handler function cannot have void return type; valid return types: string, int, crow::response, crow::returnable");
11071
11072 res = crow::response(f(req, std::forward<Args>(args)...));
11073 res.end();
11074 }
11075
11076 template<typename F, typename... Args>
11077 typename std::enable_if<
11078 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
11079 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value &&
11080 black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::response&, Args...>>::value,
11081 void>::type
11082 wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& /*req*/, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
11083 {
11084 static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::response&>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
11085 "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
11086
11087 f(res, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11088 }
11089
11090 template<typename F, typename... Args>
11091 typename std::enable_if<
11092 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
11093 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value &&
11094 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::response&, Args...>>::value &&
11095 black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<const crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...>>::value,
11096 void>::type
11097 wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
11098 {
11099 static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request&>(), std::declval<crow::response&>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
11100 "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
11101
11102 f(req, res, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11103 }
11104
11105 // wrapped_handler_call transparently wraps a handler call behind (req, res, args...)
11106 template<typename F, typename... Args>
11107 typename std::enable_if<
11108 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<Args...>>::value &&
11109 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::request&, Args...>>::value &&
11110 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<crow::response&, Args...>>::value &&
11111 !black_magic::CallHelper<F, black_magic::S<const crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...>>::value,
11112 void>::type
11113 wrapped_handler_call(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const F& f, Args&&... args)
11114 {
11115 static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request&>(), std::declval<crow::response&>(), std::declval<Args>()...))>::value,
11116 "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
11117
11118 f(req, res, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11119 }
11120
11121 template<bool Reversed>
11122 struct middleware_call_criteria_dynamic
11123 {};
11124
11125 template<>
11126 struct middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<false>
11127 {
11128 middleware_call_criteria_dynamic(const std::vector<int>& indices_):
11129 indices(indices_), slider(0) {}
11130
11131 template<typename>
11132 bool enabled(int mw_index) const
11133 {
11134 if (slider < int(indices.size()) && indices[slider] == mw_index)
11135 {
11136 slider++;
11137 return true;
11138 }
11139 return false;
11140 }
11141
11142 private:
11143 const std::vector<int>& indices;
11144 mutable int slider;
11145 };
11146
11147 template<>
11148 struct middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<true>
11149 {
11150 middleware_call_criteria_dynamic(const std::vector<int>& indices_):
11151 indices(indices_), slider(int(indices_.size()) - 1) {}
11152
11153 template<typename>
11154 bool enabled(int mw_index) const
11155 {
11156 if (slider >= 0 && indices[slider] == mw_index)
11157 {
11158 slider--;
11159 return true;
11160 }
11161 return false;
11162 }
11163
11164 private:
11165 const std::vector<int>& indices;
11166 mutable int slider;
11167 };
11168
11169 } // namespace detail
11170} // namespace crow
11171
11172
11173#include <cstdint>
11174#include <utility>
11175#include <tuple>
11176#include <unordered_map>
11177#include <memory>
11178#include <vector>
11179#include <algorithm>
11180#include <type_traits>
11181
11182
11183namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
11184{
11185
11186 constexpr const uint16_t INVALID_BP_ID{((uint16_t)-1)};
11187
11188 namespace detail
11189 {
11191 struct middleware_indices
11192 {
11193 template<typename App>
11194 void push()
11195 {}
11196
11197 template<typename App, typename MW, typename... Middlewares>
11198 void push()
11199 {
11200 using MwContainer = typename App::mw_container_t;
11201 static_assert(black_magic::has_type<MW, MwContainer>::value, "Middleware must be present in app");
11202 static_assert(std::is_base_of<crow::ILocalMiddleware, MW>::value, "Middleware must extend ILocalMiddleware");
11203 int idx = black_magic::tuple_index<MW, MwContainer>::value;
11204 indices_.push_back(idx);
11205 push<App, Middlewares...>();
11206 }
11207
11208 void merge_front(const detail::middleware_indices& other)
11209 {
11210 indices_.insert(indices_.begin(), other.indices_.cbegin(), other.indices_.cend());
11211 }
11212
11213 void merge_back(const detail::middleware_indices& other)
11214 {
11215 indices_.insert(indices_.end(), other.indices_.cbegin(), other.indices_.cend());
11216 }
11217
11218 void pop_back(const detail::middleware_indices& other)
11219 {
11220 indices_.resize(indices_.size() - other.indices_.size());
11221 }
11222
11223 bool empty() const
11224 {
11225 return indices_.empty();
11226 }
11227
11228 // Sorts indices and filters out duplicates to allow fast lookups with traversal
11229 void pack()
11230 {
11231 std::sort(indices_.begin(), indices_.end());
11232 indices_.erase(std::unique(indices_.begin(), indices_.end()), indices_.end());
11233 }
11234
11235 const std::vector<int>& indices()
11236 {
11237 return indices_;
11238 }
11239
11240 private:
11241 std::vector<int> indices_;
11242 };
11243 } // namespace detail
11244
11246
11250 class BaseRule
11251 {
11252 public:
11253 BaseRule(std::string rule):
11254 rule_(std::move(rule))
11255 {}
11256
11257 virtual ~BaseRule()
11258 {}
11259
11260 virtual void validate() = 0;
11261
11262 void set_added()
11263 {
11264 added_ = true;
11265 }
11266
11267 bool is_added()
11268 {
11269 return added_;
11270 }
11271
11272 std::unique_ptr<BaseRule> upgrade()
11273 {
11274 if (rule_to_upgrade_)
11275 return std::move(rule_to_upgrade_);
11276 return {};
11277 }
11278
11279 virtual void handle(request&, response&, const routing_params&) = 0;
11280 virtual void handle_upgrade(const request&, response& res, SocketAdaptor&&)
11281 {
11282 res = response(404);
11283 res.end();
11284 }
11285#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
11286 virtual void handle_upgrade(const request&, response& res, SSLAdaptor&&)
11287 {
11288 res = response(404);
11289 res.end();
11290 }
11291#endif
11292
11293 uint32_t get_methods()
11294 {
11295 return methods_;
11296 }
11297
11298 template<typename F>
11299 void foreach_method(F f)
11300 {
11301 for (uint32_t method = 0, method_bit = 1; method < static_cast<uint32_t>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount); method++, method_bit <<= 1)
11302 {
11303 if (methods_ & method_bit)
11304 f(method);
11305 }
11306 }
11307
11308 std::string custom_templates_base;
11309
11310 const std::string& rule() { return rule_; }
11311
11312 protected:
11313 uint32_t methods_{1 << static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::Get)};
11314
11315 std::string rule_;
11316 std::string name_;
11317 bool added_{false};
11318
11319 std::unique_ptr<BaseRule> rule_to_upgrade_;
11320
11321 detail::middleware_indices mw_indices_;
11322
11323 friend class Router;
11324 friend class Blueprint;
11325 template<typename T>
11326 friend struct RuleParameterTraits;
11327 };
11328
11329
11330 namespace detail
11331 {
11332 namespace routing_handler_call_helper
11333 {
11334 template<typename T, int Pos>
11335 struct call_pair
11336 {
11337 using type = T;
11338 static const int pos = Pos;
11339 };
11340
11341 template<typename H1>
11342 struct call_params
11343 {
11344 H1& handler;
11345 const routing_params& params;
11346 request& req;
11347 response& res;
11348 };
11349
11350 template<typename F, int NInt, int NUint, int NDouble, int NString, typename S1, typename S2>
11351 struct call
11352 {};
11353
11354 template<typename F, int NInt, int NUint, int NDouble, int NString, typename... Args1, typename... Args2>
11355 struct call<F, NInt, NUint, NDouble, NString, black_magic::S<int64_t, Args1...>, black_magic::S<Args2...>>
11356 {
11357 void operator()(F cparams)
11358 {
11359 using pushed = typename black_magic::S<Args2...>::template push_back<call_pair<int64_t, NInt>>;
11360 call<F, NInt + 1, NUint, NDouble, NString, black_magic::S<Args1...>, pushed>()(cparams);
11361 }
11362 };
11363
11364 template<typename F, int NInt, int NUint, int NDouble, int NString, typename... Args1, typename... Args2>
11365 struct call<F, NInt, NUint, NDouble, NString, black_magic::S<uint64_t, Args1...>, black_magic::S<Args2...>>
11366 {
11367 void operator()(F cparams)
11368 {
11369 using pushed = typename black_magic::S<Args2...>::template push_back<call_pair<uint64_t, NUint>>;
11370 call<F, NInt, NUint + 1, NDouble, NString, black_magic::S<Args1...>, pushed>()(cparams);
11371 }
11372 };
11373
11374 template<typename F, int NInt, int NUint, int NDouble, int NString, typename... Args1, typename... Args2>
11375 struct call<F, NInt, NUint, NDouble, NString, black_magic::S<double, Args1...>, black_magic::S<Args2...>>
11376 {
11377 void operator()(F cparams)
11378 {
11379 using pushed = typename black_magic::S<Args2...>::template push_back<call_pair<double, NDouble>>;
11380 call<F, NInt, NUint, NDouble + 1, NString, black_magic::S<Args1...>, pushed>()(cparams);
11381 }
11382 };
11383
11384 template<typename F, int NInt, int NUint, int NDouble, int NString, typename... Args1, typename... Args2>
11385 struct call<F, NInt, NUint, NDouble, NString, black_magic::S<std::string, Args1...>, black_magic::S<Args2...>>
11386 {
11387 void operator()(F cparams)
11388 {
11389 using pushed = typename black_magic::S<Args2...>::template push_back<call_pair<std::string, NString>>;
11390 call<F, NInt, NUint, NDouble, NString + 1, black_magic::S<Args1...>, pushed>()(cparams);
11391 }
11392 };
11393
11394 template<typename F, int NInt, int NUint, int NDouble, int NString, typename... Args1>
11395 struct call<F, NInt, NUint, NDouble, NString, black_magic::S<>, black_magic::S<Args1...>>
11396 {
11397 void operator()(F cparams)
11398 {
11399 cparams.handler(
11400 cparams.req,
11401 cparams.res,
11402 cparams.params.template get<typename Args1::type>(Args1::pos)...);
11403 }
11404 };
11405
11406 template<typename Func, typename... ArgsWrapped>
11407 struct Wrapped
11408 {
11409 template<typename... Args>
11410 void set_(Func f, typename std::enable_if<!std::is_same<typename std::tuple_element<0, std::tuple<Args..., void>>::type, const request&>::value, int>::type = 0)
11411 {
11412 handler_ = ([f = std::move(f)](const request&, response& res, Args... args) {
11413 res = response(f(args...));
11414 res.end();
11415 });
11416 }
11417
11418 template<typename Req, typename... Args>
11419 struct req_handler_wrapper
11420 {
11421 req_handler_wrapper(Func fun):
11422 f(std::move(fun))
11423 {
11424 }
11425
11426 void operator()(const request& req, response& res, Args... args)
11427 {
11428 res = response(f(req, args...));
11429 res.end();
11430 }
11431
11432 Func f;
11433 };
11434
11435 template<typename... Args>
11436 void set_(Func f, typename std::enable_if<
11437 std::is_same<typename std::tuple_element<0, std::tuple<Args..., void>>::type, const request&>::value &&
11438 !std::is_same<typename std::tuple_element<1, std::tuple<Args..., void, void>>::type, response&>::value,
11439 int>::type = 0)
11440 {
11441 handler_ = req_handler_wrapper<Args...>(std::move(f));
11442 /*handler_ = (
11443 [f = std::move(f)]
11444 (const request& req, response& res, Args... args){
11445 res = response(f(req, args...));
11446 res.end();
11447 });*/
11448 }
11449
11450 template<typename... Args>
11451 void set_(Func f, typename std::enable_if<
11452 std::is_same<typename std::tuple_element<0, std::tuple<Args..., void>>::type, const request&>::value &&
11453 std::is_same<typename std::tuple_element<1, std::tuple<Args..., void, void>>::type, response&>::value,
11454 int>::type = 0)
11455 {
11456 handler_ = std::move(f);
11457 }
11458
11459 template<typename... Args>
11460 struct handler_type_helper
11461 {
11462 using type = std::function<void(const crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...)>;
11463 using args_type = black_magic::S<typename black_magic::promote_t<Args>...>;
11464 };
11465
11466 template<typename... Args>
11467 struct handler_type_helper<const request&, Args...>
11468 {
11469 using type = std::function<void(const crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...)>;
11470 using args_type = black_magic::S<typename black_magic::promote_t<Args>...>;
11471 };
11472
11473 template<typename... Args>
11474 struct handler_type_helper<const request&, response&, Args...>
11475 {
11476 using type = std::function<void(const crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...)>;
11477 using args_type = black_magic::S<typename black_magic::promote_t<Args>...>;
11478 };
11479
11480 typename handler_type_helper<ArgsWrapped...>::type handler_;
11481
11482 void operator()(request& req, response& res, const routing_params& params)
11483 {
11484 detail::routing_handler_call_helper::call<
11485 detail::routing_handler_call_helper::call_params<
11486 decltype(handler_)>,
11487 0, 0, 0, 0,
11488 typename handler_type_helper<ArgsWrapped...>::args_type,
11489 black_magic::S<>>()(
11490 detail::routing_handler_call_helper::call_params<
11491 decltype(handler_)>{handler_, params, req, res});
11492 }
11493 };
11494
11495 } // namespace routing_handler_call_helper
11496 } // namespace detail
11497
11498
11499 class CatchallRule
11500 {
11501 public:
11503 CatchallRule() {}
11504
11505 template<typename Func>
11506 typename std::enable_if<black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<>>::value, void>::type
11507 operator()(Func&& f)
11508 {
11509 static_assert(!std::is_same<void, decltype(f())>::value,
11510 "Handler function cannot have void return type; valid return types: string, int, crow::response, crow::returnable");
11511
11512 handler_ = ([f = std::move(f)](const request&, response& res) {
11513 res = response(f());
11514 res.end();
11515 });
11516 }
11517
11518 template<typename Func>
11519 typename std::enable_if<
11520 !black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<>>::value &&
11521 black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<crow::request>>::value,
11522 void>::type
11523 operator()(Func&& f)
11524 {
11525 static_assert(!std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request>()))>::value,
11526 "Handler function cannot have void return type; valid return types: string, int, crow::response, crow::returnable");
11527
11528 handler_ = ([f = std::move(f)](const request& req, response& res) {
11529 res = response(f(req));
11530 res.end();
11531 });
11532 }
11533
11534 template<typename Func>
11535 typename std::enable_if<
11536 !black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<>>::value &&
11537 !black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<crow::request>>::value &&
11538 black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<crow::response&>>::value,
11539 void>::type
11540 operator()(Func&& f)
11541 {
11542 static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::response&>()))>::value,
11543 "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
11544 handler_ = ([f = std::move(f)](const request&, response& res) {
11545 f(res);
11546 });
11547 }
11548
11549 template<typename Func>
11550 typename std::enable_if<
11551 !black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<>>::value &&
11552 !black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<crow::request>>::value &&
11553 !black_magic::CallHelper<Func, black_magic::S<crow::response&>>::value,
11554 void>::type
11555 operator()(Func&& f)
11556 {
11557 static_assert(std::is_same<void, decltype(f(std::declval<crow::request>(), std::declval<crow::response&>()))>::value,
11558 "Handler function with response argument should have void return type");
11559
11560 handler_ = std::move(f);
11561 }
11563 bool has_handler()
11564 {
11565 return (handler_ != nullptr);
11566 }
11567
11568 protected:
11569 friend class Router;
11570
11571 private:
11572 std::function<void(const crow::request&, crow::response&)> handler_;
11573 };
11574
11575
11577
11580 template<typename App>
11581 class WebSocketRule : public BaseRule
11582 {
11583 using self_t = WebSocketRule;
11584
11585 public:
11586 WebSocketRule(std::string rule, App* app):
11587 BaseRule(std::move(rule)),
11588 app_(app),
11589 max_payload_(UINT64_MAX)
11590 {}
11591
11592 void validate() override
11593 {}
11594
11595 void handle(request&, response& res, const routing_params&) override
11596 {
11597 res = response(404);
11598 res.end();
11599 }
11600
11601 void handle_upgrade(const request& req, response&, SocketAdaptor&& adaptor) override
11602 {
11603 max_payload_ = max_payload_override_ ? max_payload_ : app_->websocket_max_payload();
11604 new crow::websocket::Connection<SocketAdaptor, App>(req, std::move(adaptor), app_, max_payload_, subprotocols_, open_handler_, message_handler_, close_handler_, error_handler_, accept_handler_, mirror_protocols_);
11605 }
11606#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
11607 void handle_upgrade(const request& req, response&, SSLAdaptor&& adaptor) override
11608 {
11609 new crow::websocket::Connection<SSLAdaptor, App>(req, std::move(adaptor), app_, max_payload_, subprotocols_, open_handler_, message_handler_, close_handler_, error_handler_, accept_handler_, mirror_protocols_);
11610 }
11611#endif
11612
11614 self_t& max_payload(uint64_t max_payload)
11615 {
11616 max_payload_ = max_payload;
11617 max_payload_override_ = true;
11618 return *this;
11619 }
11620
11621 self_t& subprotocols(const std::vector<std::string>& subprotocols)
11622 {
11623 subprotocols_ = subprotocols;
11624 return *this;
11625 }
11626
11627 template<typename Func>
11628 self_t& onopen(Func f)
11629 {
11630 open_handler_ = f;
11631 return *this;
11632 }
11633
11634 template<typename Func>
11635 self_t& onmessage(Func f)
11636 {
11637 message_handler_ = f;
11638 return *this;
11639 }
11640
11641 template<typename Func>
11642 self_t& onclose(Func f)
11643 {
11644 close_handler_ = f;
11645 return *this;
11646 }
11647
11648 template<typename Func>
11649 self_t& onerror(Func f)
11650 {
11651 error_handler_ = f;
11652 return *this;
11653 }
11654
11655 template<typename Func>
11656 self_t& onaccept(Func f)
11657 {
11658 accept_handler_ = f;
11659 return *this;
11660 }
11661
11662 self_t& mirrorprotocols(bool mirror_protocols = true)
11663 {
11664 mirror_protocols_ = mirror_protocols;
11665 return *this;
11666 }
11667
11668 protected:
11669 App* app_;
11670 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&)> open_handler_;
11671 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, bool)> message_handler_;
11672 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&, uint16_t)> close_handler_;
11673 std::function<void(crow::websocket::connection&, const std::string&)> error_handler_;
11674 std::function<bool(const crow::request&, void**)> accept_handler_;
11675 bool mirror_protocols_ = false;
11676 uint64_t max_payload_;
11677 bool max_payload_override_ = false;
11678 std::vector<std::string> subprotocols_;
11679 };
11680
11682
11685 template<typename T>
11686 struct RuleParameterTraits
11687 {
11688 using self_t = T;
11689
11690 template<typename App>
11691 WebSocketRule<App>& websocket(App* app)
11692 {
11693 auto p = new WebSocketRule<App>(static_cast<self_t*>(this)->rule_, app);
11694 static_cast<self_t*>(this)->rule_to_upgrade_.reset(p);
11695 return *p;
11696 }
11697
11698 self_t& name(std::string name) noexcept
11699 {
11700 static_cast<self_t*>(this)->name_ = std::move(name);
11701 return static_cast<self_t&>(*this);
11702 }
11703
11704 self_t& methods(HTTPMethod method)
11705 {
11706 static_cast<self_t*>(this)->methods_ = 1 << static_cast<int>(method);
11707 return static_cast<self_t&>(*this);
11708 }
11709
11710 template<typename... MethodArgs>
11711 self_t& methods(HTTPMethod method, MethodArgs... args_method)
11712 {
11713 methods(args_method...);
11714 static_cast<self_t*>(this)->methods_ |= 1 << static_cast<int>(method);
11715 return static_cast<self_t&>(*this);
11716 }
11717
11719 template<typename App, typename... Middlewares>
11720 self_t& middlewares()
11721 {
11722 static_cast<self_t*>(this)->mw_indices_.template push<App, Middlewares...>();
11723 return static_cast<self_t&>(*this);
11724 }
11725 };
11726
11728 class DynamicRule : public BaseRule, public RuleParameterTraits<DynamicRule>
11729 {
11730 public:
11731 DynamicRule(std::string rule):
11732 BaseRule(std::move(rule))
11733 {}
11734
11735 void validate() override
11736 {
11737 if (!erased_handler_)
11738 {
11739 throw std::runtime_error(name_ + (!name_.empty() ? ": " : "") + "no handler for url " + rule_);
11740 }
11741 }
11742
11743 void handle(request& req, response& res, const routing_params& params) override
11744 {
11745 if (!custom_templates_base.empty())
11746 mustache::set_base(custom_templates_base);
11747 else if (mustache::detail::get_template_base_directory_ref() != "templates")
11748 mustache::set_base("templates");
11749 erased_handler_(req, res, params);
11750 }
11751
11752 template<typename Func>
11753 void operator()(Func f)
11754 {
11755#ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
11756 using function_t = utility::function_traits<decltype(&Func::operator())>;
11757#else
11758 using function_t = utility::function_traits<Func>;
11759#endif
11760 erased_handler_ = wrap(std::move(f), black_magic::gen_seq<function_t::arity>());
11761 }
11762
11763 // enable_if Arg1 == request && Arg2 == response
11764 // enable_if Arg1 == request && Arg2 != resposne
11765 // enable_if Arg1 != request
11766#ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
11767 template<typename Func, size_t... Indices>
11768#else
11769 template<typename Func, unsigned... Indices>
11770#endif
11771 std::function<void(request&, response&, const routing_params&)>
11772 wrap(Func f, black_magic::seq<Indices...>)
11773 {
11774#ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
11775 using function_t = utility::function_traits<decltype(&Func::operator())>;
11776#else
11777 using function_t = utility::function_traits<Func>;
11778#endif
11779 if (!black_magic::is_parameter_tag_compatible(
11780 black_magic::get_parameter_tag_runtime(rule_.c_str()),
11781 black_magic::compute_parameter_tag_from_args_list<
11782 typename function_t::template arg<Indices>...>::value))
11783 {
11784 throw std::runtime_error("route_dynamic: Handler type is mismatched with URL parameters: " + rule_);
11785 }
11786 auto ret = detail::routing_handler_call_helper::Wrapped<Func, typename function_t::template arg<Indices>...>();
11787 ret.template set_<
11788 typename function_t::template arg<Indices>...>(std::move(f));
11789 return ret;
11790 }
11791
11792 template<typename Func>
11793 void operator()(std::string name, Func&& f)
11794 {
11795 name_ = std::move(name);
11796 (*this).template operator()<Func>(std::forward(f));
11797 }
11798
11799 private:
11800 std::function<void(request&, response&, const routing_params&)> erased_handler_;
11801 };
11802
11804 template<typename... Args>
11805 class TaggedRule : public BaseRule, public RuleParameterTraits<TaggedRule<Args...>>
11806 {
11807 public:
11808 using self_t = TaggedRule<Args...>;
11809
11810 TaggedRule(std::string rule):
11811 BaseRule(std::move(rule))
11812 {}
11813
11814 void validate() override
11815 {
11816 if (rule_.at(0) != '/')
11817 throw std::runtime_error("Internal error: Routes must start with a '/'");
11818
11819 if (!handler_)
11820 {
11821 throw std::runtime_error(name_ + (!name_.empty() ? ": " : "") + "no handler for url " + rule_);
11822 }
11823 }
11824
11825 template<typename Func>
11826 void operator()(Func&& f)
11827 {
11828 handler_ = ([f = std::move(f)](request& req, response& res, Args... args) {
11829 detail::wrapped_handler_call(req, res, f, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11830 });
11831 }
11832
11833 template<typename Func>
11834 void operator()(std::string name, Func&& f)
11835 {
11836 name_ = std::move(name);
11837 (*this).template operator()<Func>(std::forward(f));
11838 }
11839
11840 void handle(request& req, response& res, const routing_params& params) override
11841 {
11842 if (!custom_templates_base.empty())
11843 mustache::set_base(custom_templates_base);
11844 else if (mustache::detail::get_template_base_directory_ref() != mustache::detail::get_global_template_base_directory_ref())
11845 mustache::set_base(mustache::detail::get_global_template_base_directory_ref());
11846
11847 detail::routing_handler_call_helper::call<
11848 detail::routing_handler_call_helper::call_params<decltype(handler_)>,
11849 0, 0, 0, 0,
11850 black_magic::S<Args...>,
11851 black_magic::S<>>()(
11852 detail::routing_handler_call_helper::call_params<decltype(handler_)>{handler_, params, req, res});
11853 }
11854
11855 private:
11856 std::function<void(crow::request&, crow::response&, Args...)> handler_;
11857 };
11858
11859 const int RULE_SPECIAL_REDIRECT_SLASH = 1;
11860
11861
11863 class Trie
11864 {
11865 public:
11866 struct Node
11867 {
11868 uint16_t rule_index{};
11869 // Assign the index to the maximum 32 unsigned integer value by default so that any other number (specifically 0) is a valid BP id.
11870 uint16_t blueprint_index{INVALID_BP_ID};
11871 std::string key;
11872 ParamType param = ParamType::MAX; // MAX = No param.
11873 std::vector<Node> children;
11874
11875 bool IsSimpleNode() const
11876 {
11877 return !rule_index &&
11878 blueprint_index == INVALID_BP_ID &&
11879 children.size() < 2 &&
11880 param == ParamType::MAX &&
11881 std::all_of(std::begin(children), std::end(children), [](const Node& x) {
11882 return x.param == ParamType::MAX;
11883 });
11884 }
11885
11886 Node& add_child_node()
11887 {
11888 children.emplace_back();
11889 return children.back();
11890 }
11891 };
11892
11893
11894 Trie()
11895 {}
11896
11898 bool is_empty()
11899 {
11900 return head_.children.empty();
11901 }
11902
11903 void optimize()
11904 {
11905 for (auto& child : head_.children)
11906 {
11907 optimizeNode(child);
11908 }
11909 }
11910
11911
11912 private:
11913 void optimizeNode(Node& node)
11914 {
11915 if (node.children.empty())
11916 return;
11917 if (node.IsSimpleNode())
11918 {
11919 auto children_temp = std::move(node.children);
11920 auto& child_temp = children_temp[0];
11921 node.key += child_temp.key;
11922 node.rule_index = child_temp.rule_index;
11923 node.blueprint_index = child_temp.blueprint_index;
11924 node.children = std::move(child_temp.children);
11925 optimizeNode(node);
11926 }
11927 else
11928 {
11929 for (auto& child : node.children)
11930 {
11931 optimizeNode(child);
11932 }
11933 }
11934 }
11935
11936 void debug_node_print(const Node& node, int level)
11937 {
11938 if (node.param != ParamType::MAX)
11939 {
11940 switch (node.param)
11941 {
11942 case ParamType::INT:
11943 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << std::string(3 * level, ' ') << " "
11944 << "<int>";
11945 break;
11946 case ParamType::UINT:
11947 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << std::string(3 * level, ' ') << " "
11948 << "<uint>";
11949 break;
11950 case ParamType::DOUBLE:
11951 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << std::string(3 * level, ' ') << " "
11952 << "<double>";
11953 break;
11954 case ParamType::STRING:
11955 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << std::string(3 * level, ' ') << " "
11956 << "<string>";
11957 break;
11958 case ParamType::PATH:
11959 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << std::string(3 * level, ' ') << " "
11960 << "<path>";
11961 break;
11962 default:
11963 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << std::string(3 * level, ' ') << " "
11964 << "<ERROR>";
11965 break;
11966 }
11967 }
11968 else
11969 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << std::string(3 * level, ' ') << " " << node.key;
11970
11971 for (const auto& child : node.children)
11972 {
11973 debug_node_print(child, level + 1);
11974 }
11975 }
11976
11977 public:
11978 void debug_print()
11979 {
11980 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << " ROOT";
11981 for (const auto& child : head_.children)
11982 debug_node_print(child, 1);
11983 }
11984
11985 void validate()
11986 {
11987 if (!head_.IsSimpleNode())
11988 throw std::runtime_error("Internal error: Trie header should be simple!");
11989 optimize();
11990 }
11991
11992 //Rule_index, Blueprint_index, routing_params
11993 routing_handle_result find(const std::string& req_url, const Node& node, unsigned pos = 0, routing_params* params = nullptr, std::vector<uint16_t>* blueprints = nullptr) const
11994 {
11995 //start params as an empty struct
11996 routing_params empty;
11997 if (params == nullptr)
11998 params = &empty;
11999 //same for blueprint vector
12000 std::vector<uint16_t> MT;
12001 if (blueprints == nullptr)
12002 blueprints = &MT;
12003
12004 uint16_t found{}; //The rule index to be found
12005 std::vector<uint16_t> found_BP; //The Blueprint indices to be found
12006 routing_params match_params; //supposedly the final matched parameters
12007
12008 auto update_found = [&found, &found_BP, &match_params](routing_handle_result& ret) {
12009 found_BP = std::move(ret.blueprint_indices);
12010 if (ret.rule_index && (!found || found > ret.rule_index))
12011 {
12012 found = ret.rule_index;
12013 match_params = std::move(ret.r_params);
12014 }
12015 };
12016
12017 //if the function was called on a node at the end of the string (the last recursion), return the nodes rule index, and whatever params were passed to the function
12018 if (pos == req_url.size())
12019 {
12020 found_BP = std::move(*blueprints);
12021 return routing_handle_result{node.rule_index, *blueprints, *params};
12022 }
12023
12024 bool found_fragment = false;
12025
12026 for (const auto& child : node.children)
12027 {
12028 if (child.param != ParamType::MAX)
12029 {
12030 if (child.param == ParamType::INT)
12031 {
12032 char c = req_url[pos];
12033 if ((c >= '0' && c <= '9') || c == '+' || c == '-')
12034 {
12035 char* eptr;
12036 errno = 0;
12037 long long int value = strtoll(req_url.data() + pos, &eptr, 10);
12038 if (errno != ERANGE && eptr != req_url.data() + pos)
12039 {
12040 found_fragment = true;
12041 params->int_params.push_back(value);
12042 if (child.blueprint_index != INVALID_BP_ID) blueprints->push_back(child.blueprint_index);
12043 auto ret = find(req_url, child, eptr - req_url.data(), params, blueprints);
12044 update_found(ret);
12045 params->int_params.pop_back();
12046 if (!blueprints->empty()) blueprints->pop_back();
12047 }
12048 }
12049 }
12050
12051 else if (child.param == ParamType::UINT)
12052 {
12053 char c = req_url[pos];
12054 if ((c >= '0' && c <= '9') || c == '+')
12055 {
12056 char* eptr;
12057 errno = 0;
12058 unsigned long long int value = strtoull(req_url.data() + pos, &eptr, 10);
12059 if (errno != ERANGE && eptr != req_url.data() + pos)
12060 {
12061 found_fragment = true;
12062 params->uint_params.push_back(value);
12063 if (child.blueprint_index != INVALID_BP_ID) blueprints->push_back(child.blueprint_index);
12064 auto ret = find(req_url, child, eptr - req_url.data(), params, blueprints);
12065 update_found(ret);
12066 params->uint_params.pop_back();
12067 if (!blueprints->empty()) blueprints->pop_back();
12068 }
12069 }
12070 }
12071
12072 else if (child.param == ParamType::DOUBLE)
12073 {
12074 char c = req_url[pos];
12075 if ((c >= '0' && c <= '9') || c == '+' || c == '-' || c == '.')
12076 {
12077 char* eptr;
12078 errno = 0;
12079 double value = strtod(req_url.data() + pos, &eptr);
12080 if (errno != ERANGE && eptr != req_url.data() + pos)
12081 {
12082 found_fragment = true;
12083 params->double_params.push_back(value);
12084 if (child.blueprint_index != INVALID_BP_ID) blueprints->push_back(child.blueprint_index);
12085 auto ret = find(req_url, child, eptr - req_url.data(), params, blueprints);
12086 update_found(ret);
12087 params->double_params.pop_back();
12088 if (!blueprints->empty()) blueprints->pop_back();
12089 }
12090 }
12091 }
12092
12093 else if (child.param == ParamType::STRING)
12094 {
12095 size_t epos = pos;
12096 for (; epos < req_url.size(); epos++)
12097 {
12098 if (req_url[epos] == '/')
12099 break;
12100 }
12101
12102 if (epos != pos)
12103 {
12104 found_fragment = true;
12105 params->string_params.push_back(req_url.substr(pos, epos - pos));
12106 if (child.blueprint_index != INVALID_BP_ID) blueprints->push_back(child.blueprint_index);
12107 auto ret = find(req_url, child, epos, params, blueprints);
12108 update_found(ret);
12109 params->string_params.pop_back();
12110 if (!blueprints->empty()) blueprints->pop_back();
12111 }
12112 }
12113
12114 else if (child.param == ParamType::PATH)
12115 {
12116 size_t epos = req_url.size();
12117
12118 if (epos != pos)
12119 {
12120 found_fragment = true;
12121 params->string_params.push_back(req_url.substr(pos, epos - pos));
12122 if (child.blueprint_index != INVALID_BP_ID) blueprints->push_back(child.blueprint_index);
12123 auto ret = find(req_url, child, epos, params, blueprints);
12124 update_found(ret);
12125 params->string_params.pop_back();
12126 if (!blueprints->empty()) blueprints->pop_back();
12127 }
12128 }
12129 }
12130
12131 else
12132 {
12133 const std::string& fragment = child.key;
12134 if (req_url.compare(pos, fragment.size(), fragment) == 0)
12135 {
12136 found_fragment = true;
12137 if (child.blueprint_index != INVALID_BP_ID) blueprints->push_back(child.blueprint_index);
12138 auto ret = find(req_url, child, pos + fragment.size(), params, blueprints);
12139 update_found(ret);
12140 if (!blueprints->empty()) blueprints->pop_back();
12141 }
12142 }
12143 }
12144
12145 if (!found_fragment)
12146 found_BP = std::move(*blueprints);
12147
12148 return routing_handle_result{found, found_BP, match_params}; //Called after all the recursions have been done
12149 }
12150
12151 routing_handle_result find(const std::string& req_url) const
12152 {
12153 return find(req_url, head_);
12154 }
12155
12156 //This functions assumes any blueprint info passed is valid
12157 void add(const std::string& url, uint16_t rule_index, unsigned bp_prefix_length = 0, uint16_t blueprint_index = INVALID_BP_ID)
12158 {
12159 auto idx = &head_;
12160
12161 bool has_blueprint = bp_prefix_length != 0 && blueprint_index != INVALID_BP_ID;
12162
12163 for (unsigned i = 0; i < url.size(); i++)
12164 {
12165 char c = url[i];
12166 if (c == '<')
12167 {
12168 static struct ParamTraits
12169 {
12170 ParamType type;
12171 std::string name;
12172 } paramTraits[] =
12173 {
12174 {ParamType::INT, "<int>"},
12175 {ParamType::UINT, "<uint>"},
12176 {ParamType::DOUBLE, "<float>"},
12177 {ParamType::DOUBLE, "<double>"},
12178 {ParamType::STRING, "<str>"},
12179 {ParamType::STRING, "<string>"},
12180 {ParamType::PATH, "<path>"},
12181 };
12182
12183 for (const auto& x : paramTraits)
12184 {
12185 if (url.compare(i, x.name.size(), x.name) == 0)
12186 {
12187 bool found = false;
12188 for (auto& child : idx->children)
12189 {
12190 if (child.param == x.type)
12191 {
12192 idx = &child;
12193 i += x.name.size();
12194 found = true;
12195 break;
12196 }
12197 }
12198 if (found)
12199 break;
12200
12201 auto new_node_idx = &idx->add_child_node();
12202 new_node_idx->param = x.type;
12203 idx = new_node_idx;
12204 i += x.name.size();
12205 break;
12206 }
12207 }
12208
12209 i--;
12210 }
12211 else
12212 {
12213 //This part assumes the tree is unoptimized (every node has a max 1 character key)
12214 bool piece_found = false;
12215 for (auto& child : idx->children)
12216 {
12217 if (child.key[0] == c)
12218 {
12219 idx = &child;
12220 piece_found = true;
12221 break;
12222 }
12223 }
12224 if (!piece_found)
12225 {
12226 auto new_node_idx = &idx->add_child_node();
12227 new_node_idx->key = c;
12228 //The assumption here is that you'd only need to add a blueprint index if the tree didn't have the BP prefix.
12229 if (has_blueprint && i == bp_prefix_length)
12230 new_node_idx->blueprint_index = blueprint_index;
12231 idx = new_node_idx;
12232 }
12233 }
12234 }
12235
12236 //check if the last node already has a value (exact url already in Trie)
12237 if (idx->rule_index)
12238 throw std::runtime_error("handler already exists for " + url);
12239 idx->rule_index = rule_index;
12240 }
12241
12242 private:
12243 Node head_;
12244 };
12245
12247
12251 class Blueprint
12252 {
12253 public:
12254 Blueprint(const std::string& prefix):
12255 prefix_(prefix),
12256 static_dir_(prefix),
12257 templates_dir_(prefix){};
12258
12259 Blueprint(const std::string& prefix, const std::string& static_dir):
12260 prefix_(prefix), static_dir_(static_dir){};
12261
12262 Blueprint(const std::string& prefix, const std::string& static_dir, const std::string& templates_dir):
12263 prefix_(prefix), static_dir_(static_dir), templates_dir_(templates_dir){};
12264
12265 /*
12266 Blueprint(Blueprint& other)
12267 {
12268 prefix_ = std::move(other.prefix_);
12269 all_rules_ = std::move(other.all_rules_);
12270 }
12271
12272 Blueprint(const Blueprint& other)
12273 {
12274 prefix_ = other.prefix_;
12275 all_rules_ = other.all_rules_;
12276 }
12277*/
12278 Blueprint(Blueprint&& value)
12279 {
12280 *this = std::move(value);
12281 }
12282
12283 Blueprint& operator=(const Blueprint& value) = delete;
12284
12285 Blueprint& operator=(Blueprint&& value) noexcept
12286 {
12287 prefix_ = std::move(value.prefix_);
12288 static_dir_ = std::move(value.static_dir_);
12289 templates_dir_ = std::move(value.templates_dir_);
12290 all_rules_ = std::move(value.all_rules_);
12291 catchall_rule_ = std::move(value.catchall_rule_);
