12292 blueprints_ = std::move(value.blueprints_);
12293 mw_indices_ = std::move(value.mw_indices_);
12294 return *this;
12295 }
12296
12297 bool operator==(const Blueprint& value)
12298 {
12299 return value.prefix() == prefix_;
12300 }
12301
12302 bool operator!=(const Blueprint& value)
12303 {
12304 return value.prefix() != prefix_;
12305 }
12306
12307 std::string prefix() const
12308 {
12309 return prefix_;
12310 }
12311
12312 std::string static_dir() const
12313 {
12314 return static_dir_;
12315 }
12316
12317 void set_added()
12318 {
12319 added_ = true;
12320 }
12321
12322 bool is_added()
12323 {
12324 return added_;
12325 }
12326
12327 DynamicRule& new_rule_dynamic(const std::string& rule)
12328 {
12329 std::string new_rule = '/' + prefix_ + rule;
12330 auto ruleObject = new DynamicRule(std::move(new_rule));
12331 ruleObject->custom_templates_base = templates_dir_;
12332 all_rules_.emplace_back(ruleObject);
12333
12334 return *ruleObject;
12335 }
12336
12337 template<uint64_t N>
12338 typename black_magic::arguments<N>::type::template rebind<TaggedRule>& new_rule_tagged(const std::string& rule)
12339 {
12340 std::string new_rule = '/' + prefix_ + rule;
12341 using RuleT = typename black_magic::arguments<N>::type::template rebind<TaggedRule>;
12342
12343 auto ruleObject = new RuleT(std::move(new_rule));
12344 ruleObject->custom_templates_base = templates_dir_;
12345 all_rules_.emplace_back(ruleObject);
12346
12347 return *ruleObject;
12348 }
12349
12350 void register_blueprint(Blueprint& blueprint)
12351 {
12352 if (blueprints_.empty() || std::find(blueprints_.begin(), blueprints_.end(), &blueprint) == blueprints_.end())
12353 {
12354 apply_blueprint(blueprint);
12355 blueprints_.emplace_back(&blueprint);
12356 }
12357 else
12358 throw std::runtime_error("blueprint \"" + blueprint.prefix_ + "\" already exists in blueprint \"" + prefix_ + '\"');
12359 }
12360
12361
12362 CatchallRule& catchall_rule()
12363 {
12364 return catchall_rule_;
12365 }
12366
12367 template<typename App, typename... Middlewares>
12368 void middlewares()
12369 {
12370 mw_indices_.push<App, Middlewares...>();
12371 }
12372
12373 private:
12374 void apply_blueprint(Blueprint& blueprint)
12375 {
12376
12377 blueprint.prefix_ = prefix_ + '/' + blueprint.prefix_;
12378 blueprint.static_dir_ = static_dir_ + '/' + blueprint.static_dir_;
12379 blueprint.templates_dir_ = templates_dir_ + '/' + blueprint.templates_dir_;
12380 for (auto& rule : blueprint.all_rules_)
12381 {
12382 std::string new_rule = '/' + prefix_ + rule->rule_;
12383 rule->rule_ = new_rule;
12384 }
12385 for (Blueprint* bp_child : blueprint.blueprints_)
12386 {
12387 Blueprint& bp_ref = *bp_child;
12388 apply_blueprint(bp_ref);
12389 }
12390 }
12391
12392 std::string prefix_;
12393 std::string static_dir_;
12394 std::string templates_dir_;
12395 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<BaseRule>> all_rules_;
12396 CatchallRule catchall_rule_;
12397 std::vector<Blueprint*> blueprints_;
12398 detail::middleware_indices mw_indices_;
12399 bool added_{false};
12400
12401 friend class Router;
12402 };
12403
12405 class Router
12406 {
12407 public:
12408 bool using_ssl;
12409
12410 Router() : using_ssl(false)
12411 {}
12412
12413 DynamicRule& new_rule_dynamic(const std::string& rule)
12414 {
12415 auto ruleObject = new DynamicRule(rule);
12416 all_rules_.emplace_back(ruleObject);
12417
12418 return *ruleObject;
12419 }
12420
12421 template<uint64_t N>
12422 typename black_magic::arguments<N>::type::template rebind<TaggedRule>& new_rule_tagged(const std::string& rule)
12423 {
12424 using RuleT = typename black_magic::arguments<N>::type::template rebind<TaggedRule>;
12425
12426 auto ruleObject = new RuleT(rule);
12427 all_rules_.emplace_back(ruleObject);
12428
12429 return *ruleObject;
12430 }
12431
12432 CatchallRule& catchall_rule()
12433 {
12434 return catchall_rule_;
12435 }
12436
12437 void internal_add_rule_object(const std::string& rule, BaseRule* ruleObject)
12438 {
12439 internal_add_rule_object(rule, ruleObject, INVALID_BP_ID, blueprints_);
12440 }
12441
12442 void internal_add_rule_object(const std::string& rule, BaseRule* ruleObject, const uint16_t& BP_index, std::vector<Blueprint*>& blueprints)
12443 {
12444 bool has_trailing_slash = false;
12445 std::string rule_without_trailing_slash;
12446 if (rule.size() > 1 && rule.back() == '/')
12447 {
12448 has_trailing_slash = true;
12449 rule_without_trailing_slash = rule;
12450 rule_without_trailing_slash.pop_back();
12451 }
12452
12453 ruleObject->mw_indices_.pack();
12454
12455 ruleObject->foreach_method([&](int method) {
12456 per_methods_[method].rules.emplace_back(ruleObject);
12457 per_methods_[method].trie.add(rule, per_methods_[method].rules.size() - 1, BP_index != INVALID_BP_ID ? blueprints[BP_index]->prefix().length() : 0, BP_index);
12458
12459 // directory case:
12460 // request to '/about' url matches '/about/' rule
12461 if (has_trailing_slash)
12462 {
12463 per_methods_[method].trie.add(rule_without_trailing_slash, RULE_SPECIAL_REDIRECT_SLASH, BP_index != INVALID_BP_ID ? blueprints[BP_index]->prefix().length() : 0, BP_index);
12464 }
12465 });
12466
12467 ruleObject->set_added();
12468 }
12469
12470 void register_blueprint(Blueprint& blueprint)
12471 {
12472 if (std::find(blueprints_.begin(), blueprints_.end(), &blueprint) == blueprints_.end())
12473 {
12474 blueprints_.emplace_back(&blueprint);
12475 }
12476 else
12477 throw std::runtime_error("blueprint \"" + blueprint.prefix_ + "\" already exists in router");
12478 }
12479
12480 void get_recursive_child_methods(Blueprint* blueprint, std::vector<HTTPMethod>& methods)
12481 {
12482 //we only need to deal with children if the blueprint has absolutely no methods (meaning its index won't be added to the trie)
12483 if (blueprint->static_dir_.empty() && blueprint->all_rules_.empty())
12484 {
12485 for (Blueprint* bp : blueprint->blueprints_)
12486 {
12487 get_recursive_child_methods(bp, methods);
12488 }
12489 }
12490 else if (!blueprint->static_dir_.empty())
12491 methods.emplace_back(HTTPMethod::Get);
12492 for (auto& rule : blueprint->all_rules_)
12493 {
12494 rule->foreach_method([&methods](unsigned method) {
12495 HTTPMethod method_final = static_cast<HTTPMethod>(method);
12496 if (std::find(methods.begin(), methods.end(), method_final) == methods.end())
12497 methods.emplace_back(method_final);
12498 });
12499 }
12500 }
12501
12502 void validate_bp()
12503 {
12504 //Take all the routes from the registered blueprints and add them to `all_rules_` to be processed.
12505 detail::middleware_indices blueprint_mw;
12506 validate_bp(blueprints_, blueprint_mw);
12507 }
12508
12509 void validate_bp(std::vector<Blueprint*> blueprints, detail::middleware_indices& current_mw)
12510 {
12511 for (unsigned i = 0; i < blueprints.size(); i++)
12512 {
12513 Blueprint* blueprint = blueprints[i];
12514
12515 if (blueprint->is_added()) continue;
12516
12517 if (blueprint->static_dir_ == "" && blueprint->all_rules_.empty())
12518 {
12519 std::vector<HTTPMethod> methods;
12520 get_recursive_child_methods(blueprint, methods);
12521 for (HTTPMethod x : methods)
12522 {
12523 int method_index = static_cast<int>(x);
12524 per_methods_[method_index].trie.add(blueprint->prefix(), 0, blueprint->prefix().length(), method_index);
12525 }
12526 }
12527
12528 current_mw.merge_back(blueprint->mw_indices_);
12529 for (auto& rule : blueprint->all_rules_)
12530 {
12531 if (rule && !rule->is_added())
12532 {
12533 auto upgraded = rule->upgrade();
12534 if (upgraded)
12535 rule = std::move(upgraded);
12536 rule->validate();
12537 rule->mw_indices_.merge_front(current_mw);
12538 internal_add_rule_object(rule->rule(), rule.get(), i, blueprints);
12539 }
12540 }
12541 validate_bp(blueprint->blueprints_, current_mw);
12542 current_mw.pop_back(blueprint->mw_indices_);
12543 blueprint->set_added();
12544 }
12545 }
12546
12547 void validate()
12548 {
12549 for (auto& rule : all_rules_)
12550 {
12551 if (rule && !rule->is_added())
12552 {
12553 auto upgraded = rule->upgrade();
12554 if (upgraded)
12555 rule = std::move(upgraded);
12556 rule->validate();
12557 internal_add_rule_object(rule->rule(), rule.get());
12558 }
12559 }
12560 for (auto& per_method : per_methods_)
12561 {
12562 per_method.trie.validate();
12563 }
12564 }
12565
12566 // TODO maybe add actual_method
12567 template<typename Adaptor>
12568 void handle_upgrade(const request& req, response& res, Adaptor&& adaptor)
12569 {
12570 if (req.method >= HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount)
12571 return;
12572
12573 auto& per_method = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(req.method)];
12574 auto& rules = per_method.rules;
12575 unsigned rule_index = per_method.trie.find(req.url).rule_index;
12576
12577 if (!rule_index)
12578 {
12579 for (auto& method : per_methods_)
12580 {
12581 if (method.trie.find(req.url).rule_index)
12582 {
12583 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match method " << req.url << " " << method_name(req.method);
12584 res = response(405);
12585 res.end();
12586 return;
12587 }
12588 }
12589
12590 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Cannot match rules " << req.url;
12591 res = response(404);
12592 res.end();
12593 return;
12594 }
12595
12596 if (rule_index >= rules.size())
12597 throw std::runtime_error("Trie internal structure corrupted!");
12598
12599 if (rule_index == RULE_SPECIAL_REDIRECT_SLASH)
12600 {
12601 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Redirecting to a url with trailing slash: " << req.url;
12602 res = response(301);
12603 res.add_header("Location", req.url + "/");
12604 res.end();
12605 return;
12606 }
12607
12608 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Matched rule (upgrade) '" << rules[rule_index]->rule_ << "' " << static_cast<uint32_t>(req.method) << " / " << rules[rule_index]->get_methods();
12609
12610 try
12611 {
12612 rules[rule_index]->handle_upgrade(req, res, std::move(adaptor));
12613 }
12614 catch (...)
12615 {
12616 exception_handler_(res);
12617 res.end();
12618 return;
12619 }
12620 }
12621
12622 void get_found_bp(std::vector<uint16_t>& bp_i, std::vector<Blueprint*>& blueprints, std::vector<Blueprint*>& found_bps, uint16_t index = 0)
12623 {
12624 // This statement makes 3 assertions:
12625 // 1. The index is above 0.
12626 // 2. The index does not lie outside the given blueprint list.
12627 // 3. The next blueprint we're adding has a prefix that starts the same as the already added blueprint + a slash (the rest is irrelevant).
12628 //
12629 // This is done to prevent a blueprint that has a prefix of "bp_prefix2" to be assumed as a child of one that has "bp_prefix".
12630 //
12631 // If any of the assertions is untrue, we delete the last item added, and continue using the blueprint list of the blueprint found before, the topmost being the router's list
12632 auto verify_prefix = [&bp_i, &index, &blueprints, &found_bps]() {
12633 return index > 0 &&
12634 bp_i[index] < blueprints.size() &&
12635 blueprints[bp_i[index]]->prefix().substr(0, found_bps[index - 1]->prefix().length() + 1).compare(std::string(found_bps[index - 1]->prefix() + '/')) == 0;
12636 };
12637 if (index < bp_i.size())
12638 {
12639
12640 if (verify_prefix())
12641 {
12642 found_bps.push_back(blueprints[bp_i[index]]);
12643 get_found_bp(bp_i, found_bps.back()->blueprints_, found_bps, ++index);
12644 }
12645 else
12646 {
12647 if (found_bps.size() < 2)
12648 {
12649 found_bps.clear();
12650 found_bps.push_back(blueprints_[bp_i[index]]);
12651 }
12652 else
12653 {
12654 found_bps.pop_back();
12655 Blueprint* last_element = found_bps.back();
12656 found_bps.push_back(last_element->blueprints_[bp_i[index]]);
12657 }
12658 get_found_bp(bp_i, found_bps.back()->blueprints_, found_bps, ++index);
12659 }
12660 }
12661 }
12662
12664 std::string get_error(unsigned short code, routing_handle_result& found, const request& req, response& res)
12665 {
12666 res.code = code;
12667 std::vector<Blueprint*> bps_found;
12668 get_found_bp(found.blueprint_indices, blueprints_, bps_found);
12669 for (int i = bps_found.size() - 1; i > 0; i--)
12670 {
12671 std::vector<uint16_t> bpi = found.blueprint_indices;
12672 if (bps_found[i]->catchall_rule().has_handler())
12673 {
12674 try
12675 {
12676 bps_found[i]->catchall_rule().handler_(req, res);
12677 }
12678 catch (...)
12679 {
12680 exception_handler_(res);
12681 }
12682#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
12683 return std::string("Redirected to Blueprint \"" + bps_found[i]->prefix() + "\" Catchall rule");
12684#else
12685 return std::string();
12686#endif
12687 }
12688 }
12689 if (catchall_rule_.has_handler())
12690 {
12691 try
12692 {
12693 catchall_rule_.handler_(req, res);
12694 }
12695 catch (...)
12696 {
12697 exception_handler_(res);
12698 }
12699#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
12700 return std::string("Redirected to global Catchall rule");
12701#else
12702 return std::string();
12703#endif
12704 }
12705 return std::string();
12706 }
12707
12708 std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> handle_initial(request& req, response& res)
12709 {
12710 HTTPMethod method_actual = req.method;
12711
12712 std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> found{
12713 new routing_handle_result(
12714 0,
12715 std::vector<uint16_t>(),
12716 routing_params(),
12717 HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount)}; // This is always returned to avoid a null pointer dereference.
12718
12719 // NOTE(EDev): This most likely will never run since the parser should handle this situation and close the connection before it gets here.
12720 if (CROW_UNLIKELY(req.method >= HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount))
12721 return found;
12722 else if (req.method == HTTPMethod::Head)
12723 {
12724 *found = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].trie.find(req.url);
12725 // support HEAD requests using GET if not defined as method for the requested URL
12726 if (!found->rule_index)
12727 {
12728 method_actual = HTTPMethod::Get;
12729 *found = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].trie.find(req.url);
12730 if (!found->rule_index) // If a route is still not found, return a 404 without executing the rest of the HEAD specific code.
12731 {
12732 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match rules " << req.url;
12733 res = response(404); //TODO(EDev): Should this redirect to catchall?
12734 res.end();
12735 return found;
12736 }
12737 }
12738
12739 res.skip_body = true;
12740 found->method = method_actual;
12741 return found;
12742 }
12743 else if (req.method == HTTPMethod::Options)
12744 {
12745 std::string allow = "OPTIONS, HEAD";
12746
12747 if (req.url == "/*")
12748 {
12749 for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount); i++)
12750 {
12751 if (static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::Head) == i)
12752 continue; // HEAD is always allowed
12753
12754 if (!per_methods_[i].trie.is_empty())
12755 {
12756 allow.append(", ");
12757 allow.append(method_name(static_cast<HTTPMethod>(i)));
12758 }
12759 }
12760#ifdef CROW_RETURNS_OK_ON_HTTP_OPTIONS_REQUEST
12761 res = response(crow::status::OK);
12762#else
12763 res = response(crow::status::NO_CONTENT);
12764#endif
12765
12766 res.set_header("Allow", allow);
12767 res.end();
12768 found->method = method_actual;
12769 return found;
12770 }
12771 else
12772 {
12773 bool rules_matched = false;
12774 for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount); i++)
12775 {
12776 if (per_methods_[i].trie.find(req.url).rule_index)
12777 {
12778 rules_matched = true;
12779
12780 if (static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::Head) == i)
12781 continue; // HEAD is always allowed
12782
12783 allow.append(", ");
12784 allow.append(method_name(static_cast<HTTPMethod>(i)));
12785 }
12786 }
12787 if (rules_matched)
12788 {
12789#ifdef CROW_RETURNS_OK_ON_HTTP_OPTIONS_REQUEST
12790 res = response(crow::status::OK);
12791#else
12792 res = response(crow::status::NO_CONTENT);
12793#endif
12794 res.set_header("Allow", allow);
12795 res.end();
12796 found->method = method_actual;
12797 return found;
12798 }
12799 else
12800 {
12801 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match rules " << req.url;
12802 res = response(404); //TODO(EDev): Should this redirect to catchall?
12803 res.end();
12804 return found;
12805 }
12806 }
12807 }
12808 else // Every request that isn't a HEAD or OPTIONS request
12809 {
12810 *found = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].trie.find(req.url);
12811 // TODO(EDev): maybe ending the else here would allow the requests coming from above (after removing the return statement) to be checked on whether they actually point to a route
12812 if (!found->rule_index)
12813 {
12814 for (auto& per_method : per_methods_)
12815 {
12816 if (per_method.trie.find(req.url).rule_index) //Route found, but in another method
12817 {
12818 const std::string error_message(get_error(405, *found, req, res));
12819 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match method " << req.url << " " << method_name(method_actual) << ". " << error_message;
12820 res.end();
12821 return found;
12822 }
12823 }
12824 //Route does not exist anywhere
12825
12826 const std::string error_message(get_error(404, *found, req, res));
12827 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Cannot match rules " << req.url << ". " << error_message;
12828 res.end();
12829 return found;
12830 }
12831
12832 found->method = method_actual;
12833 return found;
12834 }
12835 }
12836
12837 template<typename App>
12838 void handle(request& req, response& res, routing_handle_result found)
12839 {
12840 HTTPMethod method_actual = found.method;
12841 auto& rules = per_methods_[static_cast<int>(method_actual)].rules;
12842 unsigned rule_index = found.rule_index;
12843
12844 if (rule_index >= rules.size())
12845 throw std::runtime_error("Trie internal structure corrupted!");
12846
12847 if (rule_index == RULE_SPECIAL_REDIRECT_SLASH)
12848 {
12849 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Redirecting to a url with trailing slash: " << req.url;
12850 res = response(301);
12851 res.add_header("Location", req.url + "/");
12852 res.end();
12853 return;
12854 }
12855
12856 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Matched rule '" << rules[rule_index]->rule_ << "' " << static_cast<uint32_t>(req.method) << " / " << rules[rule_index]->get_methods();
12857
12858 try
12859 {
12860 BaseRule& rule = *rules[rule_index];
12861 handle_rule<App>(rule, req, res, found.r_params);
12862 }
12863 catch (...)
12864 {
12865 exception_handler_(res);
12866 res.end();
12867 return;
12868 }
12869 }
12870
12871 template<typename App>
12872 typename std::enable_if<std::tuple_size<typename App::mw_container_t>::value != 0, void>::type
12873 handle_rule(BaseRule& rule, crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const crow::routing_params& rp)
12874 {
12875 if (!rule.mw_indices_.empty())
12876 {
12877 auto& ctx = *reinterpret_cast<typename App::context_t*>(req.middleware_context);
12878 auto& container = *reinterpret_cast<typename App::mw_container_t*>(req.middleware_container);
12879 detail::middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<false> crit_fwd(rule.mw_indices_.indices());
12880
12881 auto glob_completion_handler = std::move(res.complete_request_handler_);
12882 res.complete_request_handler_ = [] {};
12883
12884 detail::middleware_call_helper<decltype(crit_fwd),
12885 0, typename App::context_t, typename App::mw_container_t>(crit_fwd, container, req, res, ctx);
12886
12887 if (res.completed_)
12888 {
12889 glob_completion_handler();
12890 return;
12891 }
12892
12893 res.complete_request_handler_ = [&rule, &ctx, &container, &req, &res, glob_completion_handler] {
12894 detail::middleware_call_criteria_dynamic<true> crit_bwd(rule.mw_indices_.indices());
12895
12896 detail::after_handlers_call_helper<
12897 decltype(crit_bwd),
12898 std::tuple_size<typename App::mw_container_t>::value - 1,
12899 typename App::context_t,
12900 typename App::mw_container_t>(crit_bwd, container, ctx, req, res);
12901 glob_completion_handler();
12902 };
12903 }
12904 rule.handle(req, res, rp);
12905 }
12906
12907 template<typename App>
12908 typename std::enable_if<std::tuple_size<typename App::mw_container_t>::value == 0, void>::type
12909 handle_rule(BaseRule& rule, crow::request& req, crow::response& res, const crow::routing_params& rp)
12910 {
12911 rule.handle(req, res, rp);
12912 }
12913
12914 void debug_print()
12915 {
12916 for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount); i++)
12917 {
12918 Trie& trie_ = per_methods_[i].trie;
12919 if (!trie_.is_empty())
12920 {
12921 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << method_name(static_cast<HTTPMethod>(i));
12922 trie_.debug_print();
12923 }
12924 }
12925 }
12926
12927 std::vector<Blueprint*>& blueprints()
12928 {
12929 return blueprints_;
12930 }
12931
12932 std::function<void(crow::response&)>& exception_handler()
12933 {
12934 return exception_handler_;
12935 }
12936
12937 static void default_exception_handler(response& res)
12938 {
12939 // any uncaught exceptions become 500s
12940 res = response(500);
12941
12942 try
12943 {
12944 throw;
12945 }
12946 catch (const bad_request& e)
12947 {
12948 res = response (400);
12949 res.body = e.what();
12950 }
12951 catch (const std::exception& e)
12952 {
12953 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "An uncaught exception occurred: " << e.what();
12954 }
12955 catch (...)
12956 {
12957 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "An uncaught exception occurred. The type was unknown so no information was available.";
12958 }
12959 }
12960
12961 private:
12962 CatchallRule catchall_rule_;
12963
12964 struct PerMethod
12965 {
12966 std::vector<BaseRule*> rules;
12967 Trie trie;
12968
12969 // rule index 0, 1 has special meaning; preallocate it to avoid duplication.
12970 PerMethod():
12971 rules(2) {}
12972 };
12973 std::array<PerMethod, static_cast<int>(HTTPMethod::InternalMethodCount)> per_methods_;
12974 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<BaseRule>> all_rules_;
12975 std::vector<Blueprint*> blueprints_;
12976 std::function<void(crow::response&)> exception_handler_ = &default_exception_handler;
12977 };
12978} // namespace crow
12979
12980
12981namespace crow
12982{
12983 struct CORSHandler;
12984
12986 struct CORSRules
12987 {
12988 friend struct crow::CORSHandler;
12989
12991 CORSRules& origin(const std::string& origin)
12992 {
12993 origin_ = origin;
12994 return *this;
12995 }
12996
12998 CORSRules& methods(crow::HTTPMethod method)
12999 {
13000 add_list_item(methods_, crow::method_name(method));
13001 return *this;
13002 }
13003
13005 template<typename... Methods>
13006 CORSRules& methods(crow::HTTPMethod method, Methods... method_list)
13007 {
13008 add_list_item(methods_, crow::method_name(method));
13009 methods(method_list...);
13010 return *this;
13011 }
13012
13014 CORSRules& headers(const std::string& header)
13015 {
13016 add_list_item(headers_, header);
13017 return *this;
13018 }
13019
13021 template<typename... Headers>
13022 CORSRules& headers(const std::string& header, Headers... header_list)
13023 {
13024 add_list_item(headers_, header);
13025 headers(header_list...);
13026 return *this;
13027 }
13028
13030 CORSRules& expose(const std::string& header)
13031 {
13032 add_list_item(exposed_headers_, header);
13033 return *this;
13034 }
13035
13037 template<typename... Headers>
13038 CORSRules& expose(const std::string& header, Headers... header_list)
13039 {
13040 add_list_item(exposed_headers_, header);
13041 expose(header_list...);
13042 return *this;
13043 }
13044
13046 CORSRules& max_age(int max_age)
13047 {
13048 max_age_ = std::to_string(max_age);
13049 return *this;
13050 }
13051
13053 CORSRules& allow_credentials()
13054 {
13055 allow_credentials_ = true;
13056 return *this;
13057 }
13058
13060 void ignore()
13061 {
13062 ignore_ = true;
13063 }
13064
13066 CORSRules& prefix(const std::string& prefix);
13067
13069 CORSRules& blueprint(const Blueprint& bp);
13070
13072 CORSRules& global();
13073
13074 private:
13075 CORSRules() = delete;
13076 CORSRules(CORSHandler* handler):
13077 handler_(handler) {}
13078
13080 void add_list_item(std::string& list, const std::string& val)
13081 {
13082 if (list == "*") list = "";
13083 if (list.size() > 0) list += ", ";
13084 list += val;
13085 }
13086
13088 void set_header_no_override(const std::string& key, const std::string& value, crow::response& res)
13089 {
13090 if (value.size() == 0) return;
13091 if (!get_header_value(res.headers, key).empty()) return;
13092 res.add_header(key, value);
13093 }
13094
13096 void apply(const request& req, response& res)
13097 {
13098 if (ignore_) return;
13099
13100 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Methods", methods_, res);
13101 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Headers", headers_, res);
13102 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Expose-Headers", exposed_headers_, res);
13103 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Max-Age", max_age_, res);
13104
13105 bool origin_set = false;
13106
13107 if (req.method != HTTPMethod::Options)
13108 {
13109 if (allow_credentials_)
13110 {
13111 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Credentials", "true", res);
13112 if (origin_ == "*")
13113 {
13114 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", req.get_header_value("Origin"), res);
13115 origin_set = true;
13116 }
13117 }
13118 }
13119
13120 if( !origin_set){
13121 set_header_no_override("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", origin_, res);
13122 }
13123 }
13124
13125 bool ignore_ = false;
13126 // TODO: support multiple origins that are dynamically selected
13127 std::string origin_ = "*";
13128 std::string methods_ = "*";
13129 std::string headers_ = "*";
13130 std::string exposed_headers_;
13131 std::string max_age_;
13132 bool allow_credentials_ = false;
13133
13134 CORSHandler* handler_;
13135 };
13136
13138
13143 struct CORSHandler
13144 {
13145 struct context
13146 {};
13147
13148 void before_handle(crow::request& /*req*/, crow::response& /*res*/, context& /*ctx*/)
13149 {}
13150
13151 void after_handle(crow::request& req, crow::response& res, context& /*ctx*/)
13152 {
13153 auto& rule = find_rule(req.url);
13154 rule.apply(req, res);
13155 }
13156
13158 CORSRules& prefix(const std::string& prefix)
13159 {
13160 rules.emplace_back(prefix, CORSRules(this));
13161 return rules.back().second;
13162 }
13163
13165 CORSRules& blueprint(const Blueprint& bp)
13166 {
13167 rules.emplace_back(bp.prefix(), CORSRules(this));
13168 return rules.back().second;
13169 }
13170
13172 CORSRules& global()
13173 {
13174 return default_;
13175 }
13176
13177 private:
13178 CORSRules& find_rule(const std::string& path)
13179 {
13180 // TODO: use a trie in case of many rules
13181 for (auto& rule : rules)
13182 {
13183 // Check if path starts with a rules prefix
13184 if (path.rfind(rule.first, 0) == 0)
13185 {
13186 return rule.second;
13187 }
13188 }
13189 return default_;
13190 }
13191
13192 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, CORSRules>> rules;
13193 CORSRules default_ = CORSRules(this);
13194 };
13195
13196 inline CORSRules& CORSRules::prefix(const std::string& prefix)
13197 {
13198 return handler_->prefix(prefix);
13199 }
13200
13201 inline CORSRules& CORSRules::blueprint(const Blueprint& bp)
13202 {
13203 return handler_->blueprint(bp);
13204 }
13205
13206 inline CORSRules& CORSRules::global()
13207 {
13208 return handler_->global();
13209 }
13210
13211} // namespace crow
13212
13213
13214#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
13215#include <boost/asio.hpp>
13216#else
13217#ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
13218#define ASIO_STANDALONE
13219#endif
13220#include <asio.hpp>
13221#endif
13222
13223#include <algorithm>
13224#include <atomic>
13225#include <chrono>
13226#include <memory>
13227#include <vector>
13228
13229
13230namespace crow
13231{
13232#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
13233 namespace asio = boost::asio;
13234 using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
13235#else
13236 using error_code = asio::error_code;
13237#endif
13238 using tcp = asio::ip::tcp;
13239
13240#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
13241 static std::atomic<int> connectionCount;
13242#endif
13243
13245 template<typename Adaptor, typename Handler, typename... Middlewares>
13246 class Connection : public std::enable_shared_from_this<Connection<Adaptor, Handler, Middlewares...>>
13247 {
13248 friend struct crow::response;
13249
13250 public:
13251 Connection(
13252 asio::io_context& io_context,
13253 Handler* handler,
13254 const std::string& server_name,
13255 std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares,
13256 std::function<std::string()>& get_cached_date_str_f,
13257 detail::task_timer& task_timer,
13258 typename Adaptor::context* adaptor_ctx_,
13259 std::atomic<unsigned int>& queue_length):
13260 adaptor_(io_context, adaptor_ctx_),
13261 handler_(handler),
13262 parser_(this),
13263 req_(parser_.req),
13264 server_name_(server_name),
13265 middlewares_(middlewares),
13266 get_cached_date_str(get_cached_date_str_f),
13267 task_timer_(task_timer),
13268 res_stream_threshold_(handler->stream_threshold()),
13269 queue_length_(queue_length)
13270 {
13271#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
13272 connectionCount++;
13273 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Connection (" << this << ") allocated, total: " << connectionCount;
13274#endif
13275 }
13276
13277 ~Connection()
13278 {
13279#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_DEBUG
13280 connectionCount--;
13281 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Connection (" << this << ") freed, total: " << connectionCount;
13282#endif
13283 }
13284
13286 decltype(std::declval<Adaptor>().raw_socket())& socket()
13287 {
13288 return adaptor_.raw_socket();
13289 }
13290
13291 void start()
13292 {
13293 auto self = this->shared_from_this();
13294 adaptor_.start([self](const error_code& ec) {
13295 if (!ec)
13296 {
13297 self->start_deadline();
13298 self->parser_.clear();
13299
13300 self->do_read();
13301 }
13302 else
13303 {
13304 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Could not start adaptor: " << ec.message();
13305 }
13306 });
13307 }
13308
13309 void handle_url()
13310 {
13311 routing_handle_result_ = handler_->handle_initial(req_, res);
13312 // if no route is found for the request method, return the response without parsing or processing anything further.
13313 if (!routing_handle_result_->rule_index)
13314 {
13315 parser_.done();
13316 need_to_call_after_handlers_ = true;
13317 complete_request();
13318 }
13319 }
13320
13321 void handle_header()
13322 {
13323 // HTTP 1.1 Expect: 100-continue
13324 if (req_.http_ver_major == 1 && req_.http_ver_minor == 1 && get_header_value(req_.headers, "expect") == "100-continue")
13325 {
13326 continue_requested = true;
13327 buffers_.clear();
13328 static std::string expect_100_continue = "HTTP/1.1 100 Continue\r\n\r\n";
13329 buffers_.emplace_back(expect_100_continue.data(), expect_100_continue.size());
13330 do_write_sync(buffers_);
13331 }
13332 }
13333
13334 void handle()
13335 {
13336 // TODO(EDev): cancel_deadline_timer should be looked into, it might be a good idea to add it to handle_url() and then restart the timer once everything passes
13337 cancel_deadline_timer();
13338 bool is_invalid_request = false;
13339 add_keep_alive_ = false;
13340
13341 // Create context
13342 ctx_ = detail::context<Middlewares...>();
13343 req_.middleware_context = static_cast<void*>(&ctx_);
13344 req_.middleware_container = static_cast<void*>(middlewares_);
13345 req_.io_context = &adaptor_.get_io_context();
13346
13347 req_.remote_ip_address = adaptor_.remote_endpoint().address().to_string();
13348
13349 add_keep_alive_ = req_.keep_alive;
13350 close_connection_ = req_.close_connection;
13351
13352 if (req_.check_version(1, 1)) // HTTP/1.1
13353 {
13354 if (!req_.headers.count("host"))
13355 {
13356 is_invalid_request = true;
13357 res = response(400);
13358 }
13359 else if (req_.upgrade)
13360 {
13361 // h2 or h2c headers
13362 if (req_.get_header_value("upgrade").find("h2")==0)
13363 {
13364 // TODO(ipkn): HTTP/2
13365 // currently, ignore upgrade header
13366 }
13367 else
13368 {
13369
13370 detail::middleware_call_helper<detail::middleware_call_criteria_only_global,
13371 0, decltype(ctx_), decltype(*middlewares_)>({}, *middlewares_, req_, res, ctx_);
13372 close_connection_ = true;
13373 handler_->handle_upgrade(req_, res, std::move(adaptor_));
13374 return;
13375 }
13376 }
13377 }
13378
13379 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Request: " << utility::lexical_cast<std::string>(adaptor_.remote_endpoint()) << " " << this << " HTTP/" << (char)(req_.http_ver_major + '0') << "." << (char)(req_.http_ver_minor + '0') << ' ' << method_name(req_.method) << " " << req_.url;
13380
13381
13382 need_to_call_after_handlers_ = false;
13383 if (!is_invalid_request)
13384 {
13385 res.complete_request_handler_ = nullptr;
13386 auto self = this->shared_from_this();
13387 res.is_alive_helper_ = [self]() -> bool {
13388 return self->adaptor_.is_open();
13389 };
13390
13391 detail::middleware_call_helper<detail::middleware_call_criteria_only_global,
13392 0, decltype(ctx_), decltype(*middlewares_)>({}, *middlewares_, req_, res, ctx_);
13393
13394 if (!res.completed_)
13395 {
13396 res.complete_request_handler_ = [self] {
13397 self->complete_request();
13398 };
13399 need_to_call_after_handlers_ = true;
13400 handler_->handle(req_, res, routing_handle_result_);
13401 if (add_keep_alive_)
13402 res.set_header("connection", "Keep-Alive");
13403 }
13404 else
13405 {
13406 complete_request();
13407 }
13408 }
13409 else
13410 {
13411 complete_request();
13412 }
13413 }
13414
13416 void complete_request()
13417 {
13418 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Response: " << this << ' ' << req_.raw_url << ' ' << res.code << ' ' << close_connection_;
13419 res.is_alive_helper_ = nullptr;
13420
13421 if (need_to_call_after_handlers_)
13422 {
13423 need_to_call_after_handlers_ = false;
13424
13425 // call all after_handler of middlewares
13426 detail::after_handlers_call_helper<
13427 detail::middleware_call_criteria_only_global,
13428 (static_cast<int>(sizeof...(Middlewares)) - 1),
13429 decltype(ctx_),
13430 decltype(*middlewares_)>({}, *middlewares_, ctx_, req_, res);
13431 }
13432#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
13433 if (!res.body.empty() && handler_->compression_used())
13434 {
13435 std::string accept_encoding = req_.get_header_value("Accept-Encoding");
13436 if (!accept_encoding.empty() && res.compressed)
13437 {
13438 switch (handler_->compression_algorithm())
13439 {
13440 case compression::DEFLATE:
13441 if (accept_encoding.find("deflate") != std::string::npos)
13442 {
13443 res.body = compression::compress_string(res.body, compression::algorithm::DEFLATE);
13444 res.set_header("Content-Encoding", "deflate");
13445 }
13446 break;
13447 case compression::GZIP:
13448 if (accept_encoding.find("gzip") != std::string::npos)
13449 {
13450 res.body = compression::compress_string(res.body, compression::algorithm::GZIP);
13451 res.set_header("Content-Encoding", "gzip");
13452 }
13453 break;
13454 default:
13455 break;
13456 }
13457 }
13458 }
13459#endif
13460
13461 prepare_buffers();
13462
13463 if (res.is_static_type())
13464 {
13465 do_write_static();
13466 }
13467 else
13468 {
13469 do_write_general();
13470 }
13471 }
13472
13473 private:
13474 void prepare_buffers()
13475 {
13476 res.complete_request_handler_ = nullptr;
13477 res.is_alive_helper_ = nullptr;
13478
13479 if (!adaptor_.is_open())
13480 {
13481 //CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " delete (socket is closed) " << is_reading << ' ' << is_writing;
13482 //delete this;
13483 return;
13484 }
13485 // TODO(EDev): HTTP version in status codes should be dynamic
13486 // Keep in sync with common.h/status
13487 static std::unordered_map<int, std::string> statusCodes = {
13488 {status::CONTINUE, "HTTP/1.1 100 Continue\r\n"},
13489 {status::SWITCHING_PROTOCOLS, "HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols\r\n"},
13490
13491 {status::OK, "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n"},
13492 {status::CREATED, "HTTP/1.1 201 Created\r\n"},
13493 {status::ACCEPTED, "HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted\r\n"},
13494 {status::NON_AUTHORITATIVE_INFORMATION, "HTTP/1.1 203 Non-Authoritative Information\r\n"},
13495 {status::NO_CONTENT, "HTTP/1.1 204 No Content\r\n"},
13496 {status::RESET_CONTENT, "HTTP/1.1 205 Reset Content\r\n"},
13497 {status::PARTIAL_CONTENT, "HTTP/1.1 206 Partial Content\r\n"},
13498
13499 {status::MULTIPLE_CHOICES, "HTTP/1.1 300 Multiple Choices\r\n"},
13500 {status::MOVED_PERMANENTLY, "HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently\r\n"},
13501 {status::FOUND, "HTTP/1.1 302 Found\r\n"},
13502 {status::SEE_OTHER, "HTTP/1.1 303 See Other\r\n"},
13503 {status::NOT_MODIFIED, "HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified\r\n"},
13504 {status::TEMPORARY_REDIRECT, "HTTP/1.1 307 Temporary Redirect\r\n"},
13505 {status::PERMANENT_REDIRECT, "HTTP/1.1 308 Permanent Redirect\r\n"},
13506
13507 {status::BAD_REQUEST, "HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request\r\n"},
13508 {status::UNAUTHORIZED, "HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized\r\n"},
13509 {status::FORBIDDEN, "HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden\r\n"},
13510 {status::NOT_FOUND, "HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found\r\n"},
13511 {status::METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED, "HTTP/1.1 405 Method Not Allowed\r\n"},
13512 {status::NOT_ACCEPTABLE, "HTTP/1.1 406 Not Acceptable\r\n"},
13513 {status::PROXY_AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED, "HTTP/1.1 407 Proxy Authentication Required\r\n"},
13514 {status::CONFLICT, "HTTP/1.1 409 Conflict\r\n"},
13515 {status::GONE, "HTTP/1.1 410 Gone\r\n"},
13516 {status::PAYLOAD_TOO_LARGE, "HTTP/1.1 413 Payload Too Large\r\n"},
13517 {status::UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE, "HTTP/1.1 415 Unsupported Media Type\r\n"},
13518 {status::RANGE_NOT_SATISFIABLE, "HTTP/1.1 416 Range Not Satisfiable\r\n"},
13519 {status::EXPECTATION_FAILED, "HTTP/1.1 417 Expectation Failed\r\n"},
13520 {status::PRECONDITION_REQUIRED, "HTTP/1.1 428 Precondition Required\r\n"},
13521 {status::TOO_MANY_REQUESTS, "HTTP/1.1 429 Too Many Requests\r\n"},
13522 {status::UNAVAILABLE_FOR_LEGAL_REASONS, "HTTP/1.1 451 Unavailable For Legal Reasons\r\n"},
13523
13524 {status::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, "HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error\r\n"},
13525 {status::NOT_IMPLEMENTED, "HTTP/1.1 501 Not Implemented\r\n"},
13526 {status::BAD_GATEWAY, "HTTP/1.1 502 Bad Gateway\r\n"},
13527 {status::SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE, "HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable\r\n"},
13528 {status::GATEWAY_TIMEOUT, "HTTP/1.1 504 Gateway Timeout\r\n"},
13529 {status::VARIANT_ALSO_NEGOTIATES, "HTTP/1.1 506 Variant Also Negotiates\r\n"},
13530 };
13531
13532 static const std::string seperator = ": ";
13533
13534 buffers_.clear();
13535 buffers_.reserve(4 * (res.headers.size() + 5) + 3);
13536
13537 if (!statusCodes.count(res.code))
13538 {
13539 CROW_LOG_WARNING << this << " status code "
13540 << "(" << res.code << ")"
13541 << " not defined, returning 500 instead";
13542 res.code = 500;
13543 }
13544
13545 auto& status = statusCodes.find(res.code)->second;
13546 buffers_.emplace_back(status.data(), status.size());
13547
13548 if (res.code >= 400 && res.body.empty())
13549 res.body = statusCodes[res.code].substr(9);
13550
13551 for (auto& kv : res.headers)
13552 {
13553 buffers_.emplace_back(kv.first.data(), kv.first.size());
13554 buffers_.emplace_back(seperator.data(), seperator.size());
13555 buffers_.emplace_back(kv.second.data(), kv.second.size());
13556 buffers_.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
13557 }
13558
13559 if (!res.manual_length_header && !res.headers.count("content-length"))
13560 {
13561 content_length_ = std::to_string(res.body.size());
13562 static std::string content_length_tag = "Content-Length: ";
13563 buffers_.emplace_back(content_length_tag.data(), content_length_tag.size());
13564 buffers_.emplace_back(content_length_.data(), content_length_.size());
13565 buffers_.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
13566 }
13567 if (!res.headers.count("server"))
13568 {
13569 static std::string server_tag = "Server: ";
13570 buffers_.emplace_back(server_tag.data(), server_tag.size());
13571 buffers_.emplace_back(server_name_.data(), server_name_.size());
13572 buffers_.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
13573 }
13574 if (!res.headers.count("date"))
13575 {
13576 static std::string date_tag = "Date: ";
13577 date_str_ = get_cached_date_str();
13578 buffers_.emplace_back(date_tag.data(), date_tag.size());
13579 buffers_.emplace_back(date_str_.data(), date_str_.size());
13580 buffers_.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
13581 }
13582 if (add_keep_alive_)
13583 {
13584 static std::string keep_alive_tag = "Connection: Keep-Alive";
13585 buffers_.emplace_back(keep_alive_tag.data(), keep_alive_tag.size());
13586 buffers_.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
13587 }
13588
13589 buffers_.emplace_back(crlf.data(), crlf.size());
13590 }
13591
13592 void do_write_static()
13593 {
13594 asio::write(adaptor_.socket(), buffers_);
13595
13596 if (res.file_info.statResult == 0)
13597 {
13598 std::ifstream is(res.file_info.path.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
13599 std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers{1};
13600 char buf[16384];
13601 is.read(buf, sizeof(buf));
13602 while (is.gcount() > 0)
13603 {
13604 buffers[0] = asio::buffer(buf, is.gcount());
13605 do_write_sync(buffers);
13606 is.read(buf, sizeof(buf));
13607 }
13608 }
13609 if (close_connection_)
13610 {
13611 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
13612 adaptor_.close();
13613 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " from write (static)";
13614 }
13615
13616 res.end();
13617 res.clear();
13618 buffers_.clear();
13619 parser_.clear();
13620 }
13621
13622 void do_write_general()
13623 {
13624 if (res.body.length() < res_stream_threshold_)
13625 {
13626 res_body_copy_.swap(res.body);
13627 buffers_.emplace_back(res_body_copy_.data(), res_body_copy_.size());
13628
13629 do_write_sync(buffers_);
13630
13631 if (need_to_start_read_after_complete_)
13632 {
13633 need_to_start_read_after_complete_ = false;
13634 start_deadline();
13635 do_read();
13636 }
13637 }
13638 else
13639 {
13640 asio::write(adaptor_.socket(), buffers_); // Write the response start / headers
13641 cancel_deadline_timer();
13642 if (res.body.length() > 0)
13643 {
13644 std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers{1};
13645 const uint8_t* data = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(res.body.data());
13646 size_t length = res.body.length();
13647 for (size_t transferred = 0; transferred < length;)
13648 {
13649 size_t to_transfer = CROW_MIN(16384UL, length - transferred);
13650 buffers[0] = asio::const_buffer(data + transferred, to_transfer);
13651 do_write_sync(buffers);
13652 transferred += to_transfer;
13653 }
13654 }
13655 if (close_connection_)
13656 {
13657 adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
13658 adaptor_.close();
13659 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " from write (res_stream)";
13660 }
13661
13662 res.end();
13663 res.clear();
13664 buffers_.clear();
13665 parser_.clear();
13666 }
13667 }
13668
13669 void do_read()
13670 {
13671 auto self = this->shared_from_this();
13672 adaptor_.socket().async_read_some(
13673 asio::buffer(buffer_),
13674 [self](const error_code& ec, std::size_t bytes_transferred) {
13675 bool error_while_reading = true;
13676 if (!ec)
13677 {
13678 bool ret = self->parser_.feed(self->buffer_.data(), bytes_transferred);
13679 if (ret && self->adaptor_.is_open())
13680 {
13681 error_while_reading = false;
13682 }
13683 }
13684
13685 if (error_while_reading)
13686 {
13687 self->cancel_deadline_timer();
13688 self->parser_.done();
13689 self->adaptor_.shutdown_read();
13690 self->adaptor_.close();
13691 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << self << " from read(1) with description: \"" << http_errno_description(static_cast<http_errno>(self->parser_.http_errno)) << '\"';
13692 }
13693 else if (self->close_connection_)
13694 {
13695 self->cancel_deadline_timer();
13696 self->parser_.done();
13697 // adaptor will close after write
13698 }
13699 else if (!self->need_to_call_after_handlers_)
13700 {
13701 self->start_deadline();
13702 self->do_read();
13703 }
13704 else
13705 {
13706 // res will be completed later by user
13707 self->need_to_start_read_after_complete_ = true;
13708 }
13709 });
13710 }
13711
13712 void do_write()
13713 {
13714 auto self = this->shared_from_this();
13715 asio::async_write(
13716 adaptor_.socket(), buffers_,
13717 [self](const error_code& ec, std::size_t /*bytes_transferred*/) {
13718 self->res.clear();
13719 self->res_body_copy_.clear();
13720 if (!self->continue_requested)
13721 {
13722 self->parser_.clear();
13723 }
13724 else
13725 {
13726 self->continue_requested = false;
13727 }
13728
13729 if (!ec)
13730 {
13731 if (self->close_connection_)
13732 {
13733 self->adaptor_.shutdown_write();
13734 self->adaptor_.close();
13735 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << self << " from write(1)";
13736 }
13737 }
13738 else
13739 {
13740 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << self << " from write(2)";
13741 }
13742 });
13743 }
13744
13745 inline void do_write_sync(std::vector<asio::const_buffer>& buffers)
13746 {
13747
13748 asio::write(adaptor_.socket(), buffers, [&](error_code ec, std::size_t) {
13749 if (!ec)
13750 {
13751 return false;
13752 }
13753 else
13754 {
13755 CROW_LOG_ERROR << ec << " - happened while sending buffers";
13756 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " from write (sync)(2)";
13757 return true;
13758 }
13759 });
13760 }
13761
13762 void cancel_deadline_timer()
13763 {
13764 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " timer cancelled: " << &task_timer_ << ' ' << task_id_;
13765 task_timer_.cancel(task_id_);
13766 }
13767
13768 void start_deadline(/*int timeout = 5*/)
13769 {
13770 cancel_deadline_timer();
13771
13772 auto self = this->shared_from_this();
13773 task_id_ = task_timer_.schedule([self] {
13774 if (!self->adaptor_.is_open())
13775 {
13776 return;
13777 }
13778 self->adaptor_.shutdown_readwrite();
13779 self->adaptor_.close();
13780 });
13781 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << this << " timer added: " << &task_timer_ << ' ' << task_id_;
13782 }
13783
13784 private:
13785 Adaptor adaptor_;
13786 Handler* handler_;
13787
13788 std::array<char, 4096> buffer_;
13789
13790 HTTPParser<Connection> parser_;
13791 std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> routing_handle_result_;
13792 request& req_;
13793 response res;
13794
13795 bool close_connection_ = false;
13796
13797 const std::string& server_name_;
13798 std::vector<asio::const_buffer> buffers_;
13799
13800 std::string content_length_;
13801 std::string date_str_;
13802 std::string res_body_copy_;
13803
13804 detail::task_timer::identifier_type task_id_{};
13805
13806 bool continue_requested{};
13807 bool need_to_call_after_handlers_{};
13808 bool need_to_start_read_after_complete_{};
13809 bool add_keep_alive_{};
13810
13811 std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares_;
13812 detail::context<Middlewares...> ctx_;
13813
13814 std::function<std::string()>& get_cached_date_str;
13815 detail::task_timer& task_timer_;
13816
13817 size_t res_stream_threshold_;
13818
13819 std::atomic<unsigned int>& queue_length_;
13820 };
13821
13822} // namespace crow
13823
13824
13825#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
13826#include <boost/asio.hpp>
13827#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
13828#include <boost/asio/ssl.hpp>
13829#endif
13830#else
13831#ifndef ASIO_STANDALONE
13832#define ASIO_STANDALONE
13833#endif
13834#include <asio.hpp>
13835#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
13836#include <asio/ssl.hpp>
13837#endif
13838#endif
13839
13840#include <atomic>
13841#include <chrono>
13842#include <cstdint>
13843#include <future>
13844#include <memory>
13845#include <vector>
13846
13847
13848
13849namespace crow // NOTE: Already documented in "crow/app.h"
13850{
13851#ifdef CROW_USE_BOOST
13852 namespace asio = boost::asio;
13853 using error_code = boost::system::error_code;
13854#else
13855 using error_code = asio::error_code;
13856#endif
13857 using tcp = asio::ip::tcp;
13858
13859 template<typename Handler, typename Adaptor = SocketAdaptor, typename... Middlewares>
13860 class Server
13861 {
13862 public:
13863 Server(Handler* handler,
13864 const tcp::endpoint& endpoint,
13865 std::string server_name = std::string("Crow/") + VERSION,
13866 std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares = nullptr,
13867 uint16_t concurrency = 1,
13868 uint8_t timeout = 5,
13869 typename Adaptor::context* adaptor_ctx = nullptr):
13870 acceptor_(io_context_,endpoint),
13871 signals_(io_context_),
13872 tick_timer_(io_context_),
13873 handler_(handler),
13874 concurrency_(concurrency),
13875 timeout_(timeout),
13876 server_name_(server_name),
13877 task_queue_length_pool_(concurrency_ - 1),
13878 middlewares_(middlewares),
13879 adaptor_ctx_(adaptor_ctx)
13880 {}
13881
13882 void set_tick_function(std::chrono::milliseconds d, std::function<void()> f)
13883 {
13884 tick_interval_ = d;
13885 tick_function_ = f;
13886 }
13887
13888 void on_tick()
13889 {
13890 tick_function_();
13891 tick_timer_.expires_after(std::chrono::milliseconds(tick_interval_.count()));
13892 tick_timer_.async_wait([this](const error_code& ec) {
13893 if (ec)
13894 return;
13895 on_tick();
13896 });
13897 }
13898
13899 void run()
13900 {
13901 uint16_t worker_thread_count = concurrency_ - 1;
13902 for (int i = 0; i < worker_thread_count; i++)
13903 io_context_pool_.emplace_back(new asio::io_context());
13904 get_cached_date_str_pool_.resize(worker_thread_count);
13905 task_timer_pool_.resize(worker_thread_count);
13906
13907 std::vector<std::future<void>> v;
13908 std::atomic<int> init_count(0);
13909 for (uint16_t i = 0; i < worker_thread_count; i++)
13910 v.push_back(
13911 std::async(
13912 std::launch::async, [this, i, &init_count] {
13913 // thread local date string get function
13914 auto last = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
13915
13916 std::string date_str;
13917 auto update_date_str = [&] {
13918 auto last_time_t = time(0);
13919 tm my_tm;
13920
13921#if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)
13922 gmtime_s(&my_tm, &last_time_t);
13923#else
13924 gmtime_r(&last_time_t, &my_tm);
13925#endif
13926 date_str.resize(100);
13927 size_t date_str_sz = strftime(&date_str[0], 99, "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT", &my_tm);
13928 date_str.resize(date_str_sz);
13929 };
13930 update_date_str();
13931 get_cached_date_str_pool_[i] = [&]() -> std::string {
13932 if (std::chrono::steady_clock::now() - last >= std::chrono::seconds(1))
13933 {
13934 last = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
13935 update_date_str();
13936 }
13937 return date_str;
13938 };
13939
13940 // initializing task timers
13941 detail::task_timer task_timer(*io_context_pool_[i]);
13942 task_timer.set_default_timeout(timeout_);
13943 task_timer_pool_[i] = &task_timer;
13944 task_queue_length_pool_[i] = 0;
13945
13946 init_count++;
13947 while (1)
13948 {
13949 try
13950 {
13951 if (io_context_pool_[i]->run() == 0)
13952 {
13953 // when io_service.run returns 0, there are no more works to do.
13954 break;
13955 }
13956 }
13957 catch (std::exception& e)
13958 {
13959 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Worker Crash: An uncaught exception occurred: " << e.what();
13960 }
13961 }
13962 }));
13963
13964 if (tick_function_ && tick_interval_.count() > 0)
13965 {
13966 tick_timer_.expires_after(std::chrono::milliseconds(tick_interval_.count()));
13967 tick_timer_.async_wait(
13968 [this](const error_code& ec) {
13969 if (ec)
13970 return;
13971 on_tick();
13972 });
13973 }
13974
13975 handler_->port(acceptor_.local_endpoint().port());
13976
13977
13978 CROW_LOG_INFO << server_name_
13979 << " server is running at " << (handler_->ssl_used() ? "https://" : "http://")
13980 << acceptor_.local_endpoint().address() << ":" << acceptor_.local_endpoint().port() << " using " << concurrency_ << " threads";
13981 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Call `app.loglevel(crow::LogLevel::Warning)` to hide Info level logs.";
13982
13983 signals_.async_wait(
13984 [&](const error_code& /*error*/, int /*signal_number*/) {
13985 stop();
13986 });
13987
13988 while (worker_thread_count != init_count)
13989 std::this_thread::yield();
13990
13991 do_accept();
13992
13993 std::thread(
13994 [this] {
13995 notify_start();
13996 io_context_.run();
13997 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Exiting.";
13998 })
13999 .join();
14000 }
14001
14002 void stop()
14003 {
14004 shutting_down_ = true; // Prevent the acceptor from taking new connections
14005 for (auto& io_context : io_context_pool_)
14006 {
14007 if (io_context != nullptr)
14008 {
14009 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Closing IO service " << &io_context;
14010 io_context->stop(); // Close all io_services (and HTTP connections)
14011 }
14012 }
14013
14014 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Closing main IO service (" << &io_context_ << ')';
14015 io_context_.stop(); // Close main io_service
14016 }
14017
14018 uint16_t port() const {
14019 return acceptor_.local_endpoint().port();
14020 }
14021
14023 std::cv_status wait_for_start(std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point wait_until)
14024 {
14025 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
14026
14027 std::cv_status status = std::cv_status::no_timeout;
14028 while (!server_started_ && ( status==std::cv_status::no_timeout ))
14029 status = cv_started_.wait_until(lock,wait_until);
14030 return status;
14031 }
14032
14033 void signal_clear()
14034 {
14035 signals_.clear();
14036 }
14037
14038 void signal_add(int signal_number)
14039 {
14040 signals_.add(signal_number);
14041 }
14042
14043 private:
14044 uint16_t pick_io_context_idx()
14045 {
14046 uint16_t min_queue_idx = 0;
14047
14048 // TODO improve load balancing
14049 // size_t is used here to avoid the security issue https://codeql.github.com/codeql-query-help/cpp/cpp-comparison-with-wider-type/
14050 // even though the max value of this can be only uint16_t as concurrency is uint16_t.
14051 for (size_t i = 1; i < task_queue_length_pool_.size() && task_queue_length_pool_[min_queue_idx] > 0; i++)
14052 // No need to check other io_services if the current one has no tasks
14053 {
14054 if (task_queue_length_pool_[i] < task_queue_length_pool_[min_queue_idx])
14055 min_queue_idx = i;
14056 }
14057 return min_queue_idx;
14058 }
14059
14060 void do_accept()
14061 {
14062 if (!shutting_down_)
14063 {
14064 uint16_t context_idx = pick_io_context_idx();
14065 asio::io_context& ic = *io_context_pool_[context_idx];
14066 task_queue_length_pool_[context_idx]++;
14067 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << &ic << " {" << context_idx << "} queue length: " << task_queue_length_pool_[context_idx];
14068
14069 auto p = std::make_shared<Connection<Adaptor, Handler, Middlewares...>>(
14070 ic, handler_, server_name_, middlewares_,
14071 get_cached_date_str_pool_[context_idx], *task_timer_pool_[context_idx], adaptor_ctx_, task_queue_length_pool_[context_idx]);
14072
14073 acceptor_.async_accept(
14074 p->socket(),
14075 [this, p, &ic, context_idx](error_code ec) {
14076 if (!ec)
14077 {
14078 asio::post(ic,
14079 [p] {
14080 p->start();
14081 });
14082 }
14083 else
14084 {
14085 task_queue_length_pool_[context_idx]--;
14086 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << &ic << " {" << context_idx << "} queue length: " << task_queue_length_pool_[context_idx];
14087 }
14088 do_accept();
14089 });
14090 }
14091 }
14092
14094 void notify_start()
14095 {
14096 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
14097 server_started_ = true;
14098 cv_started_.notify_all();
14099 }
14100
14101 private:
14102 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<asio::io_context>> io_context_pool_;
14103 asio::io_context io_context_;
14104 std::vector<detail::task_timer*> task_timer_pool_;
14105 std::vector<std::function<std::string()>> get_cached_date_str_pool_;
14106 tcp::acceptor acceptor_;
14107 bool shutting_down_ = false;
14108 bool server_started_{false};
14109 std::condition_variable cv_started_;
14110 std::mutex start_mutex_;
14111 asio::signal_set signals_;
14112
14113 asio::basic_waitable_timer<std::chrono::high_resolution_clock> tick_timer_;
14114
14115 Handler* handler_;
14116 uint16_t concurrency_{2};
14117 std::uint8_t timeout_;
14118 std::string server_name_;
14119 std::vector<std::atomic<unsigned int>> task_queue_length_pool_;
14120
14121 std::chrono::milliseconds tick_interval_;
14122 std::function<void()> tick_function_;
14123
14124 std::tuple<Middlewares...>* middlewares_;
14125
14126 typename Adaptor::context* adaptor_ctx_;
14127 };
14128} // namespace crow
14129
14148#include <chrono>
14149#include <string>
14150#include <functional>
14151#include <memory>
14152#include <future>
14153#include <cstdint>
14154#include <type_traits>
14155#include <thread>
14156#include <condition_variable>
14157
14158#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
14159#endif // #ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
14160
14161
14162#ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
14163
14164#define CROW_ROUTE(app, url) app.route_dynamic(url) // See the documentation in the comment below.
14165#define CROW_BP_ROUTE(blueprint, url) blueprint.new_rule_dynamic(url) // See the documentation in the comment below.
14166
14167#else // #ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
14168
14187#define CROW_ROUTE(app, url) app.template route<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(url)>(url)
14188
14211#define CROW_BP_ROUTE(blueprint, url) blueprint.new_rule_tagged<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(url)>(url)
14212
14240#define CROW_WEBSOCKET_ROUTE(app, url) app.route<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(url)>(url).websocket<std::remove_reference<decltype(app)>::type>(&app)
14241
14262#define CROW_MIDDLEWARES(app, ...) template middlewares<typename std::remove_reference<decltype(app)>::type, __VA_ARGS__>()
14263
14264#endif // #ifdef CROW_MSVC_WORKAROUND
14265
14278#define CROW_CATCHALL_ROUTE(app) app.catchall_route()
14279
14290#define CROW_BP_CATCHALL_ROUTE(blueprint) blueprint.catchall_rule()
14291
14292
14302namespace crow
14303{
14304#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14305 using ssl_context_t = asio::ssl::context;
14306#endif
14314 template<typename... Middlewares>
14315 class Crow
14316 {
14317 public:
14319 using self_t = Crow;
14320
14322 using server_t = Server<Crow, SocketAdaptor, Middlewares...>;
14323
14324#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14326 using ssl_server_t = Server<Crow, SSLAdaptor, Middlewares...>;
14327#endif
14328 Crow()
14329 {}
14330
14332 template<typename... Ts>
14333 Crow(Ts&&... ts):
14334 middlewares_(make_middleware_tuple(std::forward<Ts>(ts)...))
14335 {}
14336
14340 template<typename Adaptor>
14341 void handle_upgrade(const request& req, response& res, Adaptor&& adaptor)
14342 {
14343 router_.handle_upgrade(req, res, adaptor);
14344 }
14345
14347 std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result> handle_initial(request& req, response& res)
14348 {
14349 return router_.handle_initial(req, res);
14350 }
14351
14353 void handle(request& req, response& res, std::unique_ptr<routing_handle_result>& found)
14354 {
14355 router_.handle<self_t>(req, res, *found);
14356 }
14357
14359 void handle_full(request& req, response& res)
14360 {
14361 auto found = handle_initial(req, res);
14362 if (found->rule_index)
14363 handle(req, res, found);
14364 }
14365
14367 DynamicRule& route_dynamic(const std::string& rule)
14368 {
14369 return router_.new_rule_dynamic(rule);
14370 }
14371
14373 template<uint64_t Tag>
14374 auto route(const std::string& rule)
14375 -> typename std::invoke_result<decltype(&Router::new_rule_tagged<Tag>), Router, const std::string&>::type
14376 {
14377 return router_.new_rule_tagged<Tag>(rule);
14378 }
14379
14381 CatchallRule& catchall_route()
14382 {
14383 return router_.catchall_rule();
14384 }
14385
14387 self_t& websocket_max_payload(uint64_t max_payload)
14388 {
14389 max_payload_ = max_payload;
14390 return *this;
14391 }
14392
14394 uint64_t websocket_max_payload()
14395 {
14396 return max_payload_;
14397 }
14398
14399 self_t& signal_clear()
14400 {
14401 signals_.clear();
14402 return *this;
14403 }
14404
14405 self_t& signal_add(int signal_number)
14406 {
14407 signals_.push_back(signal_number);
14408 return *this;
14409 }
14410
14411 std::vector<int> signals()
14412 {
14413 return signals_;
14414 }
14415
14417 self_t& port(std::uint16_t port)
14418 {
14419 port_ = port;
14420 return *this;
14421 }
14422
14424 std::uint16_t port() const
14425 {
14426 if (!server_started_)
14427 {
14428 return port_;
14429 }
14430#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14431 if (ssl_used_)
14432 {
14433 return ssl_server_->port();
14434 }
14435 else
14436#endif
14437 {
14438 return server_->port();
14439 }
14440 }
14441
14443 self_t& timeout(std::uint8_t timeout)
14444 {
14445 timeout_ = timeout;
14446 return *this;
14447 }
14448
14450 self_t& server_name(std::string server_name)
14451 {
14452 server_name_ = server_name;
14453 return *this;
14454 }
14455
14457 self_t& bindaddr(std::string bindaddr)
14458 {
14459 bindaddr_ = bindaddr;
14460 return *this;
14461 }
14462
14464 std::string bindaddr()
14465 {
14466 return bindaddr_;
14467 }
14468
14470 self_t& multithreaded()
14471 {
14472 return concurrency(std::thread::hardware_concurrency());
14473 }
14474
14476 self_t& concurrency(std::uint16_t concurrency)
14477 {
14478 if (concurrency < 2) // Crow can have a minimum of 2 threads running
14479 concurrency = 2;
14480 concurrency_ = concurrency;
14481 return *this;
14482 }
14483
14485 std::uint16_t concurrency() const
14486 {
14487 return concurrency_;
14488 }
14489
14498 self_t& loglevel(LogLevel level)
14499 {
14500 crow::logger::setLogLevel(level);
14501 return *this;
14502 }
14503
14507 self_t& stream_threshold(size_t threshold)
14508 {
14509 res_stream_threshold_ = threshold;
14510 return *this;
14511 }
14512
14514 size_t& stream_threshold()
14515 {
14516 return res_stream_threshold_;
14517 }
14518
14519
14520 self_t& register_blueprint(Blueprint& blueprint)
14521 {
14522 router_.register_blueprint(blueprint);
14523 return *this;
14524 }
14525
14531 template<typename Func>
14532 self_t& exception_handler(Func&& f)
14533 {
14534 router_.exception_handler() = std::forward<Func>(f);
14535 return *this;
14536 }
14537
14538 std::function<void(crow::response&)>& exception_handler()
14539 {
14540 return router_.exception_handler();
14541 }
14542
14544 template<typename Duration, typename Func>
14545 self_t& tick(Duration d, Func f)
14546 {
14547 tick_interval_ = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>(d);
14548 tick_function_ = f;
14549 return *this;
14550 }
14551
14552#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
14553
14554 self_t& use_compression(compression::algorithm algorithm)
14555 {
14556 comp_algorithm_ = algorithm;
14557 compression_used_ = true;
14558 return *this;
14559 }
14560
14561 compression::algorithm compression_algorithm()
14562 {
14563 return comp_algorithm_;
14564 }
14565
14566 bool compression_used() const
14567 {
14568 return compression_used_;
14569 }
14570#endif
14571
14573 void add_blueprint()
14574 {
14575#if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__MACH__)
14576 if (router_.blueprints().empty()) return;
14577#endif
14578
14579 for (Blueprint* bp : router_.blueprints())
14580 {
14581 if (bp->static_dir().empty()) {
14582 CROW_LOG_ERROR << "Blueprint " << bp->prefix() << " and its sub-blueprints ignored due to empty static directory.";
14583 continue;
14584 }
14585 auto static_dir_ = crow::utility::normalize_path(bp->static_dir());
14586
14587 bp->new_rule_tagged<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)>(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)([static_dir_](crow::response& res, std::string file_path_partial) {
14588 utility::sanitize_filename(file_path_partial);
14589 res.set_static_file_info_unsafe(static_dir_ + file_path_partial);
14590 res.end();
14591 });
14592 }
14593
14594 router_.validate_bp();
14595 }
14596
14598 void add_static_dir()
14599 {
14600 if (are_static_routes_added()) return;
14601 auto static_dir_ = crow::utility::normalize_path(CROW_STATIC_DIRECTORY);
14602
14603 route<crow::black_magic::get_parameter_tag(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)>(CROW_STATIC_ENDPOINT)([static_dir_](crow::response& res, std::string file_path_partial) {
14604 utility::sanitize_filename(file_path_partial);
14605 res.set_static_file_info_unsafe(static_dir_ + file_path_partial);
14606 res.end();
14607 });
14608 set_static_routes_added();
14609 }
14610
14612 void validate()
14613 {
14614 router_.validate();
14615 }
14616
14618 void run()
14619 {
14620#ifndef CROW_DISABLE_STATIC_DIR
14621 add_blueprint();
14622 add_static_dir();
14623#endif
14624 validate();
14625
14626 error_code ec;
14627 asio::ip::address addr = asio::ip::make_address(bindaddr_,ec);
14628 if (ec){
14629 CROW_LOG_ERROR << ec.message() << " - Can not create valid ip address from string: \"" << bindaddr_ << "\"";
14630 return;
14631 }
14632 tcp::endpoint endpoint(addr, port_);
14633#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14634 if (ssl_used_)
14635 {
14636 router_.using_ssl = true;
14637 ssl_server_ = std::move(std::unique_ptr<ssl_server_t>(new ssl_server_t(this, endpoint, server_name_, &middlewares_, concurrency_, timeout_, &ssl_context_)));
14638 ssl_server_->set_tick_function(tick_interval_, tick_function_);
14639 ssl_server_->signal_clear();
14640 for (auto snum : signals_)
14641 {
14642 ssl_server_->signal_add(snum);
14643 }
14644 notify_server_start();
14645 ssl_server_->run();
14646 }
14647 else
14648#endif
14649 {
14650 server_ = std::move(std::unique_ptr<server_t>(new server_t(this, endpoint, server_name_, &middlewares_, concurrency_, timeout_, nullptr)));
14651 server_->set_tick_function(tick_interval_, tick_function_);
14652 for (auto snum : signals_)
14653 {
14654 server_->signal_add(snum);
14655 }
14656 notify_server_start();
14657 server_->run();
14658 }
14659 }
14660
14665 std::future<void> run_async()
14666 {
14667 return std::async(std::launch::async, [&] {
14668 this->run();
14669 });
14670 }
14671
14673 void stop()
14674 {
14675#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14676 if (ssl_used_)
14677 {
14678 if (ssl_server_) { ssl_server_->stop(); }
14679 }
14680 else
14681#endif
14682 {
14683 // TODO(EDev): Move these 6 lines to a method in http_server.
14684 std::vector<crow::websocket::connection*> websockets_to_close = websockets_;
14685 for (auto websocket : websockets_to_close)
14686 {
14687 CROW_LOG_INFO << "Quitting Websocket: " << websocket;
14688 websocket->close("Server Application Terminated");
14689 }
14690 if (server_) { server_->stop(); }
14691 }
14692 }
14693
14694 void add_websocket(crow::websocket::connection* conn)
14695 {
14696 websockets_.push_back(conn);
14697 }
14698
14699 void remove_websocket(crow::websocket::connection* conn)
14700 {
14701 websockets_.erase(std::remove(websockets_.begin(), websockets_.end(), conn), websockets_.end());
14702 }
14703
14705 void debug_print()
14706 {
14707 CROW_LOG_DEBUG << "Routing:";
14708 router_.debug_print();
14709 }
14710
14711
14712#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14713
14715 self_t& ssl_file(const std::string& crt_filename, const std::string& key_filename)
14716 {
14717 ssl_used_ = true;
14718 ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_peer);
14719 ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_client_once);
14720 ssl_context_.use_certificate_file(crt_filename, ssl_context_t::pem);
14721 ssl_context_.use_private_key_file(key_filename, ssl_context_t::pem);
14722 ssl_context_.set_options(
14723 asio::ssl::context::default_workarounds | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv2 | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv3);
14724 return *this;
14725 }
14726
14728 self_t& ssl_file(const std::string& pem_filename)
14729 {
14730 ssl_used_ = true;
14731 ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_peer);
14732 ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_client_once);
14733 ssl_context_.load_verify_file(pem_filename);
14734 ssl_context_.set_options(
14735 asio::ssl::context::default_workarounds | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv2 | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv3);
14736 return *this;
14737 }
14738
14740 self_t& ssl_chainfile(const std::string& crt_filename, const std::string& key_filename)
14741 {
14742 ssl_used_ = true;
14743 ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_peer);
14744 ssl_context_.set_verify_mode(asio::ssl::verify_client_once);
14745 ssl_context_.use_certificate_chain_file(crt_filename);
14746 ssl_context_.use_private_key_file(key_filename, ssl_context_t::pem);
14747 ssl_context_.set_options(
14748 asio::ssl::context::default_workarounds | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv2 | asio::ssl::context::no_sslv3);
14749 return *this;
14750 }
14751
14752 self_t& ssl(asio::ssl::context&& ctx)
14753 {
14754 ssl_used_ = true;
14755 ssl_context_ = std::move(ctx);
14756 return *this;
14757 }
14758
14759 bool ssl_used() const
14760 {
14761 return ssl_used_;
14762 }
14763#else
14764
14765 template<typename T, typename... Remain>
14766 self_t& ssl_file(T&&, Remain&&...)
14767 {
14768 // We can't call .ssl() member function unless CROW_ENABLE_SSL is defined.
14769 static_assert(
14770 // make static_assert dependent to T; always false
14771 std::is_base_of<T, void>::value,
14772 "Define CROW_ENABLE_SSL to enable ssl support.");
14773 return *this;
14774 }
14775
14776 template<typename T, typename... Remain>
14777 self_t& ssl_chainfile(T&&, Remain&&...)
14778 {
14779 // We can't call .ssl() member function unless CROW_ENABLE_SSL is defined.
14780 static_assert(
14781 // make static_assert dependent to T; always false
14782 std::is_base_of<T, void>::value,
14783 "Define CROW_ENABLE_SSL to enable ssl support.");
14784 return *this;
14785 }
14786
14787 template<typename T>
14788 self_t& ssl(T&&)
14789 {
14790 // We can't call .ssl() member function unless CROW_ENABLE_SSL is defined.
14791 static_assert(
14792 // make static_assert dependent to T; always false
14793 std::is_base_of<T, void>::value,
14794 "Define CROW_ENABLE_SSL to enable ssl support.");
14795 return *this;
14796 }
14797
14798 bool ssl_used() const
14799 {
14800 return false;
14801 }
14802#endif
14803
14804 // middleware
14805 using context_t = detail::context<Middlewares...>;
14806 using mw_container_t = std::tuple<Middlewares...>;
14807 template<typename T>
14808 typename T::context& get_context(const request& req)
14809 {
14810 static_assert(black_magic::contains<T, Middlewares...>::value, "App doesn't have the specified middleware type.");
14811 auto& ctx = *reinterpret_cast<context_t*>(req.middleware_context);
14812 return ctx.template get<T>();
14813 }
14814
14815 template<typename T>
14816 T& get_middleware()
14817 {
14818 return utility::get_element_by_type<T, Middlewares...>(middlewares_);
14819 }
14820
14822 std::cv_status wait_for_server_start(std::chrono::milliseconds wait_timeout = std::chrono::milliseconds(3000))
14823 {
14824 std::cv_status status = std::cv_status::no_timeout;
14825 auto wait_until = std::chrono::steady_clock::now() + wait_timeout;
14826 {
14827 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
14828 while (!server_started_ && (status == std::cv_status::no_timeout))
14829 {
14830 status = cv_started_.wait_until(lock, wait_until);
14831 }
14832 }
14833
14834 if (status == std::cv_status::no_timeout)
14835 {
14836 if (server_)
14837 {
14838 status = server_->wait_for_start(wait_until);
14839 }
14840#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14841 else if (ssl_server_)
14842 {
14843 status = ssl_server_->wait_for_start(wait_until);
14844 }
14845#endif
14846 }
14847 return status;
14848 }
14849
14850 private:
14851 template<typename... Ts>
14852 std::tuple<Middlewares...> make_middleware_tuple(Ts&&... ts)
14853 {
14854 auto fwd = std::forward_as_tuple((ts)...);
14855 return std::make_tuple(
14856 std::forward<Middlewares>(
14857 black_magic::tuple_extract<Middlewares, decltype(fwd)>(fwd))...);
14858 }
14859
14861 void notify_server_start()
14862 {
14863 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(start_mutex_);
14864 server_started_ = true;
14865 cv_started_.notify_all();
14866 }
14867
14868 void set_static_routes_added() {
14869 static_routes_added_ = true;
14870 }
14871
14872 bool are_static_routes_added() {
14873 return static_routes_added_;
14874 }
14875
14876 private:
14877 std::uint8_t timeout_{5};
14878 uint16_t port_ = 80;
14879 uint16_t concurrency_ = 2;
14880 uint64_t max_payload_{UINT64_MAX};
14881 std::string server_name_ = std::string("Crow/") + VERSION;
14882 std::string bindaddr_ = "0.0.0.0";
14883 size_t res_stream_threshold_ = 1048576;
14884 Router router_;
14885 bool static_routes_added_{false};
14886
14887#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_COMPRESSION
14888 compression::algorithm comp_algorithm_;
14889 bool compression_used_{false};
14890#endif
14891
14892 std::chrono::milliseconds tick_interval_;
14893 std::function<void()> tick_function_;
14894
14895 std::tuple<Middlewares...> middlewares_;
14896
14897#ifdef CROW_ENABLE_SSL
14898 std::unique_ptr<ssl_server_t> ssl_server_;
14899 bool ssl_used_{false};
14900 ssl_context_t ssl_context_{asio::ssl::context::sslv23};
14901#endif
14902
14903 std::unique_ptr<server_t> server_;
14904
14905 std::vector<int> signals_{SIGINT, SIGTERM};
14906
14907 bool server_started_{false};
14908 std::condition_variable cv_started_;
14909 std::mutex start_mutex_;
14910 std::vector<crow::websocket::connection*> websockets_;
14911 };
14912
14915 template<typename... Middlewares>
14916 using App = Crow<Middlewares...>;
14917
14920 using SimpleApp = Crow<>;
14921} // namespace crow
